review: This is going to sound like a negative review it's actually an incredibly fun (albeit frustrating) game and I've had some of the best video game moments with PUBG. I would recommend it purely based on fun factor That said there's a *lot* wrong with this game most of which can be fixed (and hopefully will).Performance has improved a lot over the last few patches but it's still horrendous. It's especially bad when a lot of things are going on (at the beginning of the game when items/things are still spawning for example.) Server wide lockups (where everyone is frozen in place for several seconds) have become very common. Framerate drops are insane I can go from 100 fps down to 30 for no reason. Again greatly improved over a few months ago but still very noticeable.Optimization is... really bad. I have a Ryzen 1700 and 1080TI frame rates are anywhere between 30 and 100 on medium low settings. Two things that are interesting 1) friends that own the game with lower end computers get around the same performance that I do and b) my CPU(any/all cores)/GPU utilization runs around 40 50% even during framerate drops. The game itself will not use the computing power available to it. This is expecially odd since this game looks horrendous even on maximum settings. This is an Unreal Engine game and it looks like it was made in 2008. I don't care about graphics much but I have certain expectations for a performance/eye candy ratio. I mean Crysis looks better than this game and it's smooth as butter. Again this to me is a sign of server issues. Whether the code is just bad or the servers are underpowered I couldn't tell you.This is technically an early access game so this isn't bad just... interesting while core things are poorly implemented (controls are the worst I've ever seen no vaulting yet shooting out of windows is frustrating af the comically broken driving system etc.) other things are very well polished (the delay between seeing something in the distance and hearing it independent suspension on buggy's etc.) It reminds me of when a software team hires an intern and just says "make something cool" so they work on their own little project outside of the core planned development cycle. It's not "bad" that these nice pieces exist just odd that they worked on them now instead of the core game.There is absolutely no way they can release this game on time. They've already extended the official release date to the end of the year but that isn't NEARLY enough time to complete this game. I am fine with that I bought the game Early Access and am fully aware of the 1+ years of development this game will take. But it's deceptive to have put a 6 month timeline out to begin with. The game's features aren't even completed (extra maps being a big one) that's not to mention the plethora of controller fixes driving fixes items custom modes environments (fog etc.) modding support and the two biggest doozies of all performance and bugs (looooooots of bugs I find a new one almost every game). I bought the game as is and will happily wait for however long it takes to complete but don't lie about your timeline. Cheating in this game isn't that common in the grand scheme of video games. Some reports show fewer cheaters than most other games. The problem is in a game of 100 people it only takes one cheater to completely ruin the game. Even if only 1 in 500 people playing PUBG are cheating that means that on average 1 in 5 games will end with you getting headshotted through the bushes from 2km away. It's also really hard to see when someone is cheating since poor performance looks a lot like cheating most of the time and there's no kill cam for obvious multiplayer reasons. But I have run into a few instances where there is absolutely no denying someone was cheating (if 3/4 of the map is dead after the first circle shrink someone's probably cheating). It really sucks and discourages play.While this doesn't affect me or my wallet I think introducing micro transations in an early access game is immoral. Maybe if the team was struggling to make ends meet before the release I would understand it but this game has made millions in just early access. It's one of the most popular games on PC right now the development time should be spent fixing performance issues not milking players for more money. Add to that Greene said he would not add microtransactions in early access it's just a bad move. Add to some of the other things Greene has said in done (especially in regards to banning/punishing players for strange things) I just find him to be erratic.The community is horrible. Like worse than Rust horrible. You can't play with all chat on or you'll just hear people screaming into their mics sometimes racial slurs sometimes just unintelligable ape noises. Teaming up with randoms is a 50/50 chance you're going to get a stoner or a team killer. This is not a game you play with other people unless you know them. This isn't too big of a deal since it isn't an especially social game (if you're playing with friends) but still... get ahold of yourselves people. This isn't /b/.Lastly something I've alluded to a few times but deserves a special mention the controls. I can overlook the performance bugs microtransactions etc. but I just cannot overlook the controls. I haven't a clue who picked the default keyboard layout for this game but that person needs some medication. But even if you re map it everything is like moving through mud. The mouse delay is horrible (most likely do to framerate issues and not being able to lock your framerate) the shooting is improved but still very unresponsive jumping onto anything is a suicide inducing and just walking feels bad in an indescribable clunky way.So the tl dr is If you want to play something quickly and casually this is not the game for you. It's 98% tedius item collection/running/driving/hiding 1% dying under unforeseen and questionable circumstances and 1% heart pounding terror. But I remember my first chicken dinner and it was the first time a game made me feel like I was going to die from heart failure. For that alone I think it's worth the money.

review: Product received for free. I definately got my moneys worth out of this title but then again I spent probably 10'000 hours playing league of legends and never had to pay a cent.I feel like the Developers professional ambitions have got in the way of what really matters here. It's not the best looking game out there but certainly performs as if it should be. For me having a 7700K and 1080SLI setup and still having to play with most settings on very low to maintain over 100fps is dissapointing And I have not really noticed any remarkable performance improvements since it was first released to steam.The detail in the games environment gives the illusion of value but upon closer inspection is actually just the same recycled assets scattered about the place with some minor variations and in some cases no variation whatsoever.The hit registry and netcode would have to be my biggest gripe close quarter combat feels like a dice roll at the best of times and mele combat feels completely redundant especially in the opening minutes of the round.Long range open terrain combat is fun as is traversing the map with friends the game does a great job of capturing a realistic feeling of helplessness and tention.I can definately recommend this game as a good alternative multiplayer fix to the standard format of shooters that are out there currently. But not for more than $25 $30 unless you plan to commit to it which is hard to do when its so demanding and unpolished. Great fun for the first hubdred hours as you learn the game but once the novelty wears off frustrations arise as frequently as excitement.

review: Worst Time In A Game Warning! This is just my personal Post *I said yes to recommend but you'll understand at the end*Like the title states this is the worst time I have ever spent TRYING to even play a game. Yes I understand that this game is still in development and will crash or not respond But so frequently?? Why?? No but seriously this game just will not let me play. The furthest I have ever gotten into a match was jumping out of the plane and then the game crashed which is saying a lot. Every other time the game will crash in the menu or right when I find a lobby. So in all honesty I do not recommend this game as of now. Still though the developer is working very hard on this game and they deserve all the support that they can get. It may not work for me but it might work for you. Still try it out and support the development! If you don't like it or you have the same problems then just wait a while for the devlopment of the game to get a bit better.Anyway enjoy the game!

But I like the visuals and overall seriousness of the game except from the absolutely not fitting clownish outfits and PP like the "We live in a society" boi or the streamer stuff.If they fix the bugs I will recommend it.

review: This game feels incredibly good. I review my death cam a lot and I find obvious hackers a lot but even when I do the game leading up to that death felt good.In PUBG you always feel like anything can happen. It's a big game with a lot of variables and a lot of very good design choices that may not be well optomized but which do make the game very fun to play. This game is not competative in the sense that it is a balenced contest where you compete on an even playing field to be the best. If it's going to bother you that you lose because you dropped and only found a pistol or you lagged and started shooting late or because someone happened to be watching the corner you came around from a mile away you're going to be bothered.

review: A friend bought me this game for Christmas so we can play it together. So I tried. I checked that days stats and it was amazing 1 million players. I have no idea why. The game looks old graphics is very average and the whole adventure is boring as hell. You jump from a plane on and island. You search for weapons and gear and get shot. Or maybe shoot someone. And that's it. Most of the time you just search for stuff. The players look childish and not military at all. Some gear is just idiotic and the whole process is very boring. And the firefight looks very amateur. The dynamics is very low. There is no rush maybe some stress. I mean for the love of God don't waste your time on this stupid game. Go play something better.

review: Everybody complaining about microtransactions are just whining about nothing. Yeah every gamer including myself hates microtransactions but the difference here is they are not pay to win. And that is a big difference they are just cosmetic which who gives a what your character is wearing during battle. I sure as hell don't. All I care about is that the game is fun to play. Now if this developer made the microtransactions pay to win then there is a huge problem but I doubt he will. You're not being forced to buy the damned boxes they're just there for people who enjoy making their character look how they want it to look. This game is incredibly fun and addicting as hell. Every time you die you say to yourself "Ok next game I'll definitely win" and you start it up again. It's like going to the casino lol you just keep on playing "one more." I recommend it 100%. And people stop complaining about something so small and rate the game for the actual core game not the microtransactions. Don't play the game for like 100 hours and have all this fun with it and give it a bad rating just cause of that. You're not forced to buy those pesky boxes you'll have fun without it. Now if we wanna vote with our wallets against those pesky boxes just nobody buy the boxes they'll see it's not making money and they'll take them off.

Instead of adopting new things into the game the developers should focus on fixing current issues such as latency issues are still a thing too few servers(enemies bugging around/being much quicker or items not spawning for me but for them)(ADD MORE SERVERS) the camera often is often buggy and moves into random directions(recently with pressing the F key the camera just pops straight forward is this supposed to be of any use?) texture issues(random bumps on the surfaces that make vehicles fall over whilst not being visible) cheaters still have an easy way through(aim bot no recoil etc)These would be the main issues that would really matter since they ruin the game experience not to mention dying due to these problems and not actually the lack of my skills.Less new added stuff more fixing the problems that remained since the beginning. Please and thank you.

review: While i would agree with many that the game has only gotten worse since the release of 1.0 the game doesn't deserve as much hate as it gets now. The game was alot simplier and overall just more fun with far less issues in beta which is where most of my hours come from. I would prefer to go back to beta so that there isn't the feeling of a company so desperate to squeeze every bit of money out of this game as they could. (They promised never to add microtransactions which they did. They also added items which are only unlocked for a set amount of time before being revoked.) I play in the EU and almost never encounter any cheaters but i can't speak for asian or NA players who apparently regularly encounter chinese hackers. However as i stated at the beginning the game does not deserve as much hate as it currently gets. The optimization is far better than it ever has been (i have a mid spec pc and can run this on high/ultra at 100fps+) They have improved the UI and added alot of QOL features which can be toggled on/off. They massively fixed the dsync that everyone constantly complained about (for the most part you still get the odd instance but it is rare now.) I also more or less never experience any game crashes now either which used to/still is problem for some although saying that it isn't anywhere near as bad as it used to be. The overall feeling of the game is that it's good feels fun to play is quite smooth and entertaining especially with a group of friends. But there is always the underlying feeling of a company that just doesn't care about the community as they ignore/put off fixing the main issues of the game as they would rather add new weapon/player cosmetics. And as i stated some of these expire once aquired. You can't help but feel dissapointed in PUBG especially as someone who put so much time into the beta. I played it when it was incredibly unoptimized experienced frequent crashes put up with countless numbers of bugs. Each new update greatly improved the game and pubg's number rised. I thought it was going to be one of the most popular games on steam for quite a long time. Until the release of 1.0 and ever since then i just continued to lose faith in bluehole. I would reccommend trying it out again if you played it before but decided to take a break. However as for purchasing i'm not entirely sure. I think you should make your own mind up.TL DR It's still a fun game especially with a group of friends not as bad as almost everyone claims and is far more polished than it was in beta. But as with everything still has it's problems.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Since i am a gamer that plays multiple hours a game (Get as much juice from it) i will say this.Yes pubg is fun. Is it as good as i expected ? Yes and no.I will just cut to the chase.PROS.1.Really fun.Yes that is the most important.Cause after all it is a GAME.2.The physics are really good.There are some cons with it but will go through the cons later.3.You find a game extremely fast.4.The game brings satisfaction when you win.(DUH)5.I get the feeling of an old game called SWAT (if someone remembers that you will understand).I say this cause you will actually have to put your mind into how you will go into a house with multiple enemies.The game is not just mindless shooting.If you do not have a strategic mind you will lose.A LOT.6.ADDICTING AS .7.You don't feel punished by dying.Simply queue for another one.CONS.1.The graphics are a bit underwhelming. For a game that is priced 30 bucks it does not look that good.We have 2017.I have a good system but i still feel like the graphics go really hard on it with mediocre result.Just no.2.The foliage setting is just stupid.You can have lower res foliage but they should stay there.It can add more into the hiding factor.3.Opening/closing doors sometimes can be irritating.Those who play will understand.4.I feel like my character is a bit slow on his actions sometimes.5.One map.6.Players camping at the outskirts of the blue cyrcle.I don't know if this can be fixed by forcing players to actually move.7.Make the blue cyrcle and the red one more punishing for staying outside/inside them.When i see that i am standing in the red zone i am like yeah. I have a lot of time to loot heal reload check for enemies then gtfo.Make the whole area EXPLODE. Then i would have a motive to actually leave EVERYTHING that i am doing atm and get my outta there.Overall conclusion.Really fun game.Is it worth 30 bucks? Hell no. You can buy games way cheaper and WAY better.But it has the potential to be one of the best games ever made.Even though the game has a lot of negatives they dont surpass the positive ones cause it is soooo fun to play.I do not have many hours in it but i feel like i am already hooked on it.I know the devs are working on a continuous basis on the game it still needs a lot more to be great.Cause it can be one of the best or even the best online game.Make it feel smoother when i play. No i do not want to play a doom style game.But i dont want a slow charactter that while he reloads and he opens the door the reload gets completely canceled even though i have loaded 2 rounds in my shotgun.Those simple things.The game is really really addicting so be carefull boys.

review: I've been playing this game for a while I remember when it was the biggest game on steam but i'm sad to say the players have lost too much hope you can look on the "fix PUBG" forms and see that everyone says that they had their chance and also trying to give them other things to do. This game has had a luxury life they've had more money and fame than MANY other games out there. And still they can't fix basic issues fortnite on the other hand is run by a very hard working company and I know some people don't like the gameplay of fortnite. But the devs did everything right that PUBG did wrong. Weapons are reworked daily. desync and hit regestration is nearly perfect and fixed content ( Is not super op (QBZ) and is also usable). I still suffer from alpha bugs today the plane "jumps" halfway across the island then zips back making jumping at the right time much harder than it should be. I can't pickup weapons for almost 10 seconds because of desync. I lag forward and backwards making gun fights impossible to fight. I also see many negetive reviews that make VERY good points are found helpful by 100+ people. All in all it's cute to see PUBG on their knees begging for us to come back because while they were rich they were busy trying to get richer (trying to sue fortnite constant release of crates and payed skins) all they had to do was listen and fix bugs that should not have made it past beta. All I know is that anything else this company releases will have a VERY hard time becoming popular and trust worthy.

review: Played about 30hrs in the BETA. I loved this game. Perfect mix between ARMA and H1Z1. Way more guns and equipment. I love the ability to customize with my opticals and grips etc. It's a lot slower than H1 so if that's not your thing I don't think you'll like this game. This game isn't focusing on skins which is nice too. It's updating constantly and working on optimization updates from what I've heard. This game still has a way to go though but I think that the devs really do give a and are working hard to fix any issues. 8.5/10 would recommend

review: I absolutely reccomend this game. I have had more fun and challenging addictive gameplay with this title than any in quite some time.That being said let's dive into the "controversial" topic of the "micro transaction" and "cash cow" business people are freaking the f**k out about for some reason.Micro transactions that are purely cosmetic and related to a charity and tournament to promote the game and increase its popularity and legitimacy as an E Sports title are completely irrelevent. I understand that people are upset because the developers "went back on a promise" but seriously suck it the f**k up. The gameplay and content involved outweighs the hurt feelings of supposedly being lied to.The truth is that the boxes that were free are still free and the boxes that cost money to open are charity/tournament boxes and just have exclusive "event" type cosmetic skins. It's literally of no consequence.Bascially all I am saying is sack the f***k up and go play the game stop crying about the lame skins that 90% of us don't even wear everyone in the game drops in damn near nude anyway.

review: After 5 hours of play.This game is incredibly tense but in an enjoyable way. The "Island" is so vast and yet some one always manages to find you and it is that which keeps you on your toes. I don't usually go in for FPS games and it isn't like most other FPS games I have played. It is a very "dark" and "bleak" experience of being thrown out of a plane and herded around to bring each mach to a close. There is no explanation for what is happening and I don't care I really like the abruptness of it all. It is a really brutal and desperate struggle instead of a over powered gung ho bloodbath.I really enjoy the "idea" behind the game and it was really well implemented. I look forward to playing it more.

review: Player unknown is a fun game that you can spend hours playing and not even realise it. Having only 3 games and one large map sounds like there is not much content but the map itself is huge and each game theres somthing different. Despite what the game is the current state is kinda rough on PCs. Frame rate drops are a common issue with top of the line PCs. Servers are not always stable. The inventory system / looting can be buggy at times. One huge issue i had with the game was looting. I would ho into an appartment and found several rooms with just clothes. LIKE HOW AM I SUPPOSE TO KILL SOMEONE WITH A WHITE T SHIRT!!!But at the end of the day this is what i end up playing despite the issues.

review: People hate on this game for the sake of hating. Its a fun game with a lot of depth and strategy to it if you plan on winning games. It can also be very stressful due to you not knowing where people are or the fact that you could get shot at from any where from close to far range at any given time you always have to be moving and on your feet. For the people complaining about server issues hackers and the likes I've probably played around 300 500 games and I've only experienced to my knowledge maybe 4 games where i have lagged out/DC'd or had a 'jumpy' game and i dont even have that great of a pc or internet. And the deal with hackers I've been playing this game for a year now so I've been through all the hate Bluehole has gotten over "hackers in every game" "region lock china" etc YET and I'm 100% serious when saying that I've only ever died or have witnessed someone die to a hacker in a single one of my games. In almost 200 hours. Either I'm lucky or people just like to complain over the one time they died illegimately just because. Either way if you're in to multiplayer shooters and/or survival games I wholeheartedly recommend this game theres a reason it's my most played on steam.

review: I've clocked in around about 250 hours ont he game now and I /mostly/ recommend this game. It's an addictive game where once you get past what seems like a steep learning curve you can't stop. Playing this game with friends is where a lot more of the fun is fighting together as a squad and mowing down opponents that dare come across your path. But like every single game out there this Battlegrounds is not without it's flaws and there are many.In a rough sketch servers are a constant issue when it comes to desync and jitter. The game is very demanding for your fps where having a GTX 960 like myself will average you around 40 frames. That's not ideal but you can work with it. The game seems littered with people cheating where sometimes you can run into a player breaking ToS every 3 games. However all huge games have the capacity for large amounts of cheaters and PUBG is no exception. The cheating situation seems to be mostly under control however. There are a lot of Asian players populating the other servers (Which might I add is where a majority of the cheaters come from) and it's great to see them playing and enjoying themselves but it's rough when they seem to kill you through walls from the ping. The sound of the plane beginning is like the devil molesting your ears and rain in this game is similar but toned down a couple inches. Don't get me started on optimisation either.Other issues I can mention but honestly if you immerse yourself in destroying any players in your path you can mostly ignore this. I find this game hugely fun even when I've died and I'm watching my teammates either hand out L's or get their beat. Getting headshots in this game is so rewarding and even the average kill is pleasurable. Being in the final moments of a round gets your heart pumping more than a hot pair of blond twins wanting to take you back to their place. (Preference of course.)I sincerely hope the full release of this game can remedy some of the issues that plague this game and bring it back up to it's potential as the best Battle Royale game of all time. It's certainly fun to play watch and especially win. The market of items for this game is also likely to be huge if it isn't already.I give this game a 7/10 overall.

review: Hard to say much negative about this game really. It was made for the right reasons with the right crew with the right background and it has all the pedigree of being a small classic in the genre. Which is fitting being made by the guy who 'invented' Battle Royale/King of the Hill in the Arma Mods. Only real negative thing in my book is the vanilla solo mode. Its just TOO random TOO often who wins I find. Some might like that though because it gives the lesser skilled players a small chance of getting that juicy chicken dinner on rare occasions. But yeah I like being rewarded for skills not luck. But other than that this game is rad af. And the main Dev is aiming for a full mod platform. Who knows.... Might surpass DayZ in a few months already lol. I say Hell YEah! Have at it Modders! (updated review)After being loyal to the development the game itself and hanging tough with it for a long time now I lost interest in it entirely. Im now of the mind that this game still has awesome potential as a spectator game. I enjoy watching other people play it more than I like playing it really. ANd thats the main reason I dont recommend it anymore really. Too many promises werent delivered too much RNG (randomness) in the game (its a competitive tactical shooter. Nothing tactical about getting a mortar shell in the face after you played perfectly for 20 min afaik). Its become a cash titan. And as such the developers cater to markets and elements that shouldnt be the main reason for development. Like E sports data miners skin traders etc. And at this point the only thing that might get me back to playing it wil be when the modders get access to the code. If that happens it MIGHT still become an epic game. But as it stands now its not worth it for casual gamers. Other games does that better with faster patching &amp better coding. Ill cross my fingers for the modders for this one. Till then meh.

review: Fantastic game.It's easily the best Survival Battleroyal game there is I'm not sure you can call it a survival game on it's own like Dayz so think the comparrisment is unfair. Dayz is a much slower experience which you play for the long game while Battlegrounds you are forced into other players making the experienced heart pumping action based.The game price originally put me off but watching the youtube videos pop up and having a friend buy me the game after playing for 30+ hours the content here is worth the money.Early access this puts many people off it never has for me IF! They relase the first version with a lot of content PUBG delievers a lot of weapons every single building can be entered (as it should) contains a huge map has multiple options from single duo or 3 4 player teams as well as custom games which I believein the future will allow gamers to buy hosted servers so they can define their own playing experience. Because I play duo I can't play customs games YET I hope they sort this out in the near future.Graphics are good but I wouldn't say well optimised the gritty easten EU enviroment has a depressing tone but you'll be hard pressed to enjoy the view while you constantly have eyes on every tree waiting for an enemy to jump out.What really makes this game for me is player spotting being able to use the compass to spot players locations and communicating them to a friend this is how it should be done no artifical orange spot on the hud displaying enemy location just verbal communication which can causes arguments )The game is actually being updated frequently which surprised me we've all heard promises during EA few rarely delievered. The updates consist of new guns and heavy gameplay tweaks to balance the game what's being impressive is that there hasn't been an update that's unbalanced the game or a gun that you needed to own to win the game it's really well balanced and each weapon has a situation where it can win you the fight.I hope in the future they offer search features for servers for example I'd like to play in a server where it's more slow paced so the white circle moves every 5 mins or 10mins games would last longer than an hour. No many peoples idea of fun I know but it would make winning that more satisfying.One last thing the lag I'd say for a server with 100 people the lag is very little either great predictive lag code or decent servers who knows? But far from perfect it's certainly better than any other game with near 100 players in.

I was praying for the 1.0 release to have fixed all the games issues but no every single game I join returns a Bad Service Version error with now a NEW ERROR saying " EX HTTPREQUEST " since after the update. I have follow numerous methods that supposedly fixes these but non have worked. After this long 12GB update and leaving early access one would think that these issues would have been solved. considering that it's been ongoing for months.This is what happens when a game is concieved planned designed developed released and played by millions within a year. Guys please please please fix these issues. And PLEASE add a South African Server Huge fan base here sitting on 200+ Latencies.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Incredible. I see myself pumping plenty of hours into this.And it's only going to get better PUBG Corp have a long term strategy in place for this game not unlike TF2 in termes of longevity.The learning curve is steep however there are plentiful resources to be found online despite claims the community is highly toxic the amount of support tutorials help and education about the systems in play on the likes of youtube reddit wikis etc are exaustively comprehensive.It's exhilerating most of the time however it's also infuriating at times. Looting for a solid 10 to 15 minutes only to be shot to bits in a 3 second firefight sucks but this is what it's all about PREPARATION.Sure you can get frustrated and throw your headset off in disgust when you get killed unfairly but then go back and check out your gameplay on the extremely slick replay system and realise that YOU were infact in the wrong.How you approach the map is entirely up to you each game but each frustrating death each exclamation of OMFG HAX each choke in the top 10 is a learning experience. You get better for next time check your corners more carefully plan a more strategic advance as opposed to crying foul because you were shot sprinting across an open field chasing the circle.Of course shooting straight helps too. )Buy it. Experience it. Missing real tension and an OH CRAP OH CRAP OH CRAP experience in a video game when you come under fire like I was for the first time?Buy this game. PUBG is and becomes life.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Cons &gt Desync. The servers are weak a lot of hits will not register bigger ping more advantages because others won't be able to hit you so well.&gt Maybe not a bad thing but they abandoned the free to open crates idea pretty quick. Now you need the classic 2 euro key.&gt Fixes and optimizations comes pretty slow.&gt No map selector. You are forced to play on the new map who is 100% walking simulator and shooting from one hill to another.Pros &gt Community is pretty diverse. You will encounter both adults who will swallow their microphones when you kill them and produce strange sounds and kids who will swallow their microphones when you kill them and produce strange sounds.&gt The game is full of skilled marksmen. For examples there will be situations when you will be shot from 5 km with a shotgun by a pro player called chingchang997456&gt The gameplay is full of unexpected situation like cars who can knock down fences being blocked by a plastic chair in the middle of the street.&gt The game is a part of E sports. Just check what team is the best at using medical in the electric field who doesn't do too much anyway.&gt A lot of weapons even if most of them are broken and you will see players carrying one of the 5 actually working guns. Why to shoot someone 10 times with a pistol when you can easly shoot him 1 time with an AK because is ing normal in a survival game to outstand 10 pistol shots.

review: I really liked the game when it got released first. But after playing it for several month i start getting tired of the game and get angry every time im playing it. I m aware of the fact that the game is still an alpha but after several month online there should be at least some improvements. Cause there are too many bugs in the game to be noticed here i will just write down the bugs that me off most and are known since month and not fixed.1. Server performance and lags. In 1 of 3 rounds im pretty sure lags are the reason for my death and not the skill level of the enemy. You hit enemys 10 times close range... no death. Headshot on enemy with no helmet...he survives with blood in his face. Shotgun close range at the beginning of the round...no death. Being like 3 seconds behind the tree and get hits after hiding again...Shooting straight trough enemys without hit detection. Enemys getting hit but no damage calculated and so on.... Its really annoying. I dont have a problem with dying to good enemys but lags are just 2. Server crashes. Playing like 20 minutes only 15 enemys remaining... host closed connection... thank you for nothing3. Armor bugs. Not sure whether everyone got that. Lets give an example. I have lvl 3 helmet and lvl 3 armor. Im at full health. I get shot from a building and get 3 hits of an m16a4 and im down. After my friend revived me im looking at my armor. No dmg at all on my chest or my head. From dmg system i can not be dead from 3 hits in my arm so in my opinion sometimes game doesnt calculate your armor and its like beeing naked....Pretty sad performance here cause this issues are in the game since day one. The bring in new weapons and new crates you can open for money like in cs go but they are not willing to improve their server performance....

review: This is a very very very close to being negative review. The game is fun when luck is on your side but be prepared to be completely screwed over by the RNG more often than not.The game map is enormous but it might as well not be because the large map serves to hurt you more than help you about 50% of the time. Depending on where you drop into you may find yourself having to run miles (or drive if you're lucky and find a vehicle) just to get back into the playing area once it's determined only to finally reach it and have it shrink again to be even further away. This will happen in 33% or more of your games.The only times I ever die for the most part are when I'm on the move. Advantage here goes to the guy with good position who just happened to drop into the area where the game decides to take place. This should be remedied by the play area being visible before you drop from the plane causing a risk vs reward decision to come into play INSTEAD of RNG deciding who does well and who doesn't.RNG also can be stingy with weapon drops. You can sometimes search 3 houses and find great weapon attachments but no weapons. It happens more often than it probably should in a game that's about shooting people why be so stingy with the guns?I haven't encountered that many bugs only one crash and no cheaters to my knowledge.As for the loot crate thing? Honestly who cares? It's cosmetic completely optional and 100% not in your face. No big deal.This review sounds negative but when the game is fun and RNG isn't sticking it to you too badly the game is very worth playing. Hopefully they sort these things out because for the most part this plays very well.If the devs want to see this played at any sort of competitive level though the RNG t needs to change.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Great game great experience still having issues at times but you should definitely buy it if you enjoy playing games like H1Z1 Just Survive or Arma 3 Battleroyale.One important thing don't take in consideration the bad reviews about microtransaction. Both the community and the devs got to benefit from it. People are crying about a lot of things and I bet that most of the owners that have given this game a bad review actually got themselves some money back from it through the microtransaction system. With this method of getting the crates ( you have to play to get some in game currency so you can buy those crates and then sell them or open them the choice is yours ) it encourages players to get better at it but to not camp. If you end on the 26th but without kills you'll be awarded with less points than if would end on the 70th place after you've killed 3 players.TL DR The game is good. Buy it and enjoy it. If your system is not that great you might want to check some gameplays of this with those specs so you can make sure that your computer will be able to run it. I'm playing it on a GTX 970 and i7 4790K ( 8 GB of RAM ) and I can run it above 60 FPS only if I set most of its settings to medium/low/very low.Pros It's a really good game gunfight is great. The wider variety of guns ( compared to H1Z1 ) and gun attachments make it a superior game ( again compared to H1Z1 ) Armor actually gives you some protection. A level 3 helmet protects you from a couple of shots ( while in H1Z1 2 headshots with a helmet on meant that you were dead )Cons The game still needs a lot of work ( especially optimisation ). There are times in which the buildings don't load entirely ( for me at least ) and I can't get inside those. I have to wait a couple of seconds ( sometimes a minute ) so it can load properly and I can loot some items. Got killed sometimes because of this issue hopefully they'll fix this soon. The spawn system for items should be worked on. If you are about to land in a zone with a lot of buildings and you are unlucky to get a gun even a pistol in the first place you get to loot then you are most likely dead. I understand that this is how the game works but it can be really annoying. The loot system needs improvement too. There were times when I tried to loot a certain item ( having my crosshair on it ) and it grabbed some other items next to it. Not to mention that items can spawn so close to each other that you'll prefer to open up the inventory to drag and drop them in your bag but can get yourself killed.

review: Among all the battle royale games on the market this feels like the perfect one. Good animations models and weapon balance realistic but not too unforgiving gunplay and a nice learning curve. The weekly and monthly patches usually fix an incredible amount of bugs and errors making it a a lot more enjoyable day by day. With the arrival of first person only servers as an option I feel like there are no competitors left on the market. The only cons I can mention is the optimalization which is actively being worked on and the vehicle physics. Learn to drive or a 5 cm rock can end your life on a motorcycle. All in all get this game ASAP. Unlike other games this one doesn't feel dull after 150+ rounds.

review: PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds is an early access game riddled with bugs glitches and annoyances. But the game is a great concept that's fun to play despite all the bugs. And when a game overcomes the bugs and problems that someone has with that game and still manages to be really fun then it is a great game. The graphics are boring to look at and the animations are stale and weird. If you're looking for mindblowing graphics you won't find them here. Also this game lags a lot even on the lowest graphics setting (Or at least if you have a PC like mine). But again the game overcomes these flaws and still manages to be a fun game. The best way to play this game is with friends in my opinion. Get at least three friends and play this game together and you will have fun. I usually don't get early access games because promises can prove to be false. But with this game I didn't base my purchase in promise I based it on what it is right now. And I can only imagine how much better this game can get as development progresses. Buy it.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

I cant stand people that rage all over team chat when a glitch or a bug appears and gets them killed. I usually laugh at situations like that. Sometimes i get mad too when a bug or a glitch ruins my game..but still the game is realistic (bullet drop/bullet travel time/recoil). Another thing that i really hate is cheating...Cmon why cheat..i never cheated in a video game before and im happy that i didnt. i still dont get the point of cheating and this game has a lot of cheaters. The graphics are quite good in my opinion..but i think the game still needs optimization..i gave it a positive review even though it has a lot of glitches and hackers. I think the true meaning of videogames is having fun alone or with friends..

review: Very popular game in the genre of battle piano. This genre lies in the fact that in certain areas there are people fighting for 1 place. To remain the last survivor is the main idea of this genre. In our case we do not just appear somewhere unclear where but we jump out of the plane and choose the landing area that suits us the most.There is a fairly large map a lot of weapons and body kits various vehicles. All you need for a good crazy brawl here and there) the game also has a kind of currency which we buy cases and get the armor. And what falls to us from the cases can be sold and it is very pleasing. The game has 3 types of gamessolo( every man for himself and hope only for their forces)Duo( game with a friend you survive in 2 and compete between other players)skvad( you unite in a group of 4 people and fight against the same groups of people)The game is constantly updated add new weapons armor and more. On E3 2017 showed a new animation of the hero associated with parkour (looks good it will greatly facilitate the task of jumping out of houses or jump over the fence) I Advise you to buy this game even if you do not have anyone to play one is also very interesting to play! Happy hunting!

review: I bought this game a few years ago when it was still very new and had a substantial amount of hype. Its simplicity and conceptually efficient style knocked every other game off of my table for some time. This game was absolutely brilliant in building tension and giving players a sense of progression and improvement throughout matches. The variety of weather attachments and grenades really meant that winning was not just about pure aim but also awareness and creativity. This meant for players like me who are not very good at shooting games that I could get close and even win a few games with my hands trembling and my body sweating profusely.However the game wasn't exactly perfect ergo my recommendation against this game. You see at the time when it hadn't been fully released the game was littered with jittery and messy bugs that at times were simply comical due to their absurd nature yet sometimes incredibly frustrating for obvious reasons. It didn't matter that much at the time because I knew it was still early for the game and with the community surrounding it I was sure that the developers would work hard to resolve any issues. Oh how I was wrong. The game was left broken and tattered which was incredibly discouraging for the fans which had once loved the game so dearly. The devs went on to release and focus on the mobile version of this game while its pc version was still riddled with glitches and even worse hackers. In addition to this expansion of the game's content was almost non existent apart from the new maps of course and after every game there was no feeling of account progression or having had something gained from playing all those matches.In conclusion as of today the devs have fixed quite a lot of those bugs and gotten rid of many hackers although I am sure there are still some lurking in the shadows. So if you are looking for a game where you can quickly jump in shoot some dudes and constantly be on the run to feel that great rush of adrenaline this is that game. That being said I just can't say that can justify buying this game at full price.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I CAN"T TELL WHAT DIRECTION IM GETTING SHOT FROM!!!!!! In real life when you get shot you know what direction you get shot from. In this game there is no way to effectively defend my self when I can not tell what direction Im getting shot from!!! Where do I hide? What side of the tree do I need to be on so I dont recieve damage? In other FPS games the blood effect will be on the north south east or west of the screen. That is one example of how I can tell what direction Im being shot from. I mean really? How could this be over looked? Knowing what direction your being hit is the first and foremost way of effectively defending your self. How can a gameing franchise in the FPS relm overlook this fact? Please get this taken care of!!!!! ASAP This game will not recieve a thumbs up from me till this issue has been resolved

review: I haven't played this game much yet bought it because I have some family members that play. It's really fun when you play with a group but I've tried by myself and it's too boring for me. The games are a bit slow paced a lot of people just camp in a building with high zoom scopes and snipe you from far distances. However I enjoy the pin point precision of where you are on the map (way better than H1Z1 although this is now implemented in the game as well) and the compass to know your direction. This game has a lot of potential. I have tons of fun playing it (when I'm not raging due to being shot from across the map and I can't see where it's coming from LOL) Still for me pros out weigh cons and I recommend.

review: For a summary skip to the bottom. If you like books read the whole review.This game is extremely fun MOST of the time especially with friends. There are however many moments that make you want to rage quit i.e. When you have what you believe is a clear line of sight only to hit a windowsill or door frame and end up killed by a player you easily could have beaten otherwise. This is particularly frustrating in third person because the aimbox (in my own and others' experience) seems to be off even more so than first person. The same issue applies to grenade throws there is a visible throwing arc showing the path the grenade will travel but it has rarely held true especially indoors. More often than not I end up hitting something (like a door or window frame) that is far outside the arc of the throw and end up nearly killing myself or a squadmate. I have come to consider grenade throws as a gamble for my own life at this point and only use them with extreme caution. This should be an easily resolved problem (I blame beta state). Do keep in mind most of the issues come with precision throws indoors and into buildings. If you're out in the open there isn't a problem. The mind boggling "accuracy" of some players *cough cough*. I know I'm not the only one who experiences being instantly headshot at 100m+ as soon as an enemy turns around to fire back at you. For example a previous game in the Top 5 where I spotted an enemy from behind with my 8x scope. I decided to play it as safe as possible and fired prone from a narrow slot between 2 trees from within a modestly dense forest. As terrible as I am I missed. But my target didn't 2 seconds after I fired the other player turned around and instantly headshot me. "How is that possible" I thought marveling at the extreme skill and precision it would require to perform such an extraordinary feat of marksmanship at that distance. His ability to ascertain the exact location of my face in that short time having only gone off the general direction of the sound of a single gunshot was astounding. "He must be a professional!" I said aloud. Truly it was an honor to be in the presence of such an elite player. Then again it may have just been blind luck on his part. Is it possible? Sure. Sure...In summary aimbotting is an issue. Although most players prefer to actually test themselves and use their own skill there are a few (and I mean MAYBE 1/100) players who would rather pretend they're excellent players by using software to assist them. This is of course not the fault of the developers and doesn't impact my rating for the game. I understand it's difficult to crack down on these players but it's very disheartening to make it so far in a game only to be cheated. In regards to microtransactions Many players have decided to negatively rate this game based on the addition of this feature. I completely understand their anger and I agree with them. As another poster pointed out the items aren't entirely cosmetic. Everything you wear impacts your visibility. It is more difficult to see someone wearing camouflaged clothing than a yellow tracksuit. In PUBG everything you do and wear affects you. To be able to purchase clothing that increases your odds of survival is unfair. It's true that you can simply buy these clothes yourself for a fairly cheap price or get lucky with the RNG of a crate you purchased with in game currency but supporters were promised there would be NO microtransactions and that promise was broken thus giving the edge (however slight) to those willing to spend real world money on the game. As far as the Gamescom crates go and why I decided to finally rate this game Wow. I mean I'm not the luckiest guy but I didn't think I was unlucky enough to spend hours collecting points to purchase three crates with in game currency spend $7.50 real world currency for keys and get three of the same pair of $.20 cent school pants. The price that people buy them for isn't the issue here it's the fact that I got RNGed from behind so badly that I got three of the same item. But that's just how RNG is eh? I gambled and I lost big time.The almighty Ban Hammer and its liberal application in the protection of overly sensitive streamers in PUBG You've already read the popular posts about players being banned unfairly so I'll skip the lengthy paragraphs I would have written on the matter and just throw in my seal of agreement on the side of those who find it absurd. I mean a BAN? Come on. Especially for those accused of harassing streamers with the car horn. Odds are the guy has no idea he's honking near a streamer. And how many streamers ARE there? Consider the possibilty that someone streams JUST so they can get people they don't like banned or to feel some warped sense of power. I find that far more plausible than the unlikely scenario that someone happens to be in the same game and going far out of their way to survive long enough just to harass a streamer with a car horn. I imagine the Hammer wielders visualize a helpess streamer child being followed throughout the game by the big bad man with a horn. I played a round where there was a player driving through a town back and forth without fail blaring his horn as he drove through the streets all the while being shot at by every player in the vicinity. My friends and I thought it was hilarious. Had I been streaming I still would have thought it amusing even if they were doing it as they watched my stream. But I'm lighthearted and like to have a good laugh. In contrast streamers seem to have this strange idea that they're special and their needs should be catered to for the sake of their own benefit and enjoyment to the detriment of others. I know I said I wouldn't write a lot but it turns out I couldn't help myself Summary Get the game. Try it. Don't go off just the negative reviews of others. Also keep in mind that most of the recent negative ratings are for microtransactions and unfair bans and NOT gameplay (though there are still issues #beta). There are problems. It's a beta. Stick with it. Endure the pains that come with pre release. It's more fun with friends. If you play alone and have an exceedingly frustrating time find some buddies and go at it! The developers broke a promise but I believe they'll get back on track. If they don't leave your feedback and a negative review as others have. You will encounter cheaters at some point. When you do report them after they shoot you in the face. For the streamers don't be a pansy. If someone is "harassing" you shoot them. You have a gun (or a grenade (careful with the arc)) they have a car horn. Seems like an easy free kill if you ask me. The good times and stories far outweigh the bad ones especially with friends. Example I was once geared to the teeth having landed alone in the Military Base. I needed to cross the water to get within the circle and decided to take a boat. Having failed to reconcile the momentum of the boat as it slid across the beach I jumped out early. I immediately died my body flopping across the sand. After 7 minutes or so of unhindered play I killed myself. To me it was funny. For those enemies that saw me hilarious. This game has become one of my all time favorites. At first I hated it. I was bad at it. I played alone. I got better played with friends and now I love it. Do I approve of the antics of the developers as of late? No. Is the game still enjoyabe regardless? Yes. PUBG will give you an adrenaline rush unlike any game you've played. It's terrifying exhilerating and extremely rewarding.

review: *Acknowledgement that the game is still under development* Pros Multiple group modes that are all equally fun from paranoid inducing solo to tactic's focused 4 man squads. Gun's handle great and are balanced well with each other. There are no insta win weapons like a rocket launcher in halo. Hackers are almost non existant for an FPS. Seperate game modes for people who want either 3rd person or 1st person gameplay. This is no sniper simulator but the guns lean more towards the realistic than most FPS. If you want to kill someone 400m away you're going to have to carefully aim with a scoped zeroed rifle. Cons Melee is completely broken. One game you can run through a building 1 shotting people with a machete then the next you will not be able to hit a non moving enemy after multiple swings while he kills you with fists. The melee range (when it does work) feels like it is 1 inch away from your chest instead of the 2 3 feet range a crowbar would have. Hit detection needs some work. You might swear you shot that guy in the head 6 times and even saw blood splatter without him dying.

review: This game is essentially all about survival. Its not easy. Its about strategy and team work if you can master both you will do well in this game. If you can not you will die quickly or you will get your team killed. The rewards from winning and the adrenaline rush you get from this game is beyond any other. This game is addictive but more importantly it encourages you to be better. Better at aiming better at positioning better at ambushing When to be stealthy and when to go loud. Pubg is the best game we have in current times to what we used to have back when we had the original Rainbow Six and Ghost Recon games back in 2000.

review: First and foremost to everyone that is saying that stream sniping/ honking shouldn't be bannable I feel doesn't know what they're talking about. I personally like how PUBG's team is handling stream sniping. In my eyes streamers that stream for a living can be impacted by stream snipers. It literally affects the quality of their stream. I know that some streamers find it funny but if someone was constantly harrasing you in game I'm sure you wouldn't be a fan of it. Another more "heavy" topic is one of microtransactions. To keep it short as long as they are ONLY cosmetic (which since PUBG is a battle royal game it literally has to be no worries about that) then I'm 100% okay with it. Why not drop a couple bucks for a piece of cosmetic gear if you have some cash floating around? I hate this topic as people seem very bipolar on the topic. Anyway the game itself is really fun. For an EE title it has one of the best dev team's out their atm. The interaction between the team and the community is great and their new switch to updates with more time in between each other for high quality updates is great in my opinon. I could go in depth as to how the game feels but if you're thinking of buying the game at this point you probably already know how it looks and plays. I absolutely love the game and whole heartedly recommend it as for me its a great breath of fresh air.

review: Its probably the worst game I've played in a long time. Was gifted to me by a friend whom enjoys it. I stepped into it with the only knowledge about it is that its pretty much battle royale and the area gets smaller and smaller after time goes on. Soon as I load into the game the graphics were the first jarring thing that popped out. For a game that involves long ranged combat its hard to distinguish between a shrub and a person. The rest of the game's effects look like it was made at a B grade university. And even that is a me trying to make this game sound good.Then comes the gameplay the main part of any game. Even if its visuals are garbage the gameplay should be enough to make the game worth it. This is one of the first games in my entire life where I was yawning within 5 minutes. I was in a group and I should have known the game's quality the moment I was in the lobby. The aiming was buggy even after messing with the control option. The running was buggy. The climbing was buggy. Even falling down the stupid plane was buggy. The game is a broken mess and its been apparently released. For $30. You spend most of your time just looting only for the garbage controls to get you killed anyway. I mean if the game worked it would still be subpar. The game really is split between 2 different phases looting and then finding something to do. Every round. In repeat. Fun.Its not often I find myself actually annoyed with a game this is actually one of the first. I cannot believe anyone would release a game in this state. It baffles me anyone likes this game and it got the recognition it did. I spent about an hour on this game an hour of my life I wasted and probably will never load it up again. 1/10 the 1 was for the fact that I could actually start the game. Which in the end was a waste of my time.Long story short Dont expect much. Its a garbage game with no appeal.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I bought this game because everyone on my discord (lets say "friends) played it and ja i have to say after so many matches and 5 wins (Squad/Duo and alone) This game is pretty awesome. In my opinion there isn't a game like this at all. I mean ur blood pressure starts to rise when ur team (or yourself) are the last people inside ur Squad (or alone) in the last zone. This game is intense as hell and this is really fun but yes of course there are alot of people from china there are a few cheaters ( i haven't seen one yet) and yea what else....In my opinion this game is balances as hell there are good weapons in Airdrops which you have to fight for there are good weapons/equipment which you have to search for...idk all i can say is that....this game is above my expectations and it's really freaking fun to play it with friends.In my honest opinion i'll give this game a 7/10 with a "FUN" approval. You won't get that fun and frustration in any other game than this one get it right away pls. And message me or my friends right away.

It has multiple beautifully structured maps and the gameplay is suitable for everyone who seeks a thrilling game to play by themselves or with friends Good experience 10/10
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: The release of PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS represents a revolution in the video gaming industry. Last man standing type games have become more popular in recent years and PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS is a true pioneer of this new and exciting game mode. PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS takes your classic shooter game and brings it to the next level with massive maps beautiful graphics an excellent combat system and an overall amazing experience. With over 80 players each round you are guaranteed an action packed and thrilling game every time you play solo or with friends. Having this game for about a week allows me to easily say without a doubt that PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS is one of my favorite games and will continue to be for a long time. If you are a fan of intense combat open world maps and love to try out new games you will not be disappointed by PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS.

review: A great game in it's infancy. Much like a lot of early acess games the idea is awesome. Unlike other early acess games the PUBG guys continue to work on the project and provide improvements and additions. They also so far are keeping the game along the path it should be on not one based on where the money is which has become to common these days. The PUBG guys listen to the players that a big stand out thing. This game may be doing well in Steam stats but if they keep on the path to what this game can be and can accomplish they will top all gameing lists and then for being patient and listening to players then is when more money than ever will pour in for them. The game is great of course early access so it has it's little quirks but overall the best early access game I've played quality wise. Gun handling feels great unlike most other "survival" type games. I call it an FPS injected with some open world survival. It gets your heart pumping at times makes you want to rage at times makes you feel awesome at times in the end you always go back for more. Also if you don't like hearing the dumbest most pointless ignorant crap via mic mute voice chat upon entering the game. It's pretty bad almost always. My biggest tips wear a headset...turn it up. Listen to your senses if you think you heard something 9 times out of 10 you did stop and check your surroundings. Pace yourself be diligent and listen carefully. Most of my kills are because I listen.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I just wanna say I like the game most the people who are ing either A. Never win a game and always get ed over at some point. B. Have no real friends who are good at the game or C.Just suck at the game enough to and whine..On another note bringing up streamers and them exploiting bugs.. They have been BANNED. Destiny was Banned for driving through walls with the car and The Doc got banned for killing a teammate.. You saying they don't do anything is BS as the Devs and the main dev himself even said no streamer will get special treatment. And you realize they just have to make a new accoun they don't HAVE to tell you they got banned. I mean come on now. Overall the game is a bit buggy but for a game in Early Access it's doing 100% better then most games that have been in early access for years now. Looking at you DayZ Standalone. The game is good and I wouldn't look into the reviews to much as most people tend to cry about problems just go in and have fun! Yes you will get camped and at times get out played but all you can do is learn and improve at it as well. Good luck to everyone and I hope you guys can get some future chicken dinners!

review: the feeling when you get a chicken dinner on solo is the closest you'll get to heaven without dying seen a lot of people complaining about optimisation and frame drops but honestly i don't see what all the fuss is about a game like this doesn't thrive on graphics it's all about the gameplay which is awesome! i just stuck everything on low and kept the detail on ultra which is basically the same as all settings on ultra anyway i have between 70 and 9p fps at all times.iv'e had 2 chicken dinners since playing yesterday and it is the best feeling ever if you're thinking about getting this game then i would say go for it as it is good solo or in a squad but one thing i will say is dont rush and choose your moments wisely i sat in a bush and watched a squad of 4 guys all kill each other and when the last guy was left i popped him once in the chest and he was dead i went and looted all the 4 guys loot which was all amazing stuff which then helped me to go on to win the gameso in theory stay alive

review: ing terrible gunplay movement and overall maps are complete utter . Devs are too focused on new maps and suing every battle royale game that has a playzone system. Dont even get me started on the horrendus lag and utterly rediculous amount of hackers. I've played this game since it was first released across two different accounts. During 2017 yeah there was server issues and optimization errors but the gunplay was atleast manageable. Now the gunplay has gone worse with SMGs actually being more useful than assault rifles the assault rifles have a ridiculous amount of recoil now. Wasted $60 actually. Dont ing buy this piece of game.

review: This game definitley has its ups and downs. The game can be very annoying at times things such as glitching all over the place rubber banding and the occasional network lag makes this game kind of annoying. BUT the Devs are extremely adamant on making sure the game is getting optimized often. When I first got the game I got terrible frames but after about a month or two I was getting 40 50 frames. They definitley do care about this game and want to make it better. If you're looking for an action packed game that makes your adrenaline pump and can deal with the occasional glitch this is your game.

review: In all honestly I love this game. Something about it feels so smooth and it keeps drawing me in. But in all honesty this game is horribly imbalanced and that is a problem. I cannot tell you how many times I have left enemies with zero visible health in the deathcam or how many times i've outgunned people but somehow they magically take a quarter damage. This is seriously a problem considering the fact that I can shoot an enemy twice as much and they manage to maintain half health where I seem to miracously die from the same gun im using with higher level armor and full health. Please fix this and make this game more enjoyable.

review: After 800 hours on this game I can give my opinion on this. The game is way better than at initial release. Still lots of bugs probs with hackers and region that are not locked. Play in FPP TPP is full of campers and cheaters. Arm yourself with some friends and go slay some people on your way to your precious dinner full of proteins. The game is sometimes laggy and dsync have been horrible the last couples of updates... Now it feels better. With a good computer the game feels smooth. Won't run it on a potato. I still think that for the gameplay mechanics the weapon mechanics this is the best BR. Sadly the quality of the servers and of the updates (the fix pubg campaign was not successful at all imo) the Dsync persistent cheaters and all ruins the experience. Though it's still my favourite BR and I've tried a lot of them. RNG can be cheesy but hey that's life. PS If you just come to say fortnite &gt PUBG i'll tell you you're wrong. The best one is the one you enjoy the most. Don't misunderstand me I play fortnite too but i'm quite bored about how easy it is. PUBG has recoil control tactics more than building brain a better ballistic... Fortnite's fun PUBG is for me a better game to play with my friends.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: 게임은 재밌다. 요즘 핵쟁이도 꽤 잡는 거 같고. 놀랍운 점은 지금 껏 핵 안잡다가 콜옵이라는 경쟁작이 나오고나서야 잡기 시작했다는 거잡으라고 할 때는 안 잡다가 이 상놈의 자식들이근데 비슷한 스킨이 너무 자주 나옴. 카스 글옵이랑 비교해봤을때 요즘들어 아이템들이 DDong값이 되고 있다. 50에 주고 산게 지금 10만원이 채 안됨. 배그에서 날린 돈이 지금 백만원 넘었는데트위치가 자꾸 스팀 장터에서 비싼 아이템들하고 비슷한 스킨을 내놓아서 그러는 거 같다.비싼 아이템을 사면 뭐함 트위치에서 비슷한 아이템이 계속 나오는데 당연히 가격이 떨어지지.엠포 골드만해도 비슷하게 3개나 더 나왔고 그렇게 비쌌던 치마는 트위치에서 3종류 내놓자 DDong값됨배그 세계대회에서 나온 한정판 스킨들도 마찬가지. 덩달아 DDong값된다.트위치 좀 그만 했으면 좋겠다.NO MORE PUBG SKINS of twitch!!Every month or week Event skins appear so that they THEMSELVES undermine their value of LIMIT items.I think these items are no more valuable in THE point of limitless Twitch seems not to consider any concept of LIMIT preciousness or deliberation.YOU twitch guys just only think printing skins out on market to rake money up.TWITCH SKINS have reached saturation point. PLS reduce frequency of twitch event.NEVER forget ____________YOUR current actions undermine YOURSELF.

review: Honestly this game is just really fun. The gameplay is very exciting (mostly) and getting a kill is one of the best feelings in a game. The lag is noticebale but its only for the first few minutes of the start of a game. If you have friends who are getting or have this game it is way more fun but solo is still great. A complaint i have is the progression system as its only cosmetics if you play online games for the progression system only then this might not be for you. The developers update this game with big consistant updates which i really like.To sum up this game is just very fun and the fact you can jump straight back in to a match if you die is great. i would give it and 8/10

review: DO NOT BUY THIS GAME.The servers are the major problem with this game and I cannot recommend it in the current state. The servers were designed for 1 million concurrent players. Considering the devs could not have predicted that the game would blow up beyond that I understand that and accept the explanation. But once the game blew up in popularity beyond that their attempts at fixing these issues are far from enough to do any good.They patched the game a few months ago and after that they said they also fixed the servers (this was around the time they acknowledged that they were completely unprepared for the volume of gamers on their servers). I have had constant disconnects ever since that patch and no amount of "fixes" on my end or their end have done anything to assuage the problem.This is a game breaking bug that tens of thousands of people are experiencing.Don't get me started on the shoddy character movement where you feel like you're floating/sliding and movements are not precise. Nor the poor shooting and registration of hits on characters. That is just the beginning of how many problems this game has.At any rate the game is not ready for mass consumption and I would wait until Early Access is over and the game receives some serious overhauls.*Update*Their FIX PUBG campaign was a complete failure. The patch they released just before declaring the game fixed broke the game completely. I have spent hours trying to fix it and it rarely ever works and if it does it crashes my PC so soundly that it requires a hardboot (if I even get into the game) within seconds or minutes. DO NOT BUY THIS GAME.

review: An awesome game making its way through early access.. I really enjoy playing the game it's seriously intense at points and can be alot of fun it's also enjoyable to play with friends or by yourself. I've clocked up a few hours on this game now ) and it can lead to tears of joy or tears of anger and I mean the FIFA angry when that guys scores a 99 min goal by passing across the box when there's only 2mins of extra time given.. that level.The crete system is fab just like any other game if you dont want to buy don't buy. In fact its nice to have items that actually do effect the game whether its camo or coloured items for upcoming maps ). You can also sell your crates on the community market to make money from nothing but just playing the game I think its one of the best crate systems I've seen. One negative part of this is the huge percentage that's charged to sell back the items you've opened to the market and yes the focus on micro transactions.There are a few issues with the game and I'll list these here in importance to me with a few ideas.People seeing through absolutely everything no textures load Being shot round corners or behind objects this is constant and needs to be fixedHit registration is poor at points. Lag at start when landing the beginning is one of the most important parts of the game also other players jolting when close to each other.Campers it's way to easy for them.The landscape while using vehicles bikes in particular needs improving.Loot sometimes you can go through countless buildings without finding an AR or anythin but a shoutgun and pistol.Valting I know its comingIDEASThere should be more visibility of someome who has been to an area ive noticed you have black footprints on the floor why not leave them round only when someone has looted a building and closed all the doors?The blue zone is too powerful near end and not powerful enough to begin with.... ill leave gamescom solo winner last night Evermore to explain more ) 1 use spotting flare? a good idea would be able to have a spotting flare that you can only use once will cover a small area and for only 5 seconds or so. That way if you wanted to use it if you thought someone was camping use it then or save it to the end zone.... if you make it. Nerf the shotgun its way to powerful getting one banged with level three armour and helmet is stupid. Less powerful but a bit more faster shot on trench sk12 is fine on recoil but reduce damage. Also the distance reach of these is way to far without choke.Leave rare boxes in buildings In very few buildings why not have a locked crate with a grozer* in or similar that takes a short period of time to open? The crates that are dropped are few and too rare that you'll actually get it or even find it especially in solos. Also you should have to carry a crowbar (one member of suqads or duos) to open the red crates that are dropped.Glare from scopes for a scope thats 4x or above it should have a slight glare or shine if being aimed in.Anyway fab game keep up the good work see you on the battlegrounds!!!
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I'd recommend this game to my mates. Fun as hell and is a good laugh. HOWEVER there is so much stuff still broken and issues out the with it. I've encountered sound queues not working such as footsteps not being audible (even inside) explosions causing the sound to distort and cause the sound of an earthquake at a rave and some sounds that cut out randomly. Visual glitches such as seeing guns through walls or floating as if they are attached to players.Then there are gameplay issues. Oh my god are there gameplay issues. Dips in the ground cause vehicles to stop and act like you've hit a wall characters head bang like a paint shaker if proned on a hill and holding a weapon constant server issues cause rubber banding and the frame rate drops...the frame rate drops are the worst. I had the counter go from 60fps to 11 because someone used a grenade. When the game first came out as 1.0 (though more like 0.75) it was running at a smooth rate and 30fps was the lowest it got. Now with the new update I'm lucky to even get to 20fps when running through a field. How the hell they thought this was out of early access I'll never know. It still needs so much work for it to be out of early access properly
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: 2 months ago I was introduced to pubg mobile from a buddy of mine and instantly fell in love with the game. So much so that after a month of playing the game on my iPhone I decided to make the investment and build a new gaming pc just to play the official version. (I am normally a mac person and would have never thought in a million years I would buy a pc). I own a ps4 and not an xbox so it seemed to be the best option since there was no evidence of the game being release on the ps4 anytime soon. $2500 and 1 week later I was playing the game (I am now single thanks to it) and I have absolutely no regrets. Initially the transition from console to keyboard and mouse was very tough even with me being an experienced FPS gamer on console. Luckily it continues to get easier and easier the more I play. As expected I have not been able to stop playing this game. It is challenging and every match is unlike the last so it never loses my internest. I am excited for the upcoming training map which will be avaible within the next few weeks since I found it very useful on the mobile version. The game runs smoothly and I rarely have problems/ lag while playing. There are updates all the time including new skins guns and weapon adjustments. I hope bluehole will bring back the option to use OPSKINS to trade the skins (using wax) since this would definitely bring in new interest. I paid $19.99 for this game from the Steam website.
