review: Addictive. Exhilarating. Fresh. Game is as fun to play on the first go around as the 1000th and every drop is a new experience. The progress the game has made since Alpha and upcoming features leaves me certain I'll be enjoying the game for a long while to come. I know there has been a huge wave of negative reviews due to hacks bugs and "CHINA" but I think the issues are overblown and the internet hivemind is just having a childish REEE moment. I see maybe one hacker every 50+ hrs of playtime. Major bugs (not weird minor inconveniences) are even rarer. The 'China' controversy doesn't make sense to me (just don't play with randoms?). Game no longer crashes since v1.0 release and game has made breakneck progress in a year. People who expect otherwise are just being naive and childish in my opinion. My only real gripe with the game is the tickrate. There are few things more annoying than playing gun roulette on initial drop only to find the player who dropped after you finds a gun first because you ran by something that hadn't loaded when you were there. And the 'smoothness' of the game right now feels like the old low tick CS1.6 CS S days hopefully PUBG will improve on that end at some point. Having a good computer and internet helps with this so I'd recommend you have over the minimum settings if you really want to enjoy it.

review: Okay 60 Hours in Well. I bought 4 copies 1 for me 3 for 3 friends. Its okay if you play with friends but I feel like its a total waste of money. Unfortunatly It feels like a Hash of other games. Like back when Doom first came out. Ya Doom is amazing but it had so many knock offs like Hexen ect. It kinda feels like that. Yes I played Fortnite and who the hell kinda of bag comes up with fortnite. That game looks like Team Fortress 2 and Minecraft had a ing baby and was dropped on its head. As for H1Z1 Battle Royal. The game H1Z1 isnt even out yet. Been in Development for 4 years and hasnt budged yet they make this Cheap Crap called H1Z1 battle Royal. These Kinda games makes me really Hate Game Companies. Come up with something Original and Not a Nock off. I Dont like that you rack up so much BP and you can only spend on Crates as well as 00 31 second wait queue and its been 11 00 mins waiting. Overall Im giving this a 3.5/10 Dont Make the Mistake and waste money like I did. Its cool that it looks realistic but the over all BS with weapons and armor is ing stupid. Dont Fall for the money scheme called Crates.

review: I liked the concept of the game when it came out first. I wanted to buy it. Due to lack of money I had to wait for a long time. Finally I bought the game a few days ago. I was hoping that the game would run smoothly as I it was able to easily handle some recent titles like AC Oddessy Farcry 5 GOW 4 Shadow of tomb raider etc with high or ultra graphics settings a 720p. I used to get around 35 40 sometimes over 50 fps. But when I tried PUBG at first the game set the graphics level to ultra at 720p. I was happy to see that. But when I started a match it took very time to load the game. sometimes I was disconnected and sometimes the match started &amp I was stucked in the loading screen. Again when I face any in game player the ping was about 700ms or more. Rest of the time while running and looting the ping was around 60ms/70ms. I even tried to lower my setting but did not work. Next there is no bullet indicator on map like PUBG mobile. Even faced terrible glitches in Miramar and Vikendi map. Developers really need to fix this issues. They should add bullet indicator on map add an option to select server and fix the optimization of the game which is very bad.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game is super fun either solo or with friends. Nothing beats the tension of being in the last 10 remaining players beating the odds provides an amazing feeling no other game will ever give you.I haven't experienced any lag spikes related to my PC even though my hardware is quite old (8GB DDR RAM GTX 970 3.5 GB VRAM and AMD FX6100 OC d 4.1 GHz) and the server related lag spikes are quite uncommon.I see myself playing this game for as long as it stays alive (the playerbase is plentiful so I give it another 5 years). Most of the reviews are people with unrealistic expectations and a niche for complaining about everything. The lootboxes are quite annoying and the season pass didn t help but they re easy to ignore and it s understandable that Bluecorp as the company it is requires a constant flow of revenue to continue its operations.10/10 would buy for my friends if I had the cash.

review: New player here wanted to give it a shot because I read the reviews and hype.So I have no lagg here all goes perfectly smooth. Its gigantic.I was trying to get to my teammates in Squat First person mode.But I dropped to far from my teammates. So I needed to go whole alone to them on the other side of the bridge...I ran &amp ran in de grass without a weapon. I entered a small town where I picked up a smallhand gun.Then I suddenly hear the engine of a car. I check the window and see an squat on a small jeep fully loaded with guns lol...They don't see me but I can get to shots of and I het 2 bullets in one passenger his body. I could see that blood splatter from afar. They immediately turned back and I ran outside from the backdoor and just ran ran and hide in another house for 5 minutes while I could here engines coming by checking for me. When everything was silence. I ran to the bridge where I was supposed to meet up with my Squat. Everyone was already dead just one surviver left on the other side of the bridge but he was in need of help and wounded.So I dint trust the bridge I was sure someone was camping there. And I was right. Boom A sniper shot. I get on the ground in prone. And boom again right next to me I could hear the metal from where the bullet impacted not so far away from me. Then another bullet Boom! It hit me but I surived it. So I just went full sprint to a ramp on that bridge and jumped of the bridge in the Deep ocean below while I could clearly hear more Shots fired at me while I Jumped.I dive underwater to hide from the sniper that was hunting for me. Till i reached the other side then I proned my way to the grass undetected and there she was my teammate squat wounded on the ground. I help her and revive her but then I see in the horizon something moving its a guy with a clear long rifle about like 300 meters far away from me. BOOM!My teammate got a bullet right between the eyes. Blood everywhere. I pannick and try to shoot with my small gun on the sniper that clearly got me locked in his scoope. BOOM!! DEADOk guys this was awesome. Its so immersive and big and all runs so smoothly. To all the cry babies complaining about performance. Dont hide the you got a cheap 10 3d card in your spec LEL.Ok no but overall this was my first game. And I wanted to tell the creators of this game they succeeded very well. And this is what I always wanted a Big mmorpg shooter like thing. Where I can hunt or be hunted. And do it my way.Grapics very clear and fun. Its the unreal 4 engine so expect engine updates in future aswell because the UT engine is very capable of updates and better addons.10/10

review: Started day off delighted as I knew I'd play some games as I was waiting for the plane sequence to start and the bullets were flying around me I couldn't have been more delirious about what's coming. As the plane was flying bodies were soon to drop and 'chutes were soon to open. As we were flying towards Po i it appeared there was a lunar eclipse but actually that was just about 40 people jumping towards that sweet loot spot. Fearless and determined to be the king of the city to be above all else who stood to challenge me in a fight I've entered my first house to loot riding on a wave of confidence I opened first door found nothing continued on to the second once again found nothing alas third door where all of my hopes of clearing the town rested abruptly got interrupted. As the final door were opening random guy shot me with his s686 and blasted my face like firecracker would blast thanksgiving turkey if it was to explode inside of it I ate that shell so hard my third generation descendants will still feel the pain. After all that hardship cruel raw experience of dirty warfare my computer screen suddenly went missing through the window of room that's on 6th floor.10/10 would drop Po i again

review: Even for Early Access this game is better than a ton of the trash AAA titles that are released every year. The random nature of the game means sometimes you'll have an easier time than others. The game is free from the camping meat grinder style game play the industry is used to crapping on us every single year.I really enjoy how no 2 games end up the same way. The weapons drops starting location and zone shrink all guarantee something different will happen.Update Negative reviews are likely due to hacking from Asia which has largely been dealt with in recent patches for most games. If you're good and you find yourself in the top 100k of any one game type you'll still see home hackers out there.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: TL DR Good game. Good devs. Some flaws but not game breaking. Hackers are rampant but being sorted. Gunplay could use some polish. Needs more maps soon. Worth the 30 bucks. Great game idea with a halfway decent implementation. Dev team is actively solving issues and deploying patches. Development has begun to steer away from adding features and has started focusing on bugs and polishing existing features. Cheating has become somewhat of a nuisance but is now beginning to be dealt with. Mass bans are happening regularly and I'm sure we'll see the cheating taper off after a while. Servers are unstable on the occassion but are overall pretty sturdy. Haven't had any disconnects myself. I have heard of some stability issues and desyncing but it seems to be a mostly isolated case and may not even have to do with PUBG itself. Gunplay in my opinion is far from polished. While it does the job it doesn't feel clean. New maps are on the way and not too soon. The existing map is massive and full of places I've never even touched but the landscape feels mostly the same in most locations. After 20 hours or so I felt like I needed another map. Overall this game is totally worth the price even in Early Access. It seems as though there is a large amount of effort being invested in this game and I can see a worthy product at the end of the development tunnel. I hope BlueHole continues to follow their current trend and we see some new developments in the near future. If you're on the fence about this one just do it. I don't believe you'll regret it.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: All in all this game was something special in early access. The gameplay was buggy and the servers were trash (still aren't great even at the supposed "60 tick") but it was great. the game started going down hill the more it approached 1.0 with less optimization and more new content that also just created more optimization problems and bugs.As every month after 1.0 goes by this game seems to go out of its was to dump on its patrons with less and less game updates and more cosmetic t. This game has become the new CS GO of skin garbage and blatant cheating. Go play fortnite it's a cartoon game but at least your not paying for it and its had more updates in the past 2 months than PUBG has had this year. I feel like if you support this game you are one of the reasons why so many of these early access games make so much money only to end up as piles of garbage that the devs dont care about because they have already made a ridiculous amount of money off of them.

review: I will preface this review by saying this game is still early access and has a handful of optimization problems and a good bucket full of glitches and server problems. However this is hands down my favorite multiplayer shooter game right now. The matches are always tense edge of my seat thrill rides and very rarely do i feel cheated when i get killed. The learning curve is pretty short and the way the game is set up it is easy to play with any mixture of full blown aggression or stealth. As far as server issues go i have to say that i have never felt like they have ever been bad enough to make me feel like the game is unplayable. And that is saying a lot for a new early access game that has 3 million purchases and upwards of 100000 people playing at any given time. To top it all off every new update and patch just adds to the games. Optimization fixes new guns new gear and every piece of the game that has been changed has only been a boon and not a bust. 10/10 Will play a lot

review: I've only got just shy of 70 hours booked on this game and it's already one of my favourite games of all time. The feeling of dropping into a zone with other players and rushing to find a gun and hunting them down is unreal. The looting and weapon modding/attachment experience is quick easy and fun and once you're in the top 5 players remaining your heart can't stop pounding your senses go into overdrive listening out for the silent thuds of a supressed weapon or the slow muffled footsteps of another player sneaking up on you constantly watching out for movement and keeping one eye fixed on the psychopathic and homicidal Blue Circle of Misery theres no other feeling like it. However there are constantly bugs but they never last more than a week. The team at Bluehole are quick to squash bugs and patch things up and improve the gaming experience. PRAISE THE PAN.I've since put plenty more hours into this game and even though people give it a bad rap I still love it ridiculously much. Highly reccomend.

review: The basic idea is you are one of a hundred people air dropped onto an island with nothing but the shirt on your back. You then have to race to search the nearby buildings to find guns armour and equipment to help you survive. An energy wall slowly decreases in size forcing players to stay on the move in the ever decreasing area. This mechanic limits camping.The game aims for realism with real world guns vehicles physics and people only taking 3 4 hits to drop which makes the game have a constant tension. The tension keeps building as the game gets down to the last few players with a last man or squad standing end.Good graphics reasonable price regular updates and a huge player base (which means it is rare to wait more than a minute for a game). Option to play third person or first solo pairs or 4 person squads. All of this prior to the game leaving early access.

review: This game is pretty damn fun. what is unique about battle royale type games is that every single time you play you don't konw what's going to happen. you don't know what drops you are going to get. you don't know what other players are going to do. you don't know where the circle is going to be. it is incredibly fun. the graphics are fairly good. I would say 8/10. optimization is a mixed bag my pc is 3 years old but PUBG runs perfectly fine. but I know some friends of mine who have top of the line PCs and they receive frame drops. recommend playing this with some friends but being top10 in a solo match makes your heart race like no other. I would definitely recommend this gameKeep in mind this game is in Early Access and should be treated so.

review: I would honestly really like to recommend this game but there are WAY too many potential game breaking issues (as in it'll ruin any possibility of this game becoming as much of a household name as CSGO or TF2). The hit detection is beyond broken for a start. I'm sorry If I sound salty here but I don't appreciate that another player and myself can be standing completely still (I have a crow bar and he has fists) and he'll win the fight because only about half my hits actually register. Yes this was a thing that actually happened. This goes for guns as well though that's remedied by the fire rate of most guns and is made even less noticeable when you have teammates who are helping yout out. There's also starting to be a cheater problem. I've had more than a couple of instances where I'll jump out of the plane go to a very specific spot (whilst checking around me for anyone else also going for that spot) be the first to drop down on top of and walk into a building to get gunned down by a dude who somehow got there first and had time to find and equip level 3 armor with a shotgun and an M16A4. Before you ask no. I didn't report him as I was too off to pay attention to the killfeed to get the gamer tag of the cheater (as there's no in game player list) and I didn't feel like hunting down the seperate website you have to visit to report people as there's no in game way to report.Like I said there's a lot of issues that could be potentially game breaking though I'd go as far as to claim that they'd be brand ruining if they're left unchecked. The devs are open and honest about what they're working on which is good at least. I'll gladly change my review once they fix at least the hit detection issue but I can't reccomend it in its current state. If you really want to play it then go ahead and get it with the knowledge of the rage you'll eventually experience. If you're not sure I'd say to wait until later. If it goes on sale then go for it. $30 for a very early access game is a bit much imo. I say very early access because I wouldn't call this anywhere close to being complete.Edit I'm fully aware that all my issues could be resolved fairly quickly because of the early access nature of the game and the fantastic support of the devs however I still stand by my criticisms as early access isn't a sufficient excuse for these types of problems. These problems hinder the ability of the community to figure out other issues with the game which in turn prevents propper feedback on those other issues.Edit The most recent update that they did fixed my hit detection issue and now the majority of the times that I get bent over it feels like it was my own fault/ bad luck rather than the game actively screwing me. I'm not sure if this is the case across the entire board but it's fine for me. As true to my word I now recommend it. Even the cheater issue doesn't appear to be a thing anymore (for me at least).

review: PLAYERUNKNOWN's Battlegrounds is the most successful take on the battle royal genre as of May 2017. It's still in early access yet it is very fleshed out and addicting. Your average match involves just the right amount of fast paced action and strategy in a fully open and high quality play area that remains fun whether you are a loner or otherwise. Genuine skill based competition (and a moderate amount of RNG) means that this game isn't for the feint of heart but still remains accessible to the public.Just remember to turn down the volume at the beginning of every round or get your finest recorder and play your heart out.

review: I have only had 1 disconnect in almost 30hours of playtime (and that could've been my internet tripping for a split second!)A lot of the hate appears to be towards the chinese version or based on stream sniping. The game is fun. I'm not chinese so not spammed with ads. When I watch a streamer I'm not trying to get in his game. Funnily enough I haven't been banned for stream sniping. Go figure. 2mill peak players. You'll never queue long for a game. You decide if you want to slug it out or play a long game. The matchmaking is surprisingly pleasent (going squad solo is completely reasonable about 50% of my hours have been doing just this with a couple of top10 finishes!)I prefer FPP but worry people wont be able to change from 3rd person which will split the community (people from the start in 3rd and newcomers drawn to 1stperson). Aside from that plenty of encouraging things.It runs on my trash pc smoothly even though my gfx is 1gb and about 5 years old. Performance surprisingly good.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I bought the game a few days back and it's safe to say that I'm hooked!I love the concept and how this company made this with the feedback of the community.Good things You can play solo duo of squad (3 or 4) which in my opinion is great for playing with friends have had a lot of fun in squad play. The amount of gear you need/find is perfect everywhere I drop out of the plane I'd manage to get all the weapons and medic stuff I need. Weapons are well balanced imo. Bad things The latency to some players is horrible and you will see that many of your shots won't do jack on these guys still they will be able to hit you when in cover.Not going over the optimalisation because everyone already has. My friends randomly disconnect of the game quiet often.. but you can just start a new game!Overall I'd recommend buying the game if you have a decent gaming rig. (I've got a i7 4770k 16b 1800 ram &amp a Gtx 1070x and getting overall 70fps on high). If you don't you might want to wait till the game get's a better optimalisation.Good fun with friends sometimes a bit laggy but I'd still recommend it (8.5 10).

review: Don't let the PUBG haters steer you wrong!This game is worth every penny! I am running my settings all on ultra and although I'll admit sometimes the environmnet will need to catch up with my computer it rarely takes long for it to do so. I have just now been experiening minor server errors because of the major increase of player activity. These clowns who have been seeing it longer probably have dinnosaur eggs as computers. I have been playing for a few months now and have yet to experience any of these so called "ban hammers" from the Devs. I've come to the realization that if you aren't a you don't get treated like one. However there are some fixes that need to be addressed like EVERY EARLY ACCESS game (I swear people forget this game is still in BETA!). Most of the complaints I have like vaulting walls getting graphics to load instantly changes of weather in game and more maps are already being addressed. One thing I would like to see is more uses for the ingame currency you acquire for surviving longer. The crates are kind of a rip. I only buy them in hopes of getting something rare to sell on steam. If you want a game that is a butt load of fun with or without a group PUBG is the one to try out. The rush is great! The play is Great! Gun fights are Great once you get the hang of it. If you wanna puss out hunker down in a building somewhere. If you wanna fight run the fields and catch someone offguard. People wanna tell you how to play but those types are the ones that clean DP. Find your style play your way and have fun!

review: Hitting 1 000 hours so I thought it'd be time to give this game a review. This game is only $30 and it has allowed me enough replayability that I have consistently since its release. There are plenty of issues with it many issues. The game will sometimes break maybe one patch will fix a lot of problems but then another one will come along and cause more. There are many cheaters that play the game and that can cause some problematic experiences.At the end of the day though this game gives you a chance to display your mettle against others and along with your friends. This game pits you in a battle with very good vehicle and gunplay in a format that is exhilerating and one that rarely showcases the same events more than once. Every time I step into a match I can expect a new experience which is why I love this game.

review: Gameplay is fun and unique. One of the most exciting games I have ever played. That being said PUBG is the most buggy game I have ever played. It crashes constantly and it was more stable in early access than it is in 1.0 form. I can't recommend it because I can no longer open the game because it crashes everytime I try to open the game. A lot of people will say that you have to change certain settings to have it be stable to play. No. The game should work especially if you've spent money purchasing it and buying anything in game. A free game I've installed that has been out for only a few weeks runs better on my 1 year old system than PUBG.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: So...pubg. Pubg is a game that I have very mixed feelings about.On the one hand it s literally one of the greatest multiplayer experiences to ever exist. No other game really does what pubg does...as well as pubg does. There are lots of knock offs but they all fail to recreate the same feeling.On the other hand the game is very deeply flawed frustrating and heading in a questionable direction.All in all I have to say my opinions are more positive than negative hence the positive review but again my impression of it is heavily mixed.So the game itself. You have giant maps full of cities country sides forests/jungles rocky cliffs etc. They are 8x8km in diameter with the newest one being smaller at 4x4. The bigger ones are larger than a fallout game or skyrim possibly on par with planetside 2 s maps. You have 100 players dropping in and the last one to survive wins. Players fight with anything they find at their disposal a wide array of military grade weapons vehicles even a frying pan. Honestly the thrill I get from playing this game is nothing like I experience in other games. Late game fights can be tense and cause your heart to pound. They re so good you ll be shaking when you re done from the adrenaline. Winning or even coming close to winning is an extremely satisfying experience I just don t get in other games. And I play TONS of shooters. But the thing is .the game is flawed. It was made by a small indie company that did not expect it to be a hit. That said the game has a lot of technical debt to pay. Performance is a mess. People with top end computers struggle with it on ultra and even computers capable of running any other game maxed out might need to settle for high or medium settings. If you want high frame rates you might even want to play on low or very low. Stuff takes a while to render and load at the beginning performance struggles as a result. There s a lot of lag in the game. People die when they shouldn t die get kills when they shouldn t get kills. What happens on your screen isn t necessarily what the game decides what happened. This can lead to lots of salt and rage.The game is very buggy. You might be cruising around in your vehicle only to tip over and randomly explode for no reason. You might tip over your vehicle get out and then it will magically try to up right itself by rolling over on top of you in the process. You might literally get launched across the map (they might have fixed that one I hope they fixed that one). Stuff sometimes doesn t render properly. The game is full of bugs and lag.The game also struggles due to its own success. It now has this massive community and attention from all of these professional gamers but many of them are souring on the game. They petition the devs to implement changes and then those changes tend to make the experience worse. There is a real demand in the community to make the game more fast paced. This is because streamers play fast paced and people want to emulate streamers. So instead of playing tactically people rush right into fights die early and then the people left complain about the game being too slow. Then they try to change the game to appeal to people who want it fast and it ruins it for those who want it slow and people get alienated from the game. And then you got the esports problem. This game is attracting a lot of attention from esports communities despite it not being particularly well suited for esports due to lots of RNG elements and the aforementioned technical debt and the devs start listening to an insular small extremely vocal group of minority pro gamers who want the game to become more hardcore. So they change the recoil patterns make them harder and then you got these esports players who like it that way despite it alienating more casual players. That said these pressures the devs face from the community complicate things because I feel like they shift pubg away from its roots as a slow tactical game to a more fast paced twitch based shooter despite it being poorly suited for that from the ground up. PUBG seems to be at a crucial point where it may turn its back on its roots that made it successful to pursue the whims of more vocal elements of the community who seem to want it to be something different than it actually is. If it were a completely different game say like what islands of nyne is trying to be it might work. In order to make the game fast paced and twitch heavy the game needs to be designed around that from the ground up. Movement has to be smooth. Instead it is sluggish. Maps need to be designed for fast paced combat instead outside of the newer one they aren t. The gun mechanics need to be more arcadey not realistic. Stuff needs to actually load in and render properly at the start of the round which they often don t because of the massive technical issues that are inherent to the game as it is designed. This game works when it s slow. It works when people play tactically and treat it as a realistic shooter. If they hide and use cover and spread out and try to survive as long as possible. But the second you try to make it fast paced and appeal more to the crowd who wants deathmatch and fast paced esports the game falls flat on its face. And that s where the game seems to be heading and in my opinion it may be the downfall of the game.Regardless before you think that I m gonna rip on pubg and give it a negative review despite all of this complaining I m not. Because pubg actually looks really good once you start comparing it to the rest of the battle royale genre. The two other major successes in the genre are arcadey cartoony games with a relatively fantasy setting that just doesn t do it for me. And most games I ve played that go for the more realistic approach just feel soulless at best or are flat out bad at worst. Honestly playing these games and coming back to pubg pubg is like 90% of the way there. It s a great game. It just needs a heck of a lot of polishing and it needs to stop trying to be something it s not to appeal to players who would be better off playing other games.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: awesome game. it is not perfect though and does have bugs that need to be weeded out but currently as it is right now its very fun and gives great entertainment.If someone gets easily frustrated this may not be the game for them. you will end up dying from stupid mistakes or just get flat out unlucky or someone will catch you completely off guard. Playing with friends will reduce the frustration.new players should expect to have a difficult time adapting to the game. in my experience the difficulty makes the game very rewarding once you win the first match and when u start consistently getting into the top 10 20some of the vehicle physics need to be worked on. for example you may hit something pretty hard but take little damage and then next you hit something while you are not going as fast but take higher damage. also has been instances where i have jumped out of a vehicle but my movement becomes super slow cannot run for a few seconds.one of the things i like is you can choose to start off passive or aggressive. want intense action from the start? drop at a place that is popular to drop to based on the flgiht path of the plane. would you rather be more passive and/or play it safe you can jump out and go to a spot that is less likely to have other players going to it.majority of my experience with this game is playing squad first person with friends. if i only played this by myself my experience could of been less favorable.

review: I usually don't write reviews but because I already have over 600 Hours in game I felt compelled to. I've mostly enjoyed the game for the months leading up to 1.0 release. I have found that I really enjoy the Battle Royale genre and the feeling of success being the last man standing out of 100 players in a match. Overall I have enjoyed the gaming experience that PUBG has to offer. I love everything from the range of available weapons and attachments to the unique combat situations that arise throughout a round of play. Once I started winning more frequently however I noticed I was running into more and more cheaters (mostly Chinese players joining NA servers). Now whether or not this is just bad luck or PUBG's MMR system I don't know. What I do know is that it has completely ruined the game for me and caused me to not even want to play anymore. It is near impossible to join a Third Person server without having multiple cheaters in the game. I enjoy TPP because it is what I'm used to from my days in H1Z1 and it's a different look from traditional FPS games like CS GO. I realize that people are reporting less of a problem with cheaters on FPP servers and I'll probably have to make the switch at some point. But if my preference is to play third person I should be able to do so without the fear of having multiple cheaters in the game with me. I find that my play style has changed considerably from what it was before knowing that there is almost guaranteed to be someone with an unfair advantage in any game I drop into. The addition of the replay system has only confirmed my suspicions. Most people don't even try to hide it. Before I would play more in the open and take most fights I would encounter. Now I find myself running from fights and moving from building to building to not get shot in the head from halfway across the map by a player with a SCAR aiming over their shoulder. It absolutely just sucks. I'm not normally one to complain about anything hell I could care less about desync and subpar netcode at this point. But from someone who used to really enjoy playing this game...please please...get rid of the cheaters and give ALL OF US the peace of mind to know that we have a fair chance at winning any game we queue up for. Ping Cap Region Lock better Anti Cheat whatever you have to do to combat this issue...Please do it.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: FINAL UPDATE have determined this game is NOT worth my time. the spontaneous updates yet constantly lacking game experience have totally and entirely deterred me from this game. i have not played it in a month and i am going to uninstall RIGHT NOW. amazingly one dimensional cheater and/or glitch ridden rage inspireing catastrophe which is worth exactly that. a rage catastrophe. DONT waste your time on this game when you could spend the time on much more fufilling game experiences like.....anything but this one..3/10 overall final revieweverything past here is OLD...In theory 10/10. right now 5/10. Every part of this game needs work combat feels very cumbersome and the sensitivities are totally ed up however it plays well considering how bare it is now. Would like to see this game get the treatment and upbringing it deserves. Okay for now with miles and miles of room for improvement.UPDATE okay so here we are...awhile after 1.0. Asian players have invaded NA servers and make the game unenjoyable (i would say unplayable but F***ing over a full squad of them is too entertaining). I am going to end up with hours upon hours of replay footage consisting solely of asian players where they dont belong doing the dumbest things all while not speaking a lick of English...or spanish...or french (i mean its a north american server shouts to the french canadians eh!) so...do the math. current state 6.5/10i recommend the game to anybody who can have fun with a game having (considerably) polished combat and tactical movement. dont buy if you like devs that dont listen to overwhelming demands from the community and reframe blame....we arent racist we want to be able to communicate as a team and enjoy the game.update UPDATE here i am countless hackers in game yet i cant play....servers too busy? probably because the world found out that you condone hacking.....

review: After 500 Hours of this game I can say that I really thought this game had massive potential.. I thought this game was going to be 'the game' (it was for a while) but they really did blow it away. It was a blast when it first came out. There were bugs in the game but I wasn't concerned as it was only an early access game and I was sure they would fix these with the release of 1.0.. Then there was the arrival of crates into the game. I was dissapointed that you had to buy keys to open some of the crates but it was a way to support the developers as they fixed the bugs in this game. The game was fully released around 7 months ago and we still see these bugs to this day. It feels like the game hasn't changed It's the same thing every time.

review: Wow Okay if anyone is planning on buying this game READ THIS And ignore a lot of the recent unjust hater reviews!Bluehole is a new indie developer and for what resourcesthey have/had have made an excellent PRE RELEASE GAMEKeep that in mind as there are a few technical issues and the game is a little clunky in places .. But as it stands It was a genre breaker and the 'micro transactions' everyoneis ing about only manages to cloth your character..(I did it for a little less than $3.00 USD and look ing)So unless you are some pauper or shoe shiner it should notbe considered a negative thing Considering for the priceI look badass!Yes they stated 'no micro transactions' but back to thefirst thing I said they are a SMALL INDIE DEVELOPERand need a contiunal cash flow to keep coffee in the breakroom and those blue pucks in the toilets.. they arent free!As for gameplay I have a pretty standard system Core I5 750 2.6ghz20gb DDR3 RamGeforce 1050GTXAnd run the game almost flawlessly at maxed detail. Nowfrom a developer standpoint being pre release means un optimized code and therefore potential memoryleaks and high demand on memory (hence my 20gb..which really wasn't too expensive considdering it opensthe door to play beta games reasonably well)So what it boils down to is...GREAT BLOODY GAMETOO MANY OVERLY SENSITIVE WHINER REVIEWS (Q.Q)So either get a violin and feel sorry for yourselfORSTRAP ON A HELMET AND GET IN THE GAME (Unf unf unf)

review: My Sixth Refund case... Aspect Annotation Graphics Audio and Design OOOOOO Graphical level of this game can be described with a word of poor textures are critically outdated SFX don't live up to expectations animations are clunky. The Design is as mediocre as it can be in this type of games a big and at the same time empty island with copy/pasted houses and evergreen forests filled with boilerplated guns like M16 or AKM. Gameplay OOOOOOOO Eh it's a very boring even more boring than Arma 3 camper battles. A group of 90 players land on a large map and then try to kill each other no respawns or concessions given. It's a heaven for said campers gankers and regular DayZ players. Miserable and easily forgettable gameplay that bursts with boredom to put it briefly. Stability and Online OOOOOOOOO It's pathetic. I've had 2 crashes in a row in just 10 minutes after starting my first match. The optimization is also awful it sometimes drop down to 39 and even when it shows 60 some really annoying stutters hold their ground. The online for this game is HUGE for some awkward reason though so finding players for a match takes literally a couple of seconds. Overall 2.5/10 This overpriced excuse for a game is a joke. It's not even close to being ready for an early access release. And then there are lots of other of these "battle royale" type of games that are much cheaper with some of them even being just a free gamemodes from the workshop so it's not that crucial to pass PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS by. and YES 38 minutes of playtime is more than enough since that gewgaw is just a primitive shooter. There is no casual shooter that you can't learn to play in 20 minutes. And given that it's just a torn off battle royale gamemode I've had experience with it before.

review: Game started off as really good. It was fun and interesting to play. Now it's just died out. The devs forgot they actually need to implement gameplay to compete with the market. As much as you want to give it Fortnight actually has gameplay and doesn't even cost anything to play. This game runs terrible too. I could forgive it if it actually looked good too but it doesn't its just horribly unoptimized. The devs want to implement a loot crate and key system for cosmetics (I guarentee they'd give you weapons with these crates at the start of the game if they knew they could get away with it though) with some of the worst drop chances I've ever seen in a game that already asks for $30 to start. The start of the games is pretty fun just running around in a Hunger Games competition but after the first 50 players die (and they die quickly because most of them are just bots trying to get random drops) the game devolves and just isn't interesting. Most of the time I gear up and get stuck wondering "what do I do now?" until I get sniped from across the play zone. Hackers are also a huge problem in the game. To put the cherry on top the devs have lost it at this point. They ushered in a new type of gamemode and it's good don't get me wrong but they seem to think they have a copyright on it and go after anybody making something similar. This hurts both the industry and the gamer. With no competition this game would have no reason to get better until it inevitably dies out.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I have played this game for just shy of 800 hours since launch. It has slowly been improving the game is enjoyable with friends but pretty tilting at times playing solo with some of the issues that happen server side. I would highly recommend buying this game if you have friends who play it and they want to duo or squad. I am really hoping that when 1.0 launched (fingers crossed) that it will be a better game that brings players back. With it being an early access game I give it a higher benefit of the doubt that it will get better. I will be revisiting this review once 1.0 is launched (again fingers crossed). At the time being I will give it a 6/10 for server issues but a 9/10 for fun with friends.I will say I recommend this game to friends who want to play just because it i s so much fun with friends. Take it with a grain of salt some of the issues are very wide spread and sometimes hinder game play. That is why with 1.0 coming out I am hoping these issues are fixed. If not I will be changing this whole review to negative.

review: Do you like cash grabs made by the same people over and over again that never truly fix or improve on their old mistakes?If yes this game is for you!Developer incompetence that's liable to get you killed in situations where you have clear cut opportunities to win consistent starting server lag (just because it's loaded in doesn't mean it's loaded in!?) erratic server lag throughout matches (up to 3 seconds delay "network desyncs") client server inconsistencies (false positives of hits smoke grenades permeating in different directions for different clients doors closing on your client but not on an opponent's client allowing them to see through the door etc.) corpse collision permanence (can't move around a fallen comrade's corpse to escape/chase) etc.Then there's also the possibility of servers closing down right before a winner is determined or just your client crashing.It also arbitrarily alters your settings.Despite the swell of programming liabilities to your individual gameplay and enjoyment the core concept is entertaining (although not even remotely original).

review: Disclaimer I run the game on my desktop ( i7 8700k GTX 1080ti 32gb RAM ) and my laptop ( i7 7700hq GTX 1060 16gb RAM ) so this review might not be representative of the ''average'' gamer who's playing this game. At the time of this review I have about 800 hours of playtime. First of all yes there is some bugs but I haven't experienced many maybe I'm just lucky. Most if not all of the bugs I have experienced weren't ''gamebreaking'' either. I also believe that if you've played 200 + hours of a game even if it pisses you off afterward you got your money worth. And with PUBG no worries you'll get your money worth of in game time ! There's so many locations playstyle and weapons to master that you won't be bored of the game easily.As far as performance go for me it's fine but older systems with no SSDs will struggle. It's a ''recent'' game and it requires recent hardware for the experience to be enjoyable. I personally wouldn't play the game if I didn't have at minimum a GTX 1060 6gb or a RX 580 8gb. The game also struggles on ''weaker'' single/quad cores processors like AMD's Ryzen line up for example ( the lower tiers one if you have a 1700 and above you'll be perfectly fine ).This is the kind of game like it's predecessor arma 2 and 3 where you need great hardware to fully enjoy your experience but weaker hardware will run the game it might not be the best experience however. I ran the game on a secondary laptop with a i7 6500u and a 960m 4gb to give you an idea.The ''crates'' debacles personally doesn't affect me if I want a skin I just buy it from the market but there's not needed I also got a couple from my Amazon prime subscription ( which translate to twitch prime ). I think this game is the best battle royal available currently and it's definitely worth playing. Now maybe some people will disagree but to each his opinion.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: has a decent amount of bugs but all are small and they don't affect the gameplay that much and its nothing more than a game in early access should have. the real problem lies in the amount of rng and core mechanics of the game. without any way to guarentee getting yourself a competent weapon in a match a large amount of the games you play you just feel helpless and waiting for someone with range to pick you off as you move through the map and make it to the final circle. third person mechanic combined with the reliance on sound almost encourages campers to find a good camping spot and not move an inch. and even if the person isnt camping stale gameplay is bound to happen as rushing/advancing enemies is 10x harder than defending the rush as someone can just hide behind a wall and peek around it without risking their safety. and just pop out on their terms with full sight of their opponent giving them an easy free shot instead of the odds being closer to 50/50. air drops will drop the best gear in the game but due to their random flight paths and drops not being easily trackable trying to actually persue the best gear isn't even worth it unless it drops right next to you or you're already on your way to the location of the drop. the game is about 75% luck and then 25% being good at their mechanics. their trying to make the game more focused on first person which in theory would make it more like other first person shooters out there and easier to learn and be good at but the way the controls feel right now it feels terrible and nobody is interested in the first person ques at the moment. its going to take them a long time to clean up the gameplay and make it feel better to play if they want people to take it seriously. the highs you get in this game are like no other especially if you have a group of 3 other friends you can play with and joke around and dont take the game too seriously. but for 30 dollars i can positively say i do not recommend this game for new people interested in it.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: TL DR Fun yet highly overhyped definitely not worth the full price until at least the game is better optimised and most bugs and glitched are fixed. The game is fun for the first few matches and after winning a match the player will feel an amazing surge of excitement. However there are far too many bugs and problems with the game that become more and more clear as you play the game. The most irritating problems with PUBG are the cheaters and lag. There are countless times where after shooting an entire magazine into an enemy does not kill them because the server was not able to keep up and as a result the enemy kills you before you can reload. The game is fun. However the game still poorly optimised has yet to properly deal with the cheaters and fix the netcoding of the game.

review: Fun game but I can't recommend it due to the developers. They're greedy and sue their competition in South Korea just to have a chance at winning. paid progression system in a $30 dollar game w/ lootbox based microwagers. If you want to play battle royale here's four different games made by people not nearly as much of an as Bluehole and PUBG Co Fortnite (not the game for me but I can see the appeal. Will recommend because it's free honestly).Realm Royale (Fortnite but without building and some small class based combat that's at least something different. Also free).Totally Accurate BattleGrounds (It's 5$ made in the span of 3 weeks and has no right to be as good as it is for an April Fool's joke).Hunt Showdown (Yeah it's in early access and a bit buggy. But the concept just has so much more variety to it than your standard BR. There's actual character progression permadeath and even an objective to complete rather than being the last one alive. NPC enemies are actually a threat and bosses are are a great idea that just needs some polishing. Bit pricey but worth a try).
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This is a genre defining game that you should play. Nothing beats the adrenaline rush of trying to survive against 99 of your best enemies in squads or in solo play. It's a little rough around the edges but I'm confident that the game will be mirror polished by the time it exits Early Access. The developer has proven to be communicative aggressive about cheating and deeply interested in the competitive / Twitch scene. This has all the makings of being the next really big thing.Like many games there are now some microtransactions for completely optional visual stuff that has absolutely no gameplay value whatsoever. It's great if you're into that sort of thing and utterly ignorable if you're not. Personally I like the skins and such but if it's not your cup of tea (or if you simply don't like games with pay to win aspects) you don't have to engage with them at all to be on a level playing field.Overall it's probably the most engaging game I've played since League of Legends with its immediate appeal high mastery curve and extreme watchability. I love every aspect of the game and I suspect many millions of us are going to be playing it for a long time.

review: My review for this game used to be positive but I think I've changed my mind the large amount of negatives definitely outweigh the small amount of positives. You're about to hear a review which you've definitely heard before but I think it's necessary that everyone that thinks the same way put up the same review so here are my thoughts on Player Unknown's Battlegrounds.I could see what they were going for a tactical shooter were players could go rogue in solo mode or play in teams in duo or squad mode. But when you're playing squad with a bunch of kids they just don't understand the game and they wander off and get themselves killed. So it's better to just play solo by yourself but even there you will find problems. Hackers! Hackers everywhere (here come the memes). Remember that kid who wandered off on his own and got killed you know who probably killed him a hacker there's just so many of them now hardly anyone can play the game without finding one of these hackers. If they actually had an anti cheating software on this game (at the time I'm writing this review there is none) it would actually stop a lot of the hackers but since it doesn't hackers all get onto the game and kill a bunch of people to feel like they've won something which they shouldn't have getting an anti cheating software would also make it a somewhat better game but they still would have to fix a number of things such as Sh**ty Servers (you need to live in Asia or Europe or have the worlds best internet connection) Sh**ty Performance (you need the world's best gaming computer to play this despite what the spec minimum is) False stream sniping bans (basically if you kill a streamer EVEN if you didn't know they were one you get banned /) Kids squealing and screaming (I know this isn't fixable it's just plain annoying) Flimsy shooting (To me the shooting feels strange and flimsy I don't like it)Even with these all fixed they probably still would have even more things that they need to fix. I don't like this game at all believe it or not I used to enjoy it but now I realise how bad it is. So Player Unknown's Battlegrounds I'm afraid gets a thumbs down from me.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Here's my honest take for this game.PROS 4 big mapsWeapon mods with combinationsFun gameplay. What else can I describe? It's pure battle royale game.CONS LootboxesServers are too busy. CrashesSoundtracks are terribleCrates within lootboxesCheatersCluster UI design. The fonts are ridiculous same with sound effects.Toxic fanbaseCrappy company. Hey hey listen here instead of fixing their crap or optimization they've once put effort to put a camel toe on female underwears (test servers). I'm no feminist or SJW or some shet but don't they have anything else to do rather pull this dumb shit?Cringe name. One of the worst triple A video game names I have ever seen in my life.Forces you to play Squad by automatically enabling that in the lobby without ever knowing you're on solo.Lack of player costumization. Like... Do you ever wonder why Fortnite is a very success game? Because skins. Players can pay like 10 dollars to get their battle pass and get skins along the way by doing challenges plus some rewards even have in game currency. That's amazing. This trash however doesn't. Hell even H1Z1 gives out free lootboxes and free cool clothes unlike this trash. Hell if you want to change your player's face hair (now it free) gender you'll need to pay in game currency and it's about... probably 2 days of full game time to have enough. How pathetic is that?Unpolished and the maps are unnecessarily LARGE. For maps this large I think it's about 250 PLAYERS to be enough to fit in these maps. It just takes forever to walk to another tower. Even with some vehicles.Uneccesary match timer. Wait 60 seconds after we got all the players like just what the why?Bad cheap a s s engineVery bad optimization. Check my setup in my profile if you're curious. But I don't think it matters because the game is very stiff.Robotic animations and movements. It's so unsatisfying it's horrible.Objects and doors are awkwardly misplaced4/10The game needs alot of improvements a ton of bugfixes and imo the biggest is to give the players (who BOUGHT IT and mostly paid COSMETICS on MARKET) some respect. Give them some free skins.I do not recommend this game to anyone.

review: Slow paced battle royale game that is quite polished but still has issues with bullet reg and weird car mechanics. The "boots on the ground" aspect of the game makes it good in the sense that it is predictable and the vehicles can make you go across the map quicker however this repedetive pattern makes for a quite repetetive and boring experience in the long run. The matches blends in to eachother after a while and since an average game takes around 25 30 minutes with 15 20 minutes being either looting or running. This game trash. Get outta here atleast untill the snow map comes out

review: So out of early access here's some pro's and con's because fk a long review Pro's Heart pounding CQB Looks good Guns are really fun to shoot A blast with friends Can sometimes be really rewarding... HOWEVER Con's RNG can make this running/driving simulator 2017 Server lag Overall poorly optimized even after everything (people with 1080's even having troubles sometimes) Blatent cheaters are common (God mode one tap from hundreds of meters away speed hacks etc). In my experience about 1/5 games. Leaves you wondering why you play this game every time.

review: This is the best game I have bought in a while. Although I can only play in medium settings due to my computer I havn't had any issues in game with things like lagging or stuff not rendering in properly.The whole PvP survival aspect of this game is great and is fun for those of us that prefer the stealthy approach rather then run and gun games.The only thing I don't like is the Circle Mechanic. I understand that it helps keep games down in play time however I think it would be better if you either had more time before it started to close in on you or that you would at least be able to out run it on foot.

review: *Updated as of March 2nd*I recently took a vacation away from PUBG as I was running into lag and hacks every other game. It killed the buzz completely and I wasn't going to address this game any further till something got sorted out. And while they haven't region locked China like everyone's been asking I will say that the ping locking in the recent update has indeed changed DRASTICALLY how my experience has been. I dove back into it with a few pals after the update and the amount of China and hacks has decreased dramatically and it's been fun as hell again for me. PUBG is taking the right steps into fixing one of their biggest issues and when I say fixed I mean it has been fixed quite well. It ain't perfect but it definitely got me right back into the game. So if ya haven't picked it up since the newest update please give it a go again. As someone who was sick of it and now has gotten abck into it I definitely recommend it.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I have heard both good and bad reviews for this game but I cannot deny that above all this game is FUN! it's a weird brand of fun though and I know it's not for everyone ( different strokes for different folks and all that ) sure it has it's problems but it's still in it's infancy and it's already massively popular for good reason. Don't be mislead by those that condemn this game for it's micro transactions ( for the love of pete it's only for cosmetic items like t shirts and ball caps ) and besides the developers are only following the business patterns of the industry and you can't fault them for wanting to get paid for a product they are selling. If you don't want to spend your parents hard earned money on crates you dont have to. The idea of the game is solid fresh and above all FUN! ( there's that word again you spoiled mouth breathing trolls remember fun yeah? ) it's a no hold barred shootfest across a massive island that has more character and soul than anything triple A developers in the industry are pumping out every six months and it doesnt even have a single player campaign you loot scoot and shoot your way to an ever decreasing playing field all the while looking over your shoulder for the guy or gal that's going to fill you full of lead or run you over with a jeep or pummel you with a frying pan Samwise Gamgee style or blow you up with a frag grenade heck you could even have the misfortune of being hit by one of the many random artillery strikes that occur all across the map to discourage camping sure sometimes i last as long as a 16 year old boy losing his virginity on prom night but you can just back out once you're dead and go at it again (like a 16 year old boy on prom night) rinse and repeat over and over again until you've had enough punishment and call it quits (or rage quit if your mum doesn't or didnt hold you enough).the one issue I personally have the biggest problem with is no mic mute. So for the first minute or so while you wait to deploy your auditory senses are treated to the chorus of spastics who will wail curse rock out attempt to rap use every curse word in the english (and other) language eat thier mics call eachother homosexuals proclaim that *insert name of country here* is number one tell eachother to shut up and generally be belligerent and abusive (so par for the course for online gaming). There are other minor issues but my current PC is only able to run the game smoothly on low graphics settings and it still looks and plays very well never has a surefire kill been stolen from me due to lag or glitches of any kind. I was skeptical of this game for a while which is why it took me so long to purchase and play but i have no regrets about my purchase and i only have high hopes for the future of this fine peice of electronic entertainment. 9/10 I would definitely reccomend this game to anyone who enjoys a good contemporary shoot em up.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: PUBG has come a VERY long way. A friend of mine encouraged me to get the game prior to its official release in December 2017 and at the time a 980ti would be sweating trying to squeeze out 45 fps. TODAY however the game feels so buttery smooth in comparison. I love seeing companies pump out updates every week to ensure the slow but steady improvements of a game and these guys have done just that. Obviously the game has been "officially" released for a year now this month but as you can see with the latest addition to the game with the winter map they are still staying on top of it and every month the game feels smoother. I've had some awesome moments with friends the last year and I would highly recommend.

review: looking forward to it being optimized and smoother and less buggy but for what it is it is a whole lot of fun and rather intense to play. I enjoy the option to go into the 100 person battle alone or with 1 other person or with a squad of 4.The need to keep moving to the circle keeps it interesting and games can still last a while.The controls/ movement could use work but this is an early access game so i imagine it will only get better.Driving feels alright a bit clunky but works. The guns all feel pretty deadly and can take someone down in 1 3 shotsI would reccomend this game to anyone who enjoys survival/battle royale type games who can also be patient to wait for this game to fullfill its potential.The only bugs i have is when im loading into a match sometimes the loading screen stays for much too long after the game has already started or it just stays and never stops loading. Or upon first landing on the ground the buildings dont load at all and my fps halts. I can run games like witcher 3 on high/ultra and others but i get bad fps right now with this game if i put the settings on high or ultra.

review: PUBG was a game that was amazing in every way except execution.You could find thousands of reviews going over what went wrong but I'll just stick to a single thing the clothing. I'm all for customizable features but incorporating them with the steam market was a mistake of ungodly proportions. This invited people to farm for crate drops as much as they could (AFKing then later on blatantly cheating) to get as many clothes as they can and sell them on the steam market for steam bucks (which was funneled in a variety of ways to real income). This pushed out a lot of honest players and by the time Bluehole got around to dealing with cheaters (like placing soft region locks after calling its playerbase xenophobic) it was too late. You're left with a game mainly inhabited by cheaters bots and the occasional dummy like me who thinks the game can be fixed. In the midst of implementing microtransactions to squeeze every last buck they can out of the game Bluehole squeezed every last hope for one of the giants in a formerly niche market making any kind of comeback. For the considering buyer don't. Wait for another title that does the battle royale genre justice (assuming you won't play fortnite).

review: PLAYERUNKNOWNS BATTLEGROUNDS REVIEWBattlegrounds came out very recently on steam as an early access title but has already gained a massive following with 150 000 people currently playing daily including myself. That is no small feat considering the 26.99 purchase fee which is a lot higher than most early access titles. I purchased this game based on the hype surrounding it and straight off I can tell you that the hype is justified and is a really fun and addictive game. It suffers from in game lag and lack of polish however but most of the time that doesn t detract much from the experience. Battlegrounds is a Hunger games battle royale type of game where one hundred people are dropped onto an island and must fight to the death until there is one man/group remaining. The best way to explain it is actually with the use of other titles within this genre because it s as if ARMA and H1Z1 had a baby. ARMA is known for being hyper realistic and H1Z1 has a very arcade feel. Battlegrounds sits in the middle of the two and being all the better for it.The island you are on is pretty big and if you play carefully and have some luck it is quite possible to not meet anyone until the very end but you should always be prepared to fight so that is why when you land you should be searching buildings around you as quickly as possible to find loot. Anything from assault rifles to backpacks to helmets It all could be useful and it is up to the player to decide what they should take and what should be left behind. The best moments of this game is the tense seconds of hearing shooting in the distance and wondering if you will win the next battle for survival Or the need to move through an open field feeling paranoid because someone could be watching from a distance. All fights are awesome as it really feels like a battle for survival even if some of the controls are a bit clunky. Punching and jumping for example need work and I am sure they will be sorted out due to the developers rigid and functioning update structure.Not only do you need to think about all the people about to shoot you in the back but you need to be conscious of the electric field that slowly closes in around the map to push the survivors closer together forcing the last people to fight it out. This pushes you to either drive (if you can find a car) or trek across the map making you always try to be aware of your surroundings. I personally love this mechanic because you have to adapt to your current situation and reevaluate it every couple of minutes while being aware that any random encounter with anyone could happen. You just have to hope that you are better equipped than them. To top it all off supply drops land in open areas with the best equipment inside but you can be sure you will have to fight people to get the treasure within. The entire game takes strategy to win. Do you sneak around or are you strong enough to take the fight to the enemy. Do you wait for a battle to end and take out the victor or do you retreat into one of the games main cities. It s all up to you and needs to be reassessed on a moment to moment basis.Audio is great and you can tell where gunfire is coming from just by listening carefully. There is no music to speak of but that is so you can listen for doors opening footsteps approaching or vehicles going past you. It s all directional and very helpful. Graphics are pretty poor but that isn t really an issue to me. If you are looking for a game with good graphics however maybe this isn t the game for you unless you can look past them. Currently the optimisation is even worse. I have an i7 processor and a GTX 1080 graphics card and I have to run it on medium settings and even then I get drops. Though I believe this will be fixed within a future update. I just hope it s sooner rather than later.Having friends to play with I believe really adds to the experience. I have been playing the DUO mode with a friend and we have been having a great time protecting and strategising with eachother and I can see hundreds of hours being poured into this game and even more as it develops further. Other cool things that I want to mention before wrapping this review up is that you can customise the look of your character. There are many weapon attachments such as silencers and scopes. Boats are drivable though even more rare than working cars. There are red zones that change throughout a match that get shelled with explosives so its best to get in the nearest building. Finally this game can be played in third or first person and both are really well implemented.In conclusion this game is definitely worth your time if you are into the survival genre or just want something different to satisfy your multiplayer gaming urges. hopefully every issue I have listed will be fixed and the game will be developed further. If I had to give it a score it would be an 8 out of 10. Thank you for reading I should be reviewing this game again in a years time.Written reviews here https //blitzzreviews.wordpress.com/2017/04/01/playerunknowns battlegrounds early access review/

Like 6 people.I'm terrible at shooting and worse at aiming but I still find the game enjoyable.EDIT The game is now no longer Early Access. However it's still riddled with bugs. Probably even more so than when it was in Early Access. This game is 100% not ready to be official but it was only pushed forward to try and make more money despite the game not being finished.Wouldn't recommend until these issues are fixed.

review: meh 1.0 launch still didn't help. Random luck generator. U might get decent gear but you probably wont. Almost every single person when you're playing squads suggest you got to high traffic areas then they die instantly leaving you alone vs teams of people while blaming you for not doing more when you haven't even found a gun yet.. Or you go there and you yourself are shot instantly while thinking how the did he get a gun already!? Sometimes in high traffic areas I've run through 5+ houses without even finding a pistol and I was the first one in the house so no one had looted it then bam shot in the back on the way to the 6th house. When you take the time to go to a low traffic area and loot you still have a good chance of not getting essentials for late game. I've gone 10 rounds in a row before without finding anything beyond a red dot just to get sniped by people whos shot i can barely hear and definitely can't see. It annoys me because my k/d/a on COD and halo are epic yet i can't seem to be good at this game because you rarely get good gear. How am I supposed to kill all these snipers witha pistol? I just reinstalled to check out 1.0 and played for 5 hrs now and still I've gotten ONE scope that was above a red dot. Same thing over and over I can see a teeny tiny sillhouette of a guy whos body is the size of the dot of my red dot scope and I know he's there but i can't accurately hit him while he lands a single perfect head shot on me to end me.

The game is optimized like so my settings have to be turned way down. It also tends to have issues when connecting to servers or other people. For example tonight when I was with a squad trying to get into a game it took all of us refreshing our UI probably 5 times to get the damn game to let us ready up. So those issues are frustrating but if you can look past them PUBG is a very fun tactical battle royale game. I wish that the devs would focus more on optimization than on climbing over walls but it is what it is.

review: This game is getting a bunch of negative reviews. Here's my take I've played off and on for about a year. It's improved a lot. Lots of new weapons vehicles clothing and a total of three maps. I find that all the maps provide a much different experience and are all enjoyable.People complain about cheaters desync the devs and a whole load of other stuff. I don't know for sure whether I've been killed by a cheater yet or not. Usually I die because I did something stupid gave away my position fired when I didn't have a certain kill shot or drove straight into enemy fire. I've gotten first place I've gotten 99th place. I usually kill zero to 1 player a game so by no means am I an "elite" player and probably wouldn't rank as even a "good" player. But I feel that I'm getting better simply by knowing the maps so well. I enjoy the stealth aspect and sneaking my way into the top 10 even if I never fired a shot.I very much enjoy the solo rounds but it's a lot of fun to team up with friends to wreak havoc. Nothing like completely disagreeing on strategy three people sneaking while one is running wide open and engaging everyone they find. Lots of laughs as well as very intense moments.Overall if I have a free evening I'll gladly board onto the PUBG plane jump out and fight it out with 99 other souls. Other games I enjoy are X Com 2 Darkest Dungeon TF2 and Skyrim.

The game's graphics are very detailed with realism straight down to the bushes and grasses. I love how the game relys on luck that just makes your heart pound faster and faster until you kill your opponent or you get killed.This game was unlike any other I had played before and I don't regret buying this I would recommend this game toward people who love playing with friends or just relaxing after a hard defeat from a competitive in Overwatch or CSGO I would also recommend this game to those who love first and third person shooters and love guns and battle royals all rolled into one.

review: This game has no much potential but it's plagued with cheaters and bugs. I had to reinstall the damn game in order to get past the black loading screen bug. I constantly get errors when trying to equipt gear. This game has no business being out of early access. The cheating is out of control and Bluehole refuses to do anything about. Perhaps admitting there is a problem will be bad PR. Getting killed by xxchianhuangxx from across the map by a full auto at hip fire is not fun. Neither is being shotgunned from across the map. Being stuck in a black loading screen with the PUBG logo which doesn't go away until my team has already landed is also not fun. Fortnite is simply the better game. It's WAY more optimized. It doesn't have a problem with hackers/cheaters. It's just a better game period. Please close off China from the West Bluehole. That will solve a significant amount of the cheating. Until you do that I'm probably going to stop playing this game. For people looking for a Battle Royale game get Fortnite. PUBG is not worth the time and effort. You put all this work getting yourself into a good tactical position just to be cheated out of a win.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game is pretty good for an Early Access title. I really enjoyed the early days of DayZ and this game brings back a similarly thrilling atmosphere with all the boring parts of the aforementioned walking simulator cut out.Pros Graphics are pretty good. Gameplay is intense and combat is extremely rewarding when you get a kill. It doesn't take very long to get into a match. The map has interesting unique locations and while there are some copy pasted buildings there are much more memorable locations compared to other games of the same genre. The devs seem very involved in updating this game so far with two new maps rumored to be on the horizon. Sound design is on point. You will want to wear headphones when playing this game so you can hear your enemies.Cons Not well optimized. Be prepared to run certain settings on Very Low Medium. They had to remove flashbangs because the performance problems with them were so bad they were freezing some clients. Gameplay can feel clunky which can be both a good or bad thing. Third person gunplay makes defensive play very strong. This might be remedied by a first person mode in the future. Some people may find solo mode boring so you may want to also convince your friends to buy this game as well for more fun.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Acceptable.Looting 10/10Every time I land at some populated area 1st item I find is always a handgun or 5 bandages. Then door opens and here comes a guy with the shotgun.Fighting 10/10With this new killcam I truly understand that its not my fault I lose fight sometimes. Like a day ago 2 guys in 2 different games killed me shooting the ground... Oh well... No comment on "missing bullets"Graphics 10/10Like who could possibly ever guess that in 2k17 we gonna play games at low settings just because its OPAF and laggy as hell?Difficulty 10/10Some say you have to outsmart your enemy to get this chicken dinner. Some say you just have to be good at shooting stuff. But I say there are only 2 things that really matter POSITION and LUCK. That's it. No matter whay you do and how good are you at shooting but it does matter where this stupid circle will be at the end of a game.Does it worth a damn?For sure! Especially if you play with your friends! This gives you so much fun PP.S. This all sounds like a joke and makes you think I hate this game but its not true. I like it and I play it. Special thanks to devs for this new map and game changes. I do enjoy it alot.

review: All in all this game has the making to be a lot of fun but is poorly managed and operated. The gameplay itself is a lot of fun especially with friends. There are a lot of very frustrating things about this game that could easily be fixed and improved by the development team but have not changed. They have a function to report team killers and cheaters but is very selective on who you can report. You cannot just report anyone cheating. You can only report the person who killed you. The team has certainly put more work into the mobile port of this game than they have the PC verson. The mobile version has a shooting range to better familiarize yourself with the guns and shooting dynamics. It also has an arcade mode that proves to be arguably much more fun than the normal mode. The PC version only has prmotional game modes on weekends and does not have a gun range. Overall great game but very poorly managed by developers.

review: 200 hours in so far absolutely a very fun game if you play alone with a friend or with a group.Regular updates for bug fixes and additional content with an actual roadmap for releasing the game out of Early Access.You can play the game as aggressive or passive as you want can feel like walking simulator 2017 if you get unlucky. Gunplay is pretty good melee system is a bit lacking but isnt the main focus.I wouldn't say I like the RNG of the redzone randomly blowing you up sometimes even if it is rare but again this is uncommon.The first circle is around the millitary island 1/2 of the time which is quite annoying seeing as it is 1/5 of the map area at most.Overall 8/10 very enjoyable absolutely worth it at full price unlike most games on PC.
