review: Let me start by saying. I do very much enjoy playing this game most of the time. It has alot of things I look for in a shooter."One death no respawn garbage!" . Everyone has the same luck of the draw when it come to weapons when they drop from the plane. No Micro transactions for weapons " just clothes" Its very tactical. If you get the right team with mics can be alot of fun. Im sure one day the game will be fun again. At this point its loaded with Hackers/Cheaters/Bugs. Its very rare to load into a server without a Cheater of some sort. The game is also very poorly optimized. "The listed store page requirments are not even close!" and that fix is long over due. The devs seem to be running it cash grab style. they dont seem to care about hackers or the poor servers they have and poor optimization of the game insted they are focused on there console release "more money" soon they will be polishing a turd! I can not at this time. Recommend this game . Maybe if they start focussing on the pc version update the servers and fix the hacking/cheating..... Cheater Sim 2017!!!!!

review: Alot of fun so far definately shows promise. Alot easier to get into than Dayz was when I initially played that and more user friendly. But don't expect it to be easy I thought I was going good for a while but it was mainly that I didn't come across people in a few matches since then i've died within like 5 minutes.. but atleast in this game I know they aren't 'friendlies' and it's expected unilke Dayz where it's annoying to always get killed by everyone.Unfortunately it's not without it's bugs. The most annoying bug by far is the microphone not working randomly match to match and sometimes takes multiple times exiting the game completely and going back in to fix it. That doesn't matter if you play single but playing with teams a mic is needed.You will get killed alot and then have to load a whole other match which can be annoying sometimes. But it's all pretty fun and addictive.EDIT Due to the microphone bug which after the first day I got it has been CONSISTENTLY not working i've changed my review to negative. It ruins the most fun match which is team and is almost a deal breaking bug and TONS of people are having it yet the thread about it on their forum was closed down.

review: I was going to give this a thumbs up. I was going to write an amazing review. Today 10/14/2017 1004 this is the day PUBG died. A growing number of cheaters are about to ruin this game. It has finally gotten to the point of an early access game that its cheating problem is noticeable. Buy this game if you dont mind dealing with cheaters. It has the potiental to be a great game. I was going to say many good things about it. Buy at your own risk. I would wait to see how the developers address cheating. BattleEye? That was their big idea to help address the problem. If EPIC address the cheating problem. FORTNITE is the game you should problay try. Come on PUBG Corp...Fix your problem before its too late...Dont end up like all the other failed Early Access. I want to see this game make it but its already going down the path of all other early access. Good luck
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Not recommended mainly because the performance that is really not optimized well for a game this size.Maybe If you got a good rig I can say try this out (even though there are people who have high end PC that are still complaining about the performance) but unfortunately for i5 4460 GTX 750 (2GB) and 8GB RAM A.K.A. Trash user like me it's unplayable with very low settings it's around 30 FPS max with frequent drops to 9 12 FPS (Could even down to 1 2 FPS lol).I actually didn't expect that this game would be so heavy to handle for my system since I can run older AAA games like GTA V in medium to high settings.Since it doesn't work for me and this game is just your typical battle royale game I wouldn't recommend it. I'm sorry but as popular as it is now I believe there are better battle royale games out there.

review: This game is very toxic how in the world can people play this game?? This game never ever gets updates like how other Battle Royal games do for example fortnite... Then you got the people who hide the whole game with no kills and will watch you pass them and then kill you.... The community for this game is absolutely absurd I understand that this type of game is considered a "Tactical Shooter" but man people play like a bunch of babies... Fortnite or any other BR game our there would easily beat this title... I've played this game since the very first release of this game and man when I say this game gets no serious updates this game gets no serious updates. How in the world do I run this game with 45 55 FPS with a 1070 i5 on low graphics and downscaled resolution?? Any other game I play and run I can get up to 100 plus FPS. This game also reminds me of running simulator by how much you have to run just to make it to zone which then you get shot in back by a camping 3rd person abusing loser who has no kills and wins with 1 kill... Not even including that the last couple of circles are completly random and that shouldn't be the case the next/ending circles should be near the middle of the previous circle not completly random... This game is a bust and would not recommend it to anyone unless your want to be filled with rage and hatred. And don't even get me started on how long this game is in early access still... Fortnite is about to be out of early access and it was released not to long ago... This game needs more time and updates before I even think about touching it again with my boys...

review: Was a bit sceptical at first because of the price...Buuuut its actually pretty good and fun despite im running it on a potato GTX 690! Its hard and its supose to be hard you have to keep an eye out in every direction because its you VS 99 other players or if you feel like having a friend or 3 you can do duo or team matches too.You can play it whatever way you like kind of if you feel the need for thrill jump in on the same location as lots of other players. Nothing beats dropping in on the same few buildings with multiple enemies and running like crazy to find a gun to be the champ of the drop. Example Run in the same door as another guy.He skips the crowbar laying there.I pick up the crowbar laying there.He found a gun in the next room.I smack him in the back of the head with the crowbar while he was reloading the new found gun.I took the gun too.Ran into the next room to accidently run by another guy.Both turn around in 180 and fire as crazy.I died.I rejoined a new match.And it even made me order a GTX 1050 to run it more smoothly damn you addictiveness!

review: PUBG is the best shooter I've played in a long while. Partialy because of its realistic gun work with hard to aim shots partialy because of its strategical enviroment in which you don't have to memorize the map and be the god of reflex in order to get kills. It's both a mental and skill game combined. The best player at shooting may lose in the first minute of game because he jumped at a crowded area and meanwhile the average weekend player may finish in top 10 because of good decision making when moving.Great game no other is able to deliver the same package yet.

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game probably has the most amazing gunplay of any game I've played to date.Sniping someone from a good distance is satsifying spraying an automatic weapon is great and modifying weapons to better suit your playstyle is fantastic. 2/3 of the maps out currently are great those being Miramar and Sanhok. Erangel is complete ing garbage but that's my opinion.This game is optimized well enough to play at least on low settings on most low to mid range builds and runs beautifully when playing on ultra. There are still quite a few bugs in the game that can be annoying and sometimes it feels as though the devs have no ing clue what they're doing. This is really only 10% of the experience.The other 90% is excellent gunplay amazing customization and overall probably the best BR experience there is and with polish maybe even the best there ever will be.I wish skins were cheaper and/or easier to get. We all want a Turquoise Delight or a Shark Bite skin but unfortunately because the game has a market for skins getting them is a ing hassle and then some. There are times when PUBG Corp feels like the greedy s who funnel out just to make money and there are times when I receive something or buy something at a fair price and am left satisfied. In the however many months I've been playing this I made roughly 120 dollars back so that isn't all that bad.This game also fills the niche for playing with friends. Some matches are very competitive and test our tactical teamwork other matches we're shooting each other in the back and pretending there was an enemy behind us. You can take it seriously or around. It's great.Maybe there are some hackers here and there most of them are chinese but they're far and few between these days.I'm playing this game until it dies. I hope for that to not be any time soon and with how much money PUBG Corp is farming in it's very likely that it will not be any time soon. you if you play fortnite play a real game.

review: When the player count dwindles to twenty and you're sneaking or shooting for your spot in the shrinking circles PUBG gets your heart beating. If you claw into top ten every gunshot arrests your attention and every death brings you closer to your chicken dinner. The few wins I've picked up have been the most intense and euphoric gaming experiences I've ever had. Though it still needs some work PUGB becomes consistent fun with a squad and often solo once you tackle the learning curve. This game just barely runs at about 30 FPS on my low end pc with all the settings at their lowest and the resolution dropped to 1280x720. It chugs momentarily when I zoom with an 8x scope and sometimes the buildings take a bit to load in when I touch down. I'm cautiously optimistic for better optimisation to give me a smoother experience but I'll keep playing regardless. If you're unsure about the game now I think PUBG will be worth your time upon its full release.

review: From the easiest learned and simplest to play games like lol to cod to overwatch to cs. This take the prize. The most lazy simple and undeveloped game of the century. Well in this game you're gonna find everything in a game that shouldn't be there. you're gonna run around for loot. and you're gonna have to run towards a ring. Running will be 90% of what you're doing. the other 10% playtime will be browsing inventory and sometimes encountering lame "pvp". And you're gonna have to run some more. This should really not be called a game. cause this is just plainly to simple. if i made a huge map and put some weapons on it. Then i can call it hunger games and get millions of kids and russians to play garbage... "No braincells required come and waste your life away looking for meaningless loot game simulator GOTY". and yes i've won the game. It took less than 10 hours for me to win the game. did it feel good? do i want to win again? was it intense? was it fun?.... Not at all no... . i'd rather pay money so i dont have to run around in the wastes...

review: Review on 20/07/2017 I have had Playerunkown Battlegrounds since its Early Access release on Steam being a member of the community when most others joined so I have been through the thick and think of this game. Here goes my opinions CONS Loading time is slow FPS issues even on high spec systems Texture loading for objects when landing from the plane is horriblePROS Fun game to play Full of a weird but funny community Good open combat Involves a lot of comunication and teamwork A good all round game in generalI KNOW IT IS IN EARLY ACCESS STILL BUT IT DOESN'T MEAN I SHOULDN'T MENTION BUGS FROM THE GAME.Even knowing this game is Early Access it is one of the most promising best and overall interesting Battle Royal game out to date and deserves its current pricing at 26.99 or $29.99 WOULD HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS GAME

review: I just got this game and have about 10 hours when this review is being written and honestly very fun game but there is room for improvement. One thing that I will say off the bat if you're reading around the time I post this is that the optimization of this game is absolute trash. My computer can run GTA 5 with medium settings at around 60 fps but this game is quite the killer. You will have to tweak a lot and manage with trash settings to get 70+ fps on very low settings. That should be expected though since it is in early access but like king of the kill it will most likely stay this way for a while. The gameplay is super fun and the bugs add personality but somethings you should be aware that the map is very large so there will always be something wrong. I was playing earlier and fell through the world on one of the beaches and it's quite frustrating but killing in this game is extremely rewarding. If you like games that are quite immersive and challenging this is perfect for you. You really feel like you're in this battle royale simulation and I often find myself red faced from intensity. Personally this game is worth it pretty cheap compared to triple A titles but you get what you pay for. Thanks enjoy! Hopefully this helps! Also the game is kinda based off chance because you choose where to spawn by jumping out of the beginning airplane but sometimes the area that you need to head to can be on the complete opposite of the map sometimes extremely out of range. Even if you are the best player in the world you will NOT win all of your games. I've won sometimes and next game would get 70th place.

review: I usually don't like early access games but I feel this one is in a good spot. You may not always do well in terms of your rank in a game but every kill and stand off you live through feel like a victory in their own right. That's what keeps me coming back.When playing with friends it's even more crazy. You could try to win but it's about the same odds as solo in regards to how often it usually works out. The fun with playing with friends for me comes more from the moments where even though every team member is well kitted you decide to charge an enemy stronghold with machetes and pans anyway. One team fight win like that will have you talking about it for days.

review: the battleground is like a devil's den. The game addicts people and ultimately lead them to their doom.마치 악마의 소굴같은 게임입니다. 이 게임때문에 제 친구들 여럿 버렸습니다. 우등생이고 모범생이던 친구가 한번은 좋은 게임을 갖고 왔다며 해보라고 추천했습니다. 하지만 그 당시 저는 어려워서 포기했습니다. 제 영적 지도자가 된 그 친구는 공부는 물론이고 모든 삶의 목표를 포기하고 오직 배틀그라운드의 1인자가 되기 위해 오늘도 달리고 있습니다. 저 또한 그 길을 가려 합니다. 저의 영혼을 받아주세요.This game literally ruined my friend's life. Once he came to me and asked to play this new game that he found. I at first thought that the game is super hard. That exact friend is now on a highway to end of his life. His main goal now has become becoming the best player in the game. Therefore as his friend I too shall join the meaningless journey and ditch my life. I invoke upon you O'battleground take my soul and transform me into the best player.

It has improved immensely from last year though I'm sure people may miss that because it didn't happen all at once and it's still just as addictive to play as it used to be. At the price point which is about half of a modern day AAA game I would still say it's worth the purchase if you've got a little team.Personally I wouldn't play it by myself.

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: PUBG is a fun game. However it is massively overhyped and has a plethora of issues. If you don't have a good pc I don't recommend this game. The game lags rubberbands and crashes/freezes constantly. Close range gunfights are a coin flip the majority of the time. This game is just as frustrating to play as it is rewarding. What makes this game good is that it is the most rewarding Battle Royale game on the market. The long setup is what makes kills so satisfying and wins even more so. It is a blast to play with friends since it does provide a good time. Playing squads or duos with randoms is a far worse expereince because of the absense of region lock. If you can deal with the game's problems and don't take it too seriously you will enjoy it. But clearly the game is not perfect and the developers need to adress its problems sooner rather than later.Major problems that need to be adressed Still horribly optimized Rubberbanding (Ruins early game looting) Incosistent close range gunfights (connection issue) REGION LOCK NEEDS TO BE ENABLED!!! (Half of the randoms are Asians playing on NA server)Until the game's issues are fixed I cannot say it's a good game...but it is fun. The fun factor is why I think even in its current state the game deserves a positive review.

review: Product received for free. I know I may only have 90 hours on this game I can still write a decent review and here it goes I bought this game last year around September and I really enjoyed the gameplay even though I did die within 5 minuets of every match and felt like smashing my head through my monitor I played many more matches and learned from my mistakes which resulted in me Improving (A little bit). The graphics of this game are really nice but the preformance Isn't im sorry to say the developers are more focused on making money than making the game enjoyable and playable to their playerbase. The servers have been swarmed with Hackers and sometimes really bad lag issues which does bring down this game I do really enjoy PUBG on the occasion but not in its current state In my opinion I would wait for more issues to be resolved before you buy it but if you do go ahead and buy dont say I didn't warn you.Positives Graphics Flying over hills with your friends in a 3 seater bike Camping in houeses till the final CircleNegatives Gameplay (Lag) Hackers Not Individual Severs (Hackers can jump from servers) Battle Eye (Anti Cheat)Overall I would recommend to wait for this game to reach a stable branch before you purchase it which could take a while due to the owners not caring about their playerbase. (There is no Kind of button for Recommending this game and thats why its a yes)
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This isn't the worst game ever but it's close.The idea is great the execution is absolutely terrible. For anyone scrolling through the reviews looking for an honest opinion about this game here's mine Don't buy it. Just watch people play it on twitch or youtube because it is not worth you're time or money. "Fix Pubg" will never happen The amount of Bugs makes this game litterally unplayable. connection issues sound issues general game mechanic issues &amp just a bad player base. For a brand new player just joining you have no chance of winning unless you adapt to the absolute game style this game forces on you which is it's better to hide than to fight. &amp if you are going to fight ambush someone.Way too much is down to RNG. The gun's are unbalanced and it's completely luck based for you to get 1. the weapon you need. 2. the correct attatchments for that weapon. 3. good Armour &amp helmet 4. Heals 5. Boosts ETC. because (especially on the old maps) if you don't get everything you need you find yourself just looking for loot Which isn't fun. If you don't have enough health after the first fight of the game Tough your bascially 1 shot until you find what you need.For a game which emphasises staying alive you die extremly quickly you will get melted by nearly every gun. Not to mention as soon as you hide behind a corner you can still get shot for the next 2 seconds due to the games terrible connection issues. If you check the kill cam you are very rarely on it it's just a video of a guy missing nearly every shot.I bought a brand new pc that cost a Grand and a half with pubg in mind &amp I can safely say pubg runs terribly. UNLIKE ANY OTHER GAME IVE TRIED. The game has crashed several times at several different points in a match &amp it gives you no warning or explanation as to why you just have to accept it.Let me just put this in perspective COD4 came out in 2007. it is now 11 years later &amp This game is not even a shell of that. I cannot explain to you how little enjoyment I have recieved from this game &amp how over hyped it truley was. Because it puts you through so much BS the fun parts aren't even that great. &amp Even if you win then what? there is no progression system the player stats are always being reset you can earn crates but then you have to PAY TO OPEN THEM. It is a perfect reflection of the entire gaming industry. &amp I truley find myself hating this game &amp I honestly just can't bring myself to even play it anymore because I KNOW i wont enjoy it. This is the 3rd or 4th time of uninstalling the game every time i just want to give it another chance but there really is no point. None of my friends play it anymore &amp i think i will be moving on for good.This game is dying and i'll be happy when it's dead.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: It's a decent game if you play enough of it. Most of the time into a match it's just long range engagements and you can't see the person who's shooting you. Next thing you know you're dead without a chance to fight back. In this game it's either always die or you're really good getting 15+ kill games. I however cannot be good at this game anymore because I'm banned. For literally doing nothing either. It's stupid in my opinion and I'm sure others could agree with me. Let me explain.Super relentless guidelines with banning people. I get it people may use the excuse they were hacked and someone else played on their account but at least give the people who really were a chance. In my case I probably had one of the most secure accounts with steam guard and everything. A really good hacker got into my account and played PUBG with hacks from his computer. I got banned almost instantly after I took my account back and I can't even appeal for an unban. It's just stuck at "if you're banned it's your fault for being hacked." Which is the most f*cking r*tarded thing I've ever heard.First of all I thought you actually wanted a community following but this is just mean to some of them. You guys aren't doing great in the first place compared to Fortnite so doing this is just adding insult to injury.Second it's not like it's my doing that I just "let someone into my account". I don't share passwords or information with anyone and I'm really secure about it. Just because some russian dude knows how to hack doesn't mean it's my fault that he chose to use hacks on my account. That just sounds r*tarded as if a 5 year old kid came up with those rules.Third not adding an appeal for the people like me who think logically is honestly just rude for people not being able to use the $30 they spent with their own money. I get it lots of people use hacks. Most of the time they should be banned. But like me who hates hacking and loves a fair game is banned because some f*ckface decided to use my account instead of their own is just lazy on your guys' part. I would appreciate a refund for my waste of time explaining something that you should've known in the first place.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Bluehole just needs that cash money They make you pay 30 for the game (well worth it in my opinion).They copied CSGO with their case and skin system with skins selling for 900 .They have a hybrid of the battle pass from Fortnite and the DLCs for R6Siege that cost 10 since it comes when a new map drops.I understand that it is a game as a service with constant updates and all these are not mandatory to buy but it is outrageous to ask for that much since the game launched a year ago and you maid billions of dollars.Pros Fun game Many updates Memorable moments Even the bugs are kinda funny Nice GraphicsCons Mostly above 75 fps but rarely over 100 ( gtx1080 ) You are not gonna notice those graphics because you can only run it on low settings Vehicles are broken Sound is broken They say there are hackers BUT personally I have never encountered one ( EU servers ) Cannot play with randoms in squads duos (toxic team kills from the start of the game not speaking English) Some problems with the genre ( ex. If someone surprises you from behind in a close range you are pretty much back in the lobby) Difficult to get used to gun mechanics much better than they used to be They dont listen to the community Problems will probably never get fixedUsed to love this game and I am sad watching it die... I turned to Fornite which i used to hate compared to pubg and now I would love to come back... Nintendo please fix &lt 3

review: Product received for free. I recievedthis game for free as a gift from my friend after hours of him trying to convince me to get the game I was unsure about wether or not it would be a good idea as the game was new and I knew nothing about it. After he had gifted it to me I downloaded the game and had a try I foundthe game was simialar to Day Z in terms of controlls and graphics Though there are some factors that might deter you from buying this game Frame rate on any machine powerfull or weak will have an unstable framerate as this game is in early acces and stills needs optimization thought i said factors as in plural this is the only thing that bothers me. If you are looking for a fun game to play with friends or aloneyou have hit the jackpot with this oe and i strongly reccomend you get it if the frame rates wont bother you I am playing on a Intel Core i76700 hq and a Nvidia GTX 960M and with medium to low settings with the poor optimizations are pretty smooth around the fourty to fifties and sometimes dropping to the thritys and twenties when around the ocean Im not too sure why it does this maybe because of the light and reflections rendering tied in with the poor optimization. Either way I love this game and can't wait to see howmuch it will grow and progress in the future and am excited for the optimization update!

review: Isn't as buggy as it use to be but servers are laggy AF and annoys the hell out of me. Body armor you pick up like teir 2 doesn't slow down bullet damage anymore if somebody has a smg or a full auto combat rilfe you screwed even in teir 3 body armor. Can't tell where foot sounds are coming from can't tell which direction your being shot from to take proper cover. Decent weapons on Miramar are really hard to come by making it difficult to engage in fire fights. Solo battles are a nightmare with alot of campers. Best way to do good at this game is to buddy up and play Duo's or squads. This game is not worth the 30$ price tag it has on it. I regret my purchase of it. If you want to play PUBG just get the mobile version for you phone or Download the Tencent gaming buddy emulator for pc and play it like that. Its not as user friendly but has alot better support then this version of the game does. Its free and you can tell where your being shot from and actually do decently in it compared. Doesn't look as pretty graphically wise but its alot more fun to play!
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I dont know if I have enough hours to give a full review but I'll give it a shot.For those who have been under a rock Good stuff. Very nice gun play similar to the realism of Arma while being much less clunky. (It is based on an Arma mod after all but what isn't anymore?) Voice chat is decent quality provided you stay away from All chat channel its like people just discovered the annomnimity of the internet in there. Map is a fairly efficient size not too big but surely not too small. Good variety of weapons attachments and pretty well balanced (Currently). Gave map selection option when queuing as community requested. Did something about hackers finally.Bad stuff. 90% of in game crates are now pay to open they just contain clothes and weapon skins but I began playing when there were no pay to open crates. (I have not and will not pay to open a crate.) Not as prevelant now but HACKERS. Close quarters combat with ping differences.(Not extremely easy to control but you will rage due to this.) review: Want to play a frustration free skill based shooter with good net code? No? Well then this game is for you. Featuring vehicle physics that kill you if you graze a solitary pebble or if the game rolls heads you can enjoy the scenic 8x8 Km maps until you get quick scope one shotted out of your vehicle by someone who had a suspicious lack of line of sight. The game is kept interesting through the various randomized variables such as Whether your ping beat the ping of the person you just exchanged gunfire with (It won't) Vehicles that are never there for you when you need them (Just like your dad!) A loot system that dynamically increases the chance of you finding something you already have/don't need (Hey want a fifth Kar98 this round?) Vengeful play area circles whose father you murdered in another life (Ooooh look another open field on the opposite side of the map as where you started!)In addition the game has attracted a diverse fun loving community of hackers your long lost 12 year old fathers and the Chinese. Featuring an in game voice chat system you can chat with your fellow survivors in the lobby over the soothing sound of the N word and "China Numbah Wan" activists in converstations that would instantly bump the ESRB rating up to M. If you do have any issues with the game you can always take your issue to the forums where you can get (Maybe) developer feedback (Probably not) on whatever your post is about (Yeah no). If (When*) not there's always the Good Samaritans who will try to give you the best advice they can (Git gud fegget).In conclusion this game provides wonderful experiences that will stay with you for as long as your newly smashed desk.(Ey wanna buy some skins?)

review: Used to be a pretty nice a game until the devs decided to choose the path of the degenerate.After the major update and the following release of the game things went from bad to worse. I somehow feel left behind by the devs as all we see now are some highly praised weapon skins and "ping matchmaking". Yet the cheater problem still isnt fixed same for the lobby lags or the general connectivity. e.g "The severs are too busy". The late February Update bashed the game even more its main purpose was the get rid off cheaters but the only thing it did was disabling Reshade and completely up the stability some people (gladly not me) werent even able to start game properly. Instead of a hotfix we got a major rollback and some nice new textures. It s nice to see that a cheater is getting by Battleye 5 hours after your match but the sheer amount of these events is a having a huge impact on the motivation to contine on the higher ranks. As long as those issues arent fixed i wont give the game a positive review.

review: Product received for free. While I do dislike Bluehole for justified reasons (their innate tendency to sue others and claim that their game concepts are original) PlayerUnkown's Battlegrounds is my most frequently played game at the moment for good reasons. Its core gameplay is very enjoyable. The thrill of stalking other groups and then putting an arrow in their knee (sorry) one by one or running up close with a sawed off and just blasting them to hell is rewarding both in in game gear (usually) and satisfaction.The game can be extremely punishing as well if you make bad choices plan badly or simply aren't paying attention to your surroundings or the timer. You can easily die if you misjudge a situation or take stupid risks but it's just as easy to just jump into a new match. Matchmaking can literally take less than 10 seconds and that's counting the waiting time to spawn.I see some people here complaining about the RNG of how the circle is placed but that's one of the good parts of this game. It is unpredictable you never know what is going to happen where. You have to be able to adapt to the changing situations. No match is the same. If the circles always spawned in the middle there would be no diversity in gameplay. You would just play the same setting with different people over and over again. Also you're given plenty of time to get to where you need to get you just have to pay attention. This isn't a fault of the game it's a fault of the players.I'm not saying that the game is flawless it is definitely a flawed game. There are some game breaking bugs that can ruin a match for you if you are unlucky (I'm looking at you box in the green bloody barn). I wouldn't have recommended this game when I got it from my friends around New Years' but the game is much more polished now and I can now run it without ever dropping below 60 fps on highest settings. Bluehole is constantly fixing bugs and performance issues (although they have stagnated a bit on the performance front as of late) and the game isn't even close to being as unpolished as it was half a year ago. Vehicle bugs are as good as gone as of the latest patches.So while I am generally discontent with Bluehole as a corporation I'm more than pleased with their game.

review: This game has turned into COMPLETE and utter GARBAGE. I have just over 800 hours clocked on this game. Mostly before Sanhok. It was nice with the 2 maps(Erangel &amp Mirimar). It was even better when they gave us map choice. I used to be in the top 1% for quite a while and it was my main game that I would come home and launch. In fact it was the game that encouraged me to buy a PC and start PC gaming. Now I've just given up hope on the game.With the new maps (Sanhok and Vikendi) it has left the original map(s) in the dust. I miss the short time to wait to get into Erangel and drop in Poch!nki hoping that I wouldn't glitch off the top of the 3 story buildings when I tried to land on them. Sometimes I would lose like half of my health but it was all part of the fun. There are very few games I would recommend a matching system based on lvl/gameplay but at this point this one really needs it. I have not had a fun game in over a year. Before the new maps and before FIX PUBG(Really? So bad they had to fix it? Yes. 3 months+) I would hop on with confidence knowing I was going to catch a win before the night was over. Now... I get on and can't even play the OG map(s) because there are only 6 people in the queue. I also have no confidence getting on. The way they have made the guns and numbers work seem unfair in my opinion. If you disagree cool. Don't rage at me. My word isn't law by any means. PUBG's daily online community has felt like it's significantly decreased since Fortnite came out with their Battle Royal version of the game(no duhh I know). I was pretty upset for a good while when that happened. I was not surprised that Fortnite took over due to the low price of FREE and the new take on a Battle Royal when your gun fights rely partially on the implemented building system. Now I personally suck at Fortnite SOOO BADD and prefer games with more realistic physics and qualities. I strongly dislike Fortnite. I don't know how my friends do it but they are quite amazing at the game. I suffer a game every now and them just to play a game with them because we don't have too many games in common and I know they love having the company.To put my feelings towards PUBG in retrospect I would much rather play Fortnite know that I suck and just take multiple L's and get a kill here and there than play PUBG. If you are interested in buying the game I'm not going to tell you not to. I recommend you don't. However if it seems like something you are pretty interested in and want to play I would do thorough research on videos of gameplay and more.

review: Great potential but terrible experience. Almost nothing is working as intended.With my experience with this game ... i cant recommend it to someone this is the truth at the moment. Sad.No for now ...but i hope to change this review in the near future. And another point ...they must do something fast people are getting boored clock is ticking. In my case ...from infinite patience now its limited. Too much time has passed and nothing changed on a larger scale. (Most important problems still exists and ruining the game experience)EDIT(8.11.18) This game is more awful than before. Full of desync sound problems bad gameplay experience (they did nothing to improve it) ... you safely stop the car and not hitting or passing anything but suddenly explodes and bb 20 mins of looting/playing this is a new one.Some minor bugs that could be fixed in hours like jumping on the left side of the plane but your view resets/line up with the plane path instead of your desired direction. (jumping on right side is fine) ...and this thing is still here FOR WEEKS nearly months already.This game cant use your pc resources right ex it uses 30 40 50 % ...rarely 80+ of my 1050 oc'ed (but most of the time 50 70) and this is the problem that why i go under 60 frames often recently. Or having 1080ti for some users ... not using more than 40 % and sometime droping under 20% so you will get around 60 frames. An this is stupid for a top video card.Normaly my gtx 1050 should go 80+ to 95 99 ...around full load but no ...i dont know what they are doing with this game.And 1080ti should work around 60 80 % for strong and consistent performance. (with full hd and 150 200 frames all the time. rarely under 150.)I hoped to turn this review in a positive one but the chances droped to maximum 10% for me.Like my will to play this game anymore ... if this 10 % is gone ill leave and never coming back. Not even if they fix this garbage to near perfect game. (But this will not happen anyway)In my opinion this game must be FREE ... does not deserve a cent. Dont pay for it ... first they need to respect their customers/players and deliver something that worths the moneys.

review: You know what's a great idea? Stuffing 100 players into a plane to parachute down onto a desolate island to scavenge for weapons armor and supplies in hopes of surviving a bloody deathmatch. And to keep things interesting as numbers dwindle throw in the impending doom of an electric field that forces players into an ever shrinking warzone. PUBG's technical shortcomings can undermine its broader achievements on rare occasions but they don't override your desire to continue playing. Each phase of a match presents a different type of tension that is equal parts thrilling and terrifying driven by the insatiable desire to be the last person (or squad) standing. Whether you play solo or in a group successfully executing adaptive tactics to win intense high stakes firefights makes for an incredibly rewarding experience. Every player has unique stories of their most memorable matches and even after hundreds of hours PUBG continues to inspire rousing tales of victory and defeat.PlayerUnknown s Battlegrounds has taken the military sim gameplay popularized by games like ARMA and DayZ boiled it down to its most exciting parts and streamlined it into quick and accessible rounds of pure hassle free survival based action.P.S. Vikendi PlayerUnknown s Battlegrounds' new snow map has left the test servers and is now live for everyone to skid around in on their snowmobiles. Along with the new map there s the new pass. The Survivor Pass can be levelled up by completing missions netting yourself new items and skins. It s free for everyone but you'll need to spend cash to get the best stuff. The Premium Survivor Pass will set you back $10 and includes over 60(permanent) skins and emotes.

review: Now to understand the greatness and revolutionary gaming experience this game provides i must bring you back to the Summer of 2017. This was the biggest game at the time and was pulling in massive amounts of players it was unique and never done so perfectly before. PUBG is the greatest Battle Royale game to ever exist period. It is competitive reliable(for the most part) and realistic while also being fun. Sure it has it's faair share of bugs and a cheating problem. Most compeitive games do have a cheating problem though(Yes CS GO we are looking at you!!!) but this game is still just so good. Pros Compeitive Realistic Amazing gunplay Customization options for weapons are vast 3 great maps Playable in many different ways Kills and wins feel rewarding(something fortnite lacks) The bulletproof pan Beautiful graphicsCons Bugs Cheaters Stupid current SMG metaOverall if you like Battle Royale this game is a must buy.

review: My own opinion (I do know this game is beta) This game is pretty bad I'm going to compare it to H1Z1 since that seems like what people are comparing it to.Cons Horrible performance (running everything at low graphics gives me a common 60ish fps ish being any lower than 60. Right when you turn your head you drop down to about 50 40 fps for about 10 seconds which is ed since you are completely ed if someone is shooting at you from behind. You may think I am just a pissy since 60 fps is good but in the game for some reason it seems like I am getting alot less even with low graphics. Unlike in H1Z1 where they have in my opinion evern better graphics and yet I get a consistant 80 FPS at medium/high settings. (Specs nividia geforce gtx950 i7 12 gbs of ram).).Weird pickup animations (Spamming "F" on an item or cosmetic will cause you to not pick it up and mess you up to in which you have to stand still wait 5 seconds inbetween each pickup and then you are done. Also it gives you the option to pickup items that you can't even reach in which then you have to move closer to it after the first try or so. Unlike H1Z1 you can just spam "F" and get on with your life. This may seem stupid but if you have OCD then you will want to uninstall the game just because of that).Gun glitches (The guns take a second to show that you even have the gun equiped and even then when you reload it will take a second to show you have ammo in your gun that you reloaded. I know this may seem like nothing but if you have minor OCD then you will flip a .Car physics (Tapping "F" on the car door won't get you in the car instead like the pickup animations you have to click e after waiting 5 second or so then you can get in. Same thing with the OCD). Pros A plethora of guns (Unlike H1Z1 there are not just 3 assault rifles and 1 shotgun and 7 pistols (including revolvers/magnums).Not as RNG (You get to choose where you want to parachute from instead of getting a random spawn. For some people this is good but I find it more fun to get a RNG spawn).Overall 4 Bilbo Baggins out of 10k am done thanx for read pls follow me on twitt

review: Started playing this game a little after it came out. Was a good game paid like close to 15 bucks for it. Did nt have any issues with the game. That is until the end of last year. Cheaters everywhere. Pubg says they are working on a fix for that but the anti cheat needs to be tested. Framerate drops are not in their best intrest to fix. Just like the anti cheat. Instead of announcing its there but it needs testing just implement it. Doubtful it'll even work seeing as they already have battle eye yet are banning millions of players each ban wave. I took a break for a couple months and came back when my brother and buddy bought the game for $35. Lots had changed. Dying as soon as i hit the ground to someone speed hacking and picking up weapons faster than usual. Esp no recoil and aimbots were atrocious. One night we had played 4 games where we barley made it out of the chutes before we died. After that we called it a night and the next day they both got banned. Tried an appeal got a crappy response from the devs. Seemed like it was computer generated. Stopped playing.Jan. 2018 they got new accounts. Started playing again. Cheats not so much still there but not as bad. Ping lock fixed alot of that. Still poorly put together turd however. Lag was worse. Fast forward.June 2018 after the most recent update. Game has significantly gotten worse. Lagging even harder than before. One match I shoot at a guy with an M4 point blank in the chest no hits. He runs off. Im now up by prison. Three guys come running at me i kill two. The other guy darts from behind a tree. I ads he is dead to rights 3 feet in front of me. Sights dead on his body. Apparently he runs faster than the bullets. Kills me. Okay im done. Nope play the next match. Shooting a guy in the face with an uzi same thing no hits. A guy 400m out kills me with an m16. Needless to say after that im done with this poorly optimized turd. I cant hit a guy point blank while the sights are on him but i can die to the air around a vehicle or a boat coming out of the ground. Uninstalled and will not install again. Id say waste of money but I got my fair share for around $15.I'll expect some comments about "Get good" or "You just suck". Seeing as it is the internet and you are entitled to your own opinion. Im just stating dont buy this game it aint worth $35 sure as hell aint worth spending $1.50 to open crates as the bp is etremely hard to get. Thanks to the farmers. Examples of why I uninstalled.https //www.youtube.com/watch?v 79k bu08mcohttps //www.youtube.com/watch?v 9jJtVIP_N34https //www.youtube.com/watch?v gD2JSMtQOQchttps //www.youtube.com/watch?v WP3TisenXZE

review: All the negetive reviews on this game crack me up so lets get this straight.+ You can not run this game on a potato pc so stop trying and then complaining that the devs need to get there SH*T together it runs fiine for me on i7 4790k 4.6 and a SINGLE 980ti because we lost sli support BOOHOOO. review: Edit The game developers refuse to deal with cheaters using aim bots wall hacks speed hacks etc every game has one and they ruin the game. Not to mention the amount of poor performance and desyncing. The game is not near ready for release the fact they are pushing for release before end of 2017 is a good laugh. This is the most ADDICITING TERRIBLE game out there. Daily I tell myself "I'm done with this game" but somehow come back to get frustrated again and again. The inconsitent delivery of damage the cheaters who use aimbots or hacks to shoot through walls the random deaths because your vehicle hits a butterfly and blows up instantly when there is only 15 players left making you realize how you wasted 20 minutes of your life. Don't get me wrong it has HUGE potential to be a fun game it really does. But given that its in alpha and it seems like the random dice roll whether you will have a terrible experience. I cannot say "GET THIS GAME". I can not tell you how many times I have shot someone in the head/chest 4+ times when they have no armor or helmets I will have level 2+ helmet and chest armor and they shoot me once with a pistol killing me instantly. Uhh yeah cause that makes sesne. Or the fact that it does not matter if you have armor on and a shotgun can klll you instanlty. Umm no buck shot is not going to kill someone with armor on. The pellets will pepper your arms and legs and any other body part exposed but not penetrate. Maybe if it was a slug it would penetrate. Or how you can shoot someone 3 times with a pistol when you first drop and they 1 hit punch you? LOL YEAH OKAY. If they want to make a realistic survival battle royal they should look into real elements of what weapons can/cannot do and work on tweaking the delivery of damage and how that may effect the character.I have high hopes but I think for anyone who doesn't want to be frustrated by BS gameplay should wait until its out of Early Access. Until then I will give this a No on recommendation.

review: Not a game for people who value their free time. Prepare to do a lot of walking waiting and laying down just to get shot from nowhere wait another minute and repeat just to look at the clock and realize 3 hours just passed. If you start to play for some hours and wonder if the game is boring or if you're the one that's boring loser instead don't blame yourself blame your parents and plan threaten suicide for attention. But first leave the house and see the beauty around you on the way to taco bell before you buy $30 worth of junk food at Ralph's. Then go back home to binge on candy hentai and video games until its 3 am and your body is full of shame and sugar as you lean back on your squeaky office chair surrounded by food wrappers weed and fresh white stains on your black sweatpants. You pull out your phone to browse instagram and see all the beautiful girls you will never get a chance to touch or talk to. You see all the cool people having fun with friends doing all kinds of cool stuff that you always wanted to do but never will. Then you realize you've been living like this for all your teenage and young adult years and now you have to settle with a more boring mediocre life and will never reach your true potential because you threw away your free time to escaping into video games while you spend hours every day staring at a wall with moving pixels instead of doing things to improve your health happiness relationships exposure to the world and overall quality of life. It's too late. You destroyed your body from years of sitting on the computer. You'll never be able to have good sex with your back problems let alone be able to work out and attract women. It's over. You missed your train so you go back to your room and spend time with the only friend you have your computer. This is your life as you know it. The only happiness you have is escaping into a war game where you can communicate with your squad mates and have the illusion of socializing with people. This is the only time people will ever listen to what you ask them to do other than when you are mean to your parents and treat customer service people like because they're the only people who wont punch you in the face for being a jerk. In the real world nobody sees you as a leader but in PUBG you can lead your teammates to victory. You get a thought that maybe you should talk to that girl next to you or think of being friends with some good looking bros so you can go pick up chicks together but instead you hate what you dont understand and you make up stupid reasons in your head not to like them. Why? Because you have the ultimate talent the universe desires you are a video game master.

review: PUBG is a BatteRoyale game in which the only remaining player or team wins the game. The two maps are 8x8Km and start with 100 players who drop in with only the clothes on their back. More maps will be released including a 4x4Km one. I first played PUBG when it was still in early access and I was absolutely thrilled to play a game where the length of your weapon counts and suppressors don t lower your damage. Mechanics such as bullet drop bullet penetration and leaning (peeking) are also present. The damage model is a bit simplistic. With time the game got a much better netcode and it s a lot more optimized but it s still not very good. I love that they added the option of double tapping lean (peek) to make it toggled. Another thing that I really liked is that there is another fire stance besides the classic hip fire and ADS where you just hip fire more accurately while trading away speed. But even now you are being forced out of ADS when you get too close to objects like walls door frames etc. I think at the very least there should be an option to just prevent movement instead of forcing you out of aiming when there is no room to move. The way maps are deigned works well for PvP but it s very nonsensical and look unfinished. Vehicle physics is still wacky. Gameplay wise it s not that exciting except maybe if you get in the last 10 or 3. A lot of matches will be you running around for 15 minutes ending when a player gets the drop on you or after a short firefight. Time to kill is very low but it can be increased a bit with armor. Rating Chicken chicken this game s not the winner.http //pixelloot.com

review: Alright so I have a unique perspective here on the game so if you care here's my opinion on PUBG Its past current state and future. So as everyone knows PUBG dropped onto steam like a nuke just demolishing everything out there and smashing gaming records and amassing millions of players in mere months. The hype was insane and nobody could get enough of it everybody wanted more! But thats just it. Everybody wanted MORE... But nothing more was coming... It got stale and old quickly then small patches managed to break the entire game to a point where players started losing hope. That's when I picked up my copy of PUBG hoping that all of the negative was just people finally getting off the hype train... Boy was I wrong I played merely 4 5 hours before I totally lost hope in the game and thought to myself "there goes 40$" and i gave up on it for months. Fast forward to 2 weeks ago when I had gotten wind of a new map battlepass and apples to say you to Fortnite I laughed and said " in' hell guess ill give that game a try again" in preparation for the new update I got back on and gave it another go and to my surprise the game actually felt slightly less bugy and a little more playable then I had previously remembered and for the first time I was actually thoroughly enjoying PUBG! I started watching more and more footage of the new map and was genuinely excited for the update. I couldn't wait! Now we arrive where we are today. The release of Sanhok the battle pass and seemingly some optimization and slight gunplay tweaks (Correct me if I am wrong though) And I have to say that this is the first huge step in a new direction for PUBG co. THIS is fresh new content that your playerbase has been screaming at you about for a year now! The game actually feels fresh and new. New weapons scenery sound tweaks AND APPLES! No more updates of more Microtransactions and new skins and t nobody wants. Continue listening to the people keeping your game in buisness and your game will last for eternity. SUMMARY PUBG has been notorious for a lack of innovation and a lack of concern and care for their playerbase and what they want. BUT now it seems they seem to understand what is going on around them and how their multi million copy celling game is failing. They released an amazing update. The gameplay on Sanhok feels new and fresh. This is what we've all asked for guys. ITS HERE! If youve given up on PUBG in the past. This is a new beginning if they continue on this track. 10/10. Good job PUBG

review: Listen if you've read many of the negative reviews on steam you'll realize that quite a few have 100+ hours on PUBG. No one spends 100+ hours on a bad game. Furthermore the negative reviews tend to rant more about the company bluehole (blueballs) and not the game so ultimately I think that most of the reviews should be positve but blueballs is ing garbage. No moving on to my opinion of the game not the company. This game is honestly a modern classic and witht he recent announcement by bluehole to "Fix PUBG" I think that by October of this year this game will turn around from being hated to being a steam favorite. Let's start with solos. Solos in this game are a bit hot or miss. On one hand the tension of a 1v1 or top 10 situation is amazing yet on the other if you don't know the hot drops or player movement solos can be a boring experience where you run into no one for 15 plus minutes. So ultimately solos aer OK if you are willing to either hot drop or you know player movement so you can hunt people down and force yourself into fights. For the next section i'm going to focus on both duos and squads because they both share many similarities. Duos and Squads is where the game really shines especially with friends. there is enough downtime in which can converse with you friends especially in squads yet there is enough where it is stil an enjoyable experience. The gun fights are even more tense with a 4 man fight truly feeling like a war zone you have to cover your teamates help yourself revive teammates and take down the enem of course. This is honeslty where PUBG shines. Now to the negatives of the game not blueball's negatives. The first downside and idk if this is really a negative is the monsterous learning curve. This game takes so long to learn and with server issues which I will touch on later the game can be very frustrating to 0 IQ individual (noob). Secondly the game has sub par performance on low end PCs. I have a 1050ti and an i5 6500 which should be decent for this game and it kinda is. The only real performance problems I have are occasionally the game will fail to render building before I land the only exception being when I drop at Pecado and Hacienda on Miramar (The Desert Map) I almost always never have the buidlings renderred before I land. I run the game on medium very low on all the settings. The last real problem is the servers in this game supposedly patch 19 made the servers run at a somewhat stable 60hz yet I still face hitreg desync lag and the "Network Lag Detected" error. This is exacerbated by my low to mid range PC where I feel like 1/2 bullets I land when spraying are actually registering. When single firing the hitreg seems to be fine. With all that being said the "Fix PUBG" campaign blueballs recently announced aims to fix performance and server issues and I have faith in blueballs because if they don't COD Battle Royale and BF5 Battle Royale will kill this game in mere seconds. Blueball's entire game lies on "Fix PUBG" and they need to succeed. You have been visited by the Fedora of Atheism and Autism! Tip this fedora to 5 friends or you'll be haunted to become an atheist neckbeard!

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I've wasted 76 hours of my life on this game. The physics (ESPECIALLY vehicle physics) are worthless. Most of the time when you're driving you'll hit an imaginary bump that will flip your car and (if you're lucky) leave you with no health. You can't jump over anything unless you're at a full sprint. Weapons/damage feel like they're detirmined by RNG instead of a base damage. You can put 14 AK rounds into someone then they'll turn around and burst you with an M16 and down/kill you (true story). When someone is down they take about double the damage of someone who is up so it takes a ridiculous amount to kill someone in Duo or Squad. Third person is the worst thing this game could have ever done for two reasons. First it gives a massive advantage to anyone on the defense. They can sit behind a tree or at the top of stairs and wait for you to show your head while they are completely safe. Second it's 100% broke. 99% of the time I'm unable to shoot at someone from 3rd person (or even 1st person at times) without exposing almost my entire body and then getting swiftly ended often times without being able to fire a single bullet. There is a small red circle that indicates to you that your rounds will hit an object instead of your target and usually your bullets will hit said object even when it isn't there. These are just basic gameplay issues. This doesn't include the errors random game crashes "network lag detected" that can last anywhere form two seconds all the way up to five minutes and a plethora of other bugs. Like I said 76 hours wasted. I regret buying the game and wish I could get a refund. It's a fantastic concept and I understand it IS still early access but it's so broken in so many ways.P.S. I'm quite excited for the "maybe you should just get good" messages I'm going to receive for posting this.

review: Would not recommend this game. I can't Understand why so many people are playing this. I would compare it to buying a Call of Duty game for $59.99 Only you have no Single player no zombies 1 map. 1 stinking map 1 mode 1 gun 1 life ( sounds boring no?). Its nothing like Call of duty though or Arma or any other good titles. The rounds are super short ( if you die). As soon as you spawn you have very very little time to get anything before you need to rush to the next area ( Which can sometimes be so far away you have no chance of getting to. I will say due and squads make the game alot more enjoyable but still the same crap. Seemed to be a few bugs Opening doors and sometimes just moving around getting rubber band effect. I just would not recommend and don't see what the hypes all about with this one. There are a few pros however. The graphics look "decent" nothing shy of any other game though. Did i say pros? Thats about it for me.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This is essentially just a redo of PU's king of the hill MOD for Arma using the Unreal engine. My negative review is not for the low FPS lack of optimization or lag (it has all those EA problems) but rather the poor game play meta and balance. It plays like PvP in DayZ sped up minus zombies and with slightly more people per sqKM. As a mod it is not worth $30 more like $10 15. Let's hope the devs don't take the money and run without finishing the game. It seems that because of the debacle that was/is H1Z1 gamers are overreacting to this release with joy. When the bar is low...If DayZ is a walking simulator Battlegrounds is a running simulator. EA or not the balance and game play mechanics are completely off right now. The dev's description states "Players must fight to locate weapons and supplies in a massive 8x8 km island to be the lone survivor." No they don't. At that size there is a density of only 1.5 players per sqkm. There is no incentive to engage other than the slowly shrinking combat zone or ego. The map is too large for 100 people and guns are way too prevalent. You can parachute in away from all the others loot one house get a sidearm and long arm (often in the same building but certainly in the same compound) and then hide. While you can get first aid kits there are not any other "supplies" or any other goal than just be the last to die. Now most people are parachuting in large groups early and quickly killing each other but that play style (to each their own) is essentially death match. Because you only get one life and can't spec the people doing this would probably really love an actual death match version of this game (hint hint). Also this instantly results in a balance issue. When as often happens 20 30 people die very quickly the player density plummets. Which ultimately exposes the flaw in all KOTH games they are too repetitive and limited. When it is but one game mode among others for a game KOTH is fun. But as a standalone game itself it makes no sense. Even with ladders and leader boards. Now some will get sucked into earning clothing for their avatar or some other perk but those are the same people that will grind a game like Farmville.I'll admit I don't know what the solution is. Increased player density for a start by shrinking the map. Reduce weapon spawns. That will help in the general playability but long term? Add some sort of survival component.

review: Unfortunately I was only able to realise how terrible this game is once I experienced Fortnite a similar infamous "Battle Royale" game by Epic Games. It highlighted obvious flaws with PUBG's core experience that have not been addressed since release. Bluehole have failed to keep up with this games unprecedented success and that fact rears its ugly head prominently every time you hop into a game.PUBG's map is far too large for what it tries to achieve which is an intense survival experience. What ends up happening is that you have to choose between becoming an easy target by using a vehicle or embark on a super duper running simulator as you run from zone to zone. It feels extremely dissatisfying when you and your friends gear up for 10 minutes or so without seeing a single enemy only to be picked off by one swift shot by someone you didn't see. You desperately call out to your friends for help but they can't see him either only specs in the distance is that a bush or a player? Moments like these destroy the enjoyment of the game for me.That brings me to another gripe with the game its graphics. The realistic style of PUBG would work fine except the game is an unoptimised piece of garbage. My computer is by no means high end it would barely qualify as a viable low end machine with an embarrassing GTX 750 as its graphics card. That being said I have no trouble running Fortnite CS GO or Overwatch. Even GTA 5 runs relatively smoothly when compared to PUBG. The optimisation becomes an issue at the start of each round where 100 players are crammed in the loudest jet plane in existence and dropped off into a dull map with pre bought assets that don't load for at least 30 seconds into the game which by then everyone else who landed around you has found a weapon to violently shoot you with. Speaking of shooting....The games combat system seems incredibly wonky. The end game relies on you having scopes just so you have a chance of hitting your opponents. WHY??? Additionally if you are lucky enough to get an adequate scope for final engagements you are met with another issue the unintuitive wall of scoping distance. It uses squares on the map as indications of 100 metres which is supposed to allow you to register in your brain how far away the enemy is from your current position. It uses the "Page Up" and "Page Down" buttons (for some reason...) and is confusing especially in the heat of the moment when you are getting shot at repeatedly. The looting system is passable for the most part however linking back to the issues of scopes there are far too many variables that inhibit looting from being satisfying. You can spend such a long period of time searching for the right weapon to use only encountering rooms with crossbows pistols and weapons such as the VSS. If not this you'll never be able to find the right attachment for your gun. Oh you wanted an extended mag for your SCAR L? Sorry pal this extended mag only works with SMGs you ing idiot!The fact that this game passes 2 million concurrent players a day on steam is disgusting. Don't support this shambles get Fortnite. Please.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: The majority of the time in this game you will die in the first few moments because you don't have a gun trudge around a vast empty open world here gunshots hundreds of meters away get sniped in the head die from the circle because you can't find a car survive because you played like a hermit and never see a living soul. The environments feel empty gun play is so rare you can't really enjoy it. No range to test out guns. I played 5 games and fired fewer than 30 rounds. Much more of a survival game than a shooter in my opinion. Gunplay felt cheesy at most times more rock paper scissors than strategy. I like the concept but the game doesn't have a good pace for solo. I should also make it clear that this is not a game built for solo the mechanics only really make sense in a group setting. The game is no doubt much more interesting and fun in a group. Great for streamers and pro teams not at all good for someone who wants to play solo.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: So Im going to finally get around to writing a review other than "Its Aids"So to start off it seems like the philosophy of "I like it therefore its good" is something that is spread far and wide and many people follow this idea. Unfortunatly this is a very subjective viewpoint and it is the cause for many games that are actually flawed getting so many great reviews.That is the case of this game. It is sure fun as hell to play with friends but overall it is a lack luster game filled with devs and so many bugs that the fingers of the world could not count. So let me start off by listing some of the things I enjoy it is a small list but there are still some fun things.Pros It is quite and enjoyable game fun to play at times. Plenty of people playing no need to really wait for a match. I mean thats it? I cant really see much else with the gameCons So many bugs it hurts youll run in to them every single game whether it be your head sticking through something or getting stuck on nothing. The servers dear god they are always laggy at the start of the game the pickup time for loot is delayed and that is infuriating when you know someone next door is coming to blow you away with a shotgun. I always ask others in my squad just to make sure it isnt just me lo and behold it never is on my end. This happens in 75% of games and you will probably experience some lag somewhere throughout a match other than the start 50% of the time. The optomization is pretty doo doo the game is not that graphically impressive and I have a GTX 1070 and a system that should be able to at least get 60 on medium but that isnt the case you will get dips in frame rate and stuttering at times. The gunplay is sloppy from random sprays where one person will get lucky to the pans being able to one shot headshot whereas an M4 or AK wont. The gunplay is also relatively slow and clunky for a game that has some intense combat (When that actually happens). I dont really know how to explain it but no other game has felt this way.The Devs ALright you autistic s banning people for "stream sniping" whenever you feel like it is the dumbest ive heard you can honk your horn around a streamer and be banned instantly im not even joking. The whole "we have to test the paid crate system" has to be the biggest form of t the earth has ever heard. You dont need to test it now so you can take our money later. It is a simple system when compared to the game and guess what? It worked fine. Youre promises mean nothing and everyone will remember that. This whole issue with the chinese servers is just plain greed and is disgusting. You have so much ing money it is ridiculous and you cant even give them dedicated servers? You deserve terrible reviews and you deserve every bit of you get from it. Also now the NA and EU servers are lagging hard because of it thanks you dolts.*EDIT* 10 17 17 Every time I got to play a game it allows me to join one and after that is over the game will crash without fail as well as canceling any matchmaking I try after that first game. Thx

review: If you're playing it alone Solo prepare to be annoyed. Also if you don't have a high end computer prepare to be annoyed. You won't see where the shots come from. Also the audio is screwed up. If it sounds like a car is right next to you it may be half a mile away but may also be about to run you down...Insanely frustrating aiming system. Double click to use the sights otherwise it just zooms in a little bit. A lot of work still to do. 3rd person is nice and all. But it is too easily used to peek around what you're hiding behind and see what's coming. Also the matching is ridiculous. Brand spanking new players who don't know what they're doing are pitted against people who have hundreds of hours in game. So there are new players like me who are slower at everything who also have slightly lower end computers also me... Who get shot by invisible people while dodging cars driving through a town half a mile away.This game needs a tutorial for those who wants to learn how to play it. Straight into PVP with no clue as to how to do things gets frustrating real fast. I would do a squad game but what does that help? I still can't see the people shooting at me. Minimum system requirements should be upped a bit running an overclocked i7 BUT with only a GTX 745 graphics card. I would at most be a mule for the other people on the squad. Also my friends are scattered all across the world. Playing overseas servers are not really an option.Bottom line I'll check back in once game has had a few more months to mature and work out the kinks. As it is now it's far too biased towards high end computer users who knows the hotkeys.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

It would be nice if you will be able to see how you got killed so that you can learn from your mistakes or if the person who killed you is cheating or not. review: I don't recommend this game to anyone. It definately can't be compared to epicness of Arma 2 battle royale mod. Levels of gear is just laziness. Instead of Having lvl 1 2 3 helmets they could of come up with realistic variants of helmets such as motorcycle helmet/ iron helmet/ Combat tactical helmet etc. Same goes with backpacks. Can you imagine lvl 3 backpack in dayz? Breaks all immersion. Shooting seems more arcadish than in counter strike fine fine it has bullet travel time however the whole gun handling physics for example switching weapons is just horribly made. Another point I want to make is movement. It really needs alot more work to be done on it to be comfortable. (For example comparing Guild wars movement to world of warcraft movement EVERYONE knows that fluidity of movement in WoW just feels perfect and doesnt off your nerves like guild wars.Everything I listed here has nothing to do with a stage of a game such as alpha or prerelease or w/e. Ofcourse they could "change" whole game but that would mean there is no need for reviews. Stuff i listed above is not "broken" or "buggy" its just the way it was implemented.

review: Player Unknown's Battleground I feel is a very underrated game given the mixed reviews. I've put a fair amount of hours into the game now and I think it's overall a great game that just needs a little polish. And no surprise there it's still early access. Here's my breakdown of what makes the game great what could use a little work and overall how this game feels to play.The Good The ability to play in first OR third person is a nice touch. I remember when that was not an option. (Well you could but there was no FIRST person only game option on release so you would be at a huge disadvantage if you did). The graphics are not bad especially when you think about the type of game this is. An open world survival battle royale game. It doesn't have the best graphics for sure but they work for the game. And the new map on the technical test server seems even better. It really seems they tweaked something for the new update as it looks a lot better.Gunfights make sense. You're not going to snipe someone with a shotgun and up close they do plenty of damage. You can switch fire rates so if you want to use an AR as a poor man's sniper you can do it. You see muzzle flashes you hear the different sounds each gun makes so you can usually identify what you are hearing by sound alone. Direction of gunfire is pretty easy to tell too.High skill ceiling. Every match is a challenge. It takes a lot of effort to "git gud." I personally am not there yet but I don't feel like that is out of reach either. It is definitely competitive and every kill feels rewarding.The Bad Bullet drop sometimes feels unpredictable. It may be just me but sometimes the bullet drop seems inconsistent. No vaulting! While this WILL be changed in the upcoming patch for now you cannot vault over low objects like fences and small walls. This won't be an issue for long though and the vaulting feels great on the Technical Test Server (TSS).gun balance could use work. I would like to see every weapon viable but that just isn't the case. There are many trash weapons that you pretty much bypass entirely because of how useless they are. I would love to see crossbows and pistols actually useful for anything besides an "oh crap I need something NOW" type of panic weapon.Game doesn't seem optimized the best. I'm running a GTX 1060 6gb with 16 gb of DDR4 RAM. I shouldn't have significant frame drops running with everything on high but I do. I keep a few settings to medium to avoid this. So the game could be better optimized.Controlls sometimes feel a little clunky. They take some getting used to. Not game breaking by any means but occasionally things with the controlls can lead to a bit of frustration until you learn some of the kinks wth it.This part ironically irks me the most about the game the fact you need BP the game's currency just to edit your character appearance. And it's not cheap either it's a wopping 3k BP. That's quite a grind to get especially if you aren't that great at the game. Dev's should seriously consider letting you alter your character appearance for free considering it has no in game effect whatsoever I feel this is a pretty low blow to do to your playerbase.Overall A very great game especially for the price. It is a lot of fun solo OR with a group. If you like 1st/3rd person shooters and battle royale games do not miss out on this one. Game seems to go on sale fairly often too so if you can snag it on sale even better. This is a game you can sink a lot of hours into and have a lot of fun doing it.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game needs a lot of ing work. Instead of fixing bugs the developers want to add more ing features so they get more sales. Scummy Some bugs/Stupid Viewmodel bugs (People can peek seeing all of you but you only see their arm/elbow) Too many hackers (People who use ESP are EXTREMELY common. Aim botters not so much. Only came across 2 aim botters from what i know) Chinese invasion Most of the hackers i mentioned above are chinese. They play on EU servers only it seems. There are also too many chinese players who are just simply abusing their ping to gain the upper hand. There needs to be region locks on PUBG to block the toxic chinese community out. Gun combat is just ing awful. I wish i could say they nailed the head on gun combat but they really ing didn't. Let's start with shot guns. There is only one shot gun that is useable on this game and that is the double barrel shotgun. It is to op and needs nerf'd. It can one tap people with level one armour/helmets from about 25m. Snipers are useless because there isn't one sniper that can one tap level 2 armour (full health). Not even the AWM. Rifles aren't too bad the ak is just for range. The SMGs need to be nerf'd so people cannot run and gun. Zone camping. There are too many people who camp inside the zone to get easy kills. The devs need to add something so it's harder to see when you are in the blue but when looking into the blue it's almost clear. This would reduce these toxic players. FPS Lag. This game runs terribly. I have a GTX 1080 i7 and 32gb of ram and still can't get good frame rate. Desync lag. The game is not skill based at all in the first 5 minutes. It is to laggy. You could hit someone 4 times with a shotgun just to get one tapped. Oh but you didn't shot 4 times according to the server.I refuse to let the devs get away with the 'beta' game t. If its a ing beta game then make the game playable and actually treat it like a beta instead of whoring out your game for money. Have some self respect. I am only listing the negative things because they need fixed and pandering to the devs isn't going to get this fixed. I don't even know why I put hours into this game anymore. The devs don't give a about it only their cash flow.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS
