review: After 40 hours of experience of play PUBG i have experienced positives and negatives. The difference is the positives as of now do not out weigh the negatives. Yes PUBG is a tremendous amount of fun but only for those with extreemly high end gaming pcs. I have a really good pc running the game with a 1070 and a high end I5 and i still had bother with buildings loading in at the start of the game and crashing. Even others i know with 1080tis had the same issues. This makes it difficult to even get to start enjoying a game as textures not loading at the start of the match is game changing lettings others enter buildings and get weapons to kill you before you can even see that the building is there but that is even if you can enter the match because 50% of the time it'll crash before you can get in the game. The problem is at the moment the developers are working too much on microtransactions (WHICH I HATE THE IDEA OF) and the xbox release as apposed to finishing the game they started. Yes this is a pre release game but at least focus on releasing it on the platform it was intended for before porting it onto a new console.

review: This is not my favorite type of FPS(TPS actually with strong FPS elements) but I thought it would be great to test considering the rising playerbase.I got disappointed.I rate it negative for 3 reasons OPTIMIZATION this game have potential but at the moment the optimization is crappy (i7 6700K GTX 1070 and I still have really bad stutters the game is absurldy cpu intensive). Unable to open door at the start of the game because the game have to load textures is really great when you hear gunfight close to you )GRAPHICS it looks blurry not matter what setting I use hard to distinguish someone over 50 meter if there's many details around him (like a car of window) I play on 1080p 24". I assume it's caused by FXAA ( lowest AA setting doesn't fix it)GAMEPLAY the gunfights are boring as hell and I see you coming THIS IS NOT A REALISTIC GAME. Realism is a just pretext to introduce arcade gameplay like Battlefield series is. You move like you wear a 60 kg jacket. Jumping feels painful. I don't like TPS view (too much camping advantage)The game is sluggish feels like you're fighting in a dream (more like nightmare at that point..). Recoil is OK though mouse is OK (there's no acceleration if you wonder)ASIDE The server browser is a joke (there's no filter just a list...) I wanted to play on FPS view only server it's a messThe .exe crashesPpl insulting on voice chat in aircraf like child ( thanks god fixable though)

review: Started the game. Played for about 45 minutes on one map just to get a crate that got me an item 0 03$ worth.. great. Decided my pc sucks because i was getting 30 fps. Bought new pc close to high end. Downloaded game went into options put on ultra... barely 70 fps. Optimalization disgusting. Gameplay not even challenging. You are running around the whole map for 1 hour just to get 10+ kills and then getting shot in the head with one bullet dying. And if you manage to get that 1st place all you get is a few points that you get to spend on your C R A T E that will get you 0 03$ worth of items... Conclusion Optimalization very sad Gameplay ? Not challenging. No Ranking that will keep you pumped up. Glitchy as hell. Just to mention this game isnt even worth 30$ ofc its not full yet maybe i will change this review in the next few months. Or maybe the developers will abandon it. I am here just to say that my 30$ weren't worth this game and i am really sad that i heard all the commotion around this game bought a new pc and got barely 60fps stable ? Great no more hate i guess.Positives are maybe that this is probably more fun to play with friends than rival H1Z1 and you have more joy in looting.Overall 5/10.Unless you get it for half the price its not worth it not yet.

review: Idk what you guys are doing over there at Bluehole but no one appreciates being lied to. I have no clue what was in this newest update which caused it to be 5GB but this myth to your development team called "optimisation" is actually hilarious at this point. Your claim that you have improved optimisation issues is totally false. When someone who can play a game on the Frostbite engine at a stable 90fps cant get over a stable 50fps something is TOTALLY wrong with your game especially when it's on the Unreal Engine which when used by developers with actual talent can be a super crisp and smooth experience. the TL DR of this dont throw all of your development money into a tournament for a game that is in Early Access. That money can go towards systems for the game improving your god awful servers optimising the game so everyone has a great experience creating new Points of interests or new maps as a whole creating new weaponry creating a variety of strange but interesting game modes.All you guys are doing is riding off of the interest your game has picked up and this will die off the second a Triple A company gets on this amazing genre which you are making a mess of. This is the reason why you guys are putting dev money to tournaments to gain more temporary popularity and a cheeky little profit which wont even go towards the game. PlayerUnknown is milking this game dry before it dies dont let him steal your money either.

review: Let me start out by saying that if there was a middle ground button that is a mix between yes and no then I would click that.First things first I love the game and I desparately want more people to join the playground of this ily titled video game but it is hard to recommend to people because of it's constant appearances of bugs glitches etc. The devs are very transparent and give every update in full and in general will listen to the community. However instead of fixing the vehicles or the buggy sounds they decide to hold a tournament in Germany. And instead of fixing "sometimes buildings just don't load" glitch or the crashes they add new weapons or vehicles. Instead of fixing the doors or the frequent network connectivity issues they decide to add crates that cost real money to open.Even with public outcry for these bugs to be fixed they decide to go out and try to make it as close to an esport as possible without it even being a 'fixed' game. The devs only seem to listen when there is a huge issue or listen to new additions to the game instead of fixing bugs. It's so endlessly frustrating but I give it the benefit of the doubt because of it being in early access. But is an early access game really ready to have a tournament with a 350k prize pool at gamescom?Only buy it if you understand what you are getting into.

review: Game has a lot of potential but currently largely unplayable. You better have a good rig to play this on i don t think minimum requirements are correct. I have i5 2500K 16 Gb ddr3 and gtx 960 4Gb and game runs at like 15 fps at lowest possible settings and when fire fight breaks out it drops for around 5 fps which means that firefights literally often last for 3 frames and there is no chance to do anything if you are spotted. Sounds are very glitched which probably are because of general lag and sound localisation appears to be occasionally reversed. Sounds are your most imporant tool of detecting another players so this a huge deal. Graphics feel glitcy but that might my rig though.Game itself is very much about looting camping dying to campers dying to blue wall of death that does way too much damage on late game and often forces you to run across open field when there are enemies shooting you from cover. Of my last 10 times in top 10 blue circle screwed me over 8 times and so far i ve found no cure for it but to get lucky with camping spot. Shooting is very laggy for me atleast and most of time bullets seem to hit but not register. Shotguns only work on people standing still moving targets might take 2 shells to head and not be affected by them. At early game it takes a second for clicks to register whether it is opening a door or picking up an item. Melee fights are match between 2 ghosts because lag makes it look like you punches are hitting air and then dying 10 meters away from your opponent having punched you in the face ages ago.Could be lots of fun but there is a ton of updates bug fixes and balancing that need to come first. It s an realy access game and it feels like it. I d probably recommend this for gamers with new computers and good internet connection but not for anyone else.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Cannot recommend until FOV slider is implemented into the game.There was a fix to allow for comfortable 90 FOV but the Devs 'fixed it' in the latest update.Your only option now is play in 55 FOV with the camera clipping through your character's shoulders.Unplayable to me now.Will not give a decent review until this very basic setting to accommodate those with motion sickness and those who don't suffer from 'consolitis'.The game is good but buy it once you hear of an FOV implementation. I'm not kidding it's THAT BAD

review: I love the idea and it's not bad but after playing for a couple of matches I've got several complaints. Most importantly is the lag caused both by the network and I suppose my system though I am running a 7th gen i7 processor and 16gb of ram this game has a really tough time rendering things and causes my game to freeze up. My internet speed is also 30mbps so I'm not sure why there would be a problem in that regard. MY system has no problem running heavier loads so I don't think the game itself is properly optimized yet. My next complaint is that the map is so damn big for just 100 people honestly. The timers in which the play area shrink and the rate at which it does seems way too quick. It sucks to spend majority of the game running to the play area only to get there and be killed by the people who found the vehicles first and secured a good camping location. I think another year or two in development would do this game justice.

review: Honestly I thought I would really enjoy this but that is not the case.It's buggy as hell. I appreciate it's still early access but they've got the funding. They have a button on the main page to 'refresh the UI incase it's buggy'. If that isn't an indicator of what to expect I don't know what is.Performance is terrible. People with modest rigs still suffer from poor fps.It's so clunky. Things you can't walk up or climb over are just beyond frustrating. Putting your gun to a window or over a desk prevents you from doing so. When you think you're picking up ammo off the floor you end up picking the gun instead you switch back but then have to reload the gun again even though it was previously loaded.The maps are so large half the time it feels like a walking simulator. You spend 50% of your time staring at the floor for items 49% walking and 1% shooting.The general gun mechanics are strange. There's been several times I've pumped a full round into someone (the blood spats are an indicator it hit) and the player is still alive and shoots you dead in one. Other times I've shot someone with a shotgun from 25 meters away and killed them in 1 hit.The devs themselves are poor too and act like children. It's just a massive cash cow now. Here's why Bringing in micro transactions during early access is just unethical especially after the amount it's made in sales there's no excuse. Bringing in micro transations when they clearly stated they didn't. So that was a massive lie. They ban people for stream sniping and even those that aren't. There's no care for their players. They support the streamers because it's their way of marketing and getting more sales. They ban people from their forum that have posted a polite opinion. They cry when another company "steals" their idea even though battle royale style games has been around for years.

review: My first experience with PlayerUnkown's Battlegrounds ("PUBG") was a rather negative one. I had read all there was to read about the game's horrible optimization yet still had a glimpse of optimism that I wouldn't be a victim of it. But that first game I got into threw all that optimization out the window when the game barely functioned at all despite me having good enough hardware.I set the settings all down to the bare minimum everything to low and then the game finally started functioning at a good and playable framerate. I dive into the technicalities first before any other aspect of the game because this is a game that will stress you out and disturb you with its poor performance. There will be times when menu buttons won't function you'll see errors you can'r resolve and have to restart and simply bugs that make you want to pull your hair out.Furthermore if you have anything less than extremely good hardware get ready to play with poor graphics since that's most the settings will let you go without causing you to stutter and get very low framerates. The excuse for all of this is that it's in Early Access and thus it's 'understandable'. What remains to be seen is if the issues are resolved by the time the game gets out of the early access stage (if that time ever comes).But if you can ignore all of that there really is something to be had in PUBG. The concept is fairly simple you take 100 people throw them on a large island that has ruins houses buildings vehicles towers military bases and above all weapons. They scrounge the island for whatever arsenal and armor they can find and fight until one remains. Eventually the playable area begins to lower until a small chunk of land is left upon which the final victor will stand.This simple concept is taken and presented in a way that makes every match feel unique despite the same objective. A lot of this is because of the large map that is quite vast in size. Aside of the re use of the house models that are scattered across the island each location feels different and thus leads to fun experiences each time. The main thrill of the game comes from all the hiding guessing and killing you'll be doing as you try to make your way to the final few survivors. I'd give this game a thumbs down if I hadn't too felt that rush of being among the last 10 people as you see the area around you closing in gunfires running ablaze in the distance and you're hiding in a patch of grass hoping to make it to the end and get the glorious chicken dinner. That thrill is really what this game's all about and I feel as long as the developers are commited to solving the bugs and fixing the technical issues of the game there is a lot to be had and experienced in PUBG.

review: What happened to this game. I remember the summer this game came out and it was this laggy piece of that I loved. I played this game to death over that first summer of it's release and I had a blast throughout. I met some friends on this game that I still talk to more than a year later. This game was released very early when the battle royale genre was getting popular and was basically the better version of H1Z1 in my opinion. I can still remember my first game on landing at Mylta power and getting pummled but trying again and showing my friends as we sunk 100's of hours into it. Some of the best time of my life were playing this game. But then update 1.0 came out. It was hyped up to be this great update which would add cool new things like more weapons vaulting a new entire map to play on new vehicles to drive and more. My friends and I were so hyped up about it but when it came out we were sorely dissapointed. We played it for maybe 5 hours and thought this new map sucks the game hasn't been fixed why is this not early access anymore why do the new weapons feel awful why are there more bugs than before? We thought the update would change the game forever and it did in the worst way possible. This game used to be filled with passion and the creator wanted to do something with this but maybe the over popularity ruined it for us. I wouldn't recommend in the current state and it hurts me to say that even after all the hours i have sinked in to it
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: 4/10 A game that has less to do with survival and more to do with a roulette wheel of server lag spikes and game crashes that define the user experience from the start of the game. Delibiating server lag renders this game completely unplayable. Resulting in minute or greater lag spikes in a situation when seconds count. Couple that with the poorly compressed graphics that are slow to render in the first place. The result is a game that looks like it's from the mid 1990s and runs like it too. Due to it requiring the user to run at the lowest setting even if they play every other game at highest graphics settings.A game with a lot of potential that ultimately falls short of being fun because of the numberious technical issues the interrupt the user experience at every turn.

review: Lack of content Few weapons few vehicles just one scenario one "mode". Lot of bugs. Performance Issues. Outdated Mechanics You need to select grenade or physical weapon before use it there's no way to use it directly by pressing a button. Cant take cover while aiming need to expose yourself if want to shoot throught windows and holes. Physical weapons do damage per hit and has range problems instead of killing instantly considering the area hitted. Sounds doesn't work properly can't tell from where shoots steps and vehicles are coming. Toxic team players In the Squad mode is quiet commom that your team mates kill or let you die to steal your loot. Unbalanced Shotguns Every shotgun shoot is instakill even with advanced ballistc protections. Better physical combat mechanics and damage reduction could solve or ate least soften this question. There's nothing that could counter it now. Tons of annoying minor problems There's too much to write here but Guns doesnt start in the automatic shoot mode need to select it guns arent recharged alone when out of ammo etc ...Resume I highly regret of buying this feels like a 10 years outaded fps boring and repetitive. I couldnt stand solo or duo matchs anymore in second day of gaming. The squad mode is a little bit more enjoyfull but also get tired after one week.

review: Apparently people are gettting banned for killing streamers which is impossible to know who is who there's no gamer tags. So killing people in a game where you kill people might get you banned.Controls are clunky be prepared for mass frustration trying to jump over a low obstacle.Incredibly unforgiving for new players. No matchmaking system so you'll spend 95% of your games for the first few months getting killed and not knowing how. Be prepared to mute your voice chat options as soon as you buy the game the people in the lobby are constantly screeching.Roughly one quarter of the games I drop into have all the buildings missing or not rendered which means you just waste all your queue time and have to leave.Server Lag usually results in lost gunfights at point blank. Matchups are usually decided by who shoots first not positioning.Chase down opponent with crowbar. Swing at pointblank range and miss. Opponent kills you with long rifle.Game just banned 25 000 accounts or so for cheating but has sold millions of copies and doesn't have adequate cheat protection.0/10 for realism when it tries to be realistic.Edit Post Release Everything is the same as the last few months people are still cheating my gun dissapeared in the middle of a fight and sound turns off for no reason.Pre game non loading makes play impossible. Basically the game will sit on the loading screen even on a 1080 and not load in until the plane has made its whole way across the island.

review: Week 1 of most recent patch You had a great game here. The recent update broke it beyond belief. If you are going to have a test server and you find issues ON THE TEST SERVER. Maybe you should FIX THEM! Week 2 of most recent patch Kept playing on the advice of others. The issues still persist AND now there are massive frame drops in fire fights. I have a 1080ti a 6700K and 32GB of RAM. Not to mention Gigabit internet. This is all on your end and I am sick of it. I will come back to your game when your idiot developers fix it.Week 3 of most recent patch Crashes are more rampant than ever. This update is the worst I have ever seen added to a game. Still a HARD NO from me!Week 4 of most recent patch It has now been over a month since the most recent update and it is still incredibly broken. I have gigabit internet and a computer that can play witcher 3 on ultra with hair effects on... Yet in this game I get insane frame drops and network lag like nobodies business. I am done coming in second in solo due to massive frame drops and lag. Get your together. If I could refund this game I would!Week 5 of most recent patch Still so broken people can see through walls and shoot through walls. Servers with their dsync are so disfunctional that asians to go US servers just to get easy kills and vice versa... Week 8 All of these issues still persist even after a FIVE GIG UPDATE! Why bring in new weapons and maps and yet still have all these desync issues? How brain damaged can devs be?

review: Feel like I should post a review with all the people that have been dogging on this game lately. Yes its early access and i know people are weary of that I've been burned on a few early access games in the past and there have been some issues with servers but i would not hesitate to buy this game at $30 as it sits. If it were left as is id still be happy.Pros Its a steal at $30Huge and growing player baseDevs have been great with updates and supportGameplay is great and every match is excitingCons As with every early access game there are bugs with updates but nothing to worry too much over and always dealt with quicklyEvery once and a while theres some bad server lag but have been coming across it less and less People have also been complaining about buying keys for these new crates but I think thats completely unwarranted. First of all the crate is bought with in game currancy you get for playing matches and there are other crates you can choose to get that open for free. Second its an optional key you can buy to open a crate which just contains cosmetic items. If you buy a crate somehow by accident and dont want to buy a key THE CRATE IS MARKETABLE. (I've nearly made back purchase price of the game with crates) Its not some sort of pay to win thing. The proceeds are to raise money for charity and a tournament set up/prize pool not an uncommon occurrance. I have gotten way more than $30 worth of entertainment out of this game so far (150+ hours) and would highly reccomend buying before full release.

review: * الايجابيات + الاسلحة موزونة وعددها كويس (موش بطال كبداية) وكل سلاح له اضافاته وذخائره الخاصة فيه.+ الماب متنوع من ناحية التضاريس وتقدر تستغل هذا الشيء لصالحك.+ القنص والقتل بشكل عام في اللعبة يعطيك شعور لا يوصف d+ الجرافيكس جدا ممتاز وقاعد يتحسن مع كل تحديث.+ المناخ والطقس يتغير من قيم الى قيم في الماب.+ ما فيه أحد قوي باللعبة مهما كانت الاسلحة والدروع والعلاجات الي مع اللاعبين الذكي هو الي ينتصر ويذبح البقية.+ انت تختار المكان الي تبغى تبدا القيم فيه من خلال قفزك من الطائرة.+ بعد كل قيم تكسب نقاط وبالنقاط ذي تشتري صناديق ثم تبيعها في الماركت ب 5 ريال أو اكثر d d+ اللعبة هي الوحيدة الي قدرت تتقن فكرة مجموعة اشخاص يتقاتلون حتى يبقى فائز واحد بشكل ممتع سواء كنت لحالك او مع أخوياك.+ رتم اللعبة يبدأ بطيء ومع مرور الوقت يصير حماسي وسريع.+ التفاصيل الصغيرة في اللعبة خورافية (زي اذا كان فيه شخص في الطابق الثاني يمشي الي في الطابق الاول ممكن يشوف السقف يطلع منه غبار او اللمبة الي في السقف تتكهرب اذا مشى فوقها ايضا السيارة تحتاج بنزين أو تتعطل إلخ إلخ d)+ اللعبة تقدر تلعبها بالمنظور الي يعجبك تبغى منظر اول أو منظور ثالث كلها موجودة.+ مطور اللعبة قاعد يحدثها أول بأول بشكل خورافي جدا.* السلبيات قيادت المركبات معاقة حركة الاعب معاقة وخاصة في القفز القتال اليدوي معاق. الماب كبير جدا وص م م لـ200 شخص مو لـ100. القلتشات كثيرة ومزعجة تخرب اللعبة عليك. اداء اللعبة مضروب يعني ممكن يكون جهازك قوي لكن الفريمات تصير مضروبة. اللغة العربية في اللعبة برعاية ترجمة قوقل. اللعبة حرفيا مافيها نظام level أو Rank او شيء من هذا القبيل زي بقية العاب الاون لاين!! البيوت عبارة 4 أشكال مكررة تكرار بشكل يجيب الغثيان. السيارات عددها قليل جدا جدا لدرجة ان اذا منطقة اللعبة بعيده عنك اطلع من القيم لان مافيه أمل توصل على رجولك. الاصوات في اللعبة سيئه في بعض الاحيان تسمع شخص يمشي يمين فجاه تلقاه يسارك وهكذا. /color باختصار اللعبة جدا جدا ممتعة سواء كنت لحالك او مع أخوياك.9 10.

review: The game is Great and is very enjoyable but there are a few key problems. The first major problem is the games framerate even if you do meet the system requirements. Another is the weapon balancing which could be easily fixed (and I look forward to seeing progress on this aspect). The last major problem is the glitches and bugs but these are to be expected in an early access game. So overall this would be a good game to buy... once it is completed and fans look forward to when the game is fully released.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game is broken. I love it. The devs on the other hand... they basically called their own playerbase a bunch of racists because us Americans didnt want to play with China... from across the globe. The Chinese are over 99% of the hackers in this game and when you play an online game with people from across the globe especially with 100 people in one game you're gonna experience some ping issues. Anyways the maps are nice eriandel being the obviously better map the graphics are nice at least when they aren't bugging out and the different guns and attachments are nice. The customization is really good (buy a gas mask it's only like 15 cents now). The part of this game that keeps me coming back to it however is the rush that you get either at the beginning of a game when you land with several other people and you are scrambling to get any weapon you can before rushing the others or at the end of a game when there are only a fraction of the original number of players left and you don't know where anyone is unless they are shooting... it really makes you think quickly and my palms sweat almost every match.This game is worth the $30 in my opinion. It is not "easy to learn hard to master " as they say. It is the opposite of that. Beginners will be on. That is part of the game. Once you get half decent and start winning some games or at least coming close the game gets fun. It gets competitive. You get mad when you lose at the end of the game or even when you get sniped in the head from nowhere. but that's all part of the random nature of the game. If every fight was fair then you would never get those moments where your opponent has the upper hand but you come out on top anyways. When your enemy gets the first shot but then you get to cover and end up winning. Those moments are priceless.If you know how to take a loss this game is for you. If you like competitive shooters like CS GO but want a sort of break from all the action though it somehow being more intense then this game is for you. If you have a small group of friends to play with (or a nice discord you use) then this game is a great time in duos or squads. Try it out. If you don't like it refund it. If you do have a good time.8/10
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: If spending money was just about a game I would saay yes HOWEVER with all of the negativity that engulfs this game I wouldn't touch it especially knowing what I know now.As a purchaser of this game you mean absolutely nothing but a paycheck to these people. They literally do ban people for reasons that are beyond questionable and by their own admission unprovable like the honking BS. There are artticles on it on the net. Then you have the lame streamers put out a video a few days ago to try to push their narrative showing an alleged "stream honker". There are NO other videos on the internet to support this claim. There is this 1 viedo with the same 2 honkers each time driving STRAIGHT to the streamers like the streamers are telling them where to go or a pre set point. The video was posted Aug 23rd. The original unedited videos that were supposedly used to make this video are NO WHERE to be found.Very pathetic. The reason a few streamers are allowed to pull this garbage is in my opinion they are friends with the creator. I know Grimmz is one of his best friends and more than likely the person that is referrenced as giving Green the idea to make a "Hunger Games" type Battle Royal. The picture used in every article of the "sniper" is GRIMMZ FFS. If you don't think so take a good look and compare the 2. It's him.Now there is also a butt load of cheating in PUBG. There are so many cheats that it is unreal even top streamers use autoaim. However if you even MENTION cheats on the forums the 10 12 shadow mods that they have will come and flame until they have enough to delete the post. That's how they operate. They lurk in the shadows. They don't want to do the real mod work of moving/combining posts making pins etc... So they just flame and delete because they are lazy. That is why sooo many posts get vaped. Also 90% of threads are immediately hit with these same people screaming TROLL POST. It is so overused there that it is nauseating. Like having a bunch of SJW snowflakes running the place.http //www.eurogamer.net/articles/2017 07 01 the hackers of playerunknowns battlegroundsGreene sympathises with some of the people creating these tools deeming them misguided genius' rather than petty criminals. Although there may be a lot of money currently in producing hacks for PUBG he doesn't take it personally and even alludes to knowing some of the programmers who make these cheats in real life."I have a lot of respect for the guys who write the hacks " he says. "I know a lot of the people in the game industry think they're scum. I really don't think that. I've been lucky enough to call a few of them friends. You know they're not necessarily bad people all they want to do is just find holes in things. Like as you're growing up you wanted to take apart the radio to see how it works. That's the kind of mentality they have."A lot of the guys who buy the cheats yes I would put call them just cheaters. But all the people who write the cheats they're just looking for an outlet for something that they love doing."If you come here and read reviews I would pose questions on other reviews not the forums because you will only get a biased view there. I am in my 40's. I'm not a kid that rages and makes something up. I am going by what I have seen and experienced over the past few weeks.If you have a problem with the game and go to the forums you will be ridiculed as having a potato PC or some idiot/idiots will ALWAYS answer get gud typical forum responses used ranking most used to slightly less used. 1. Troll post 2. Get gud. 3. Potato PC. Get gud. 4.Delete 5. We know everything your just dumb. get gud troll post Oh and "nothing to see here move along" LMAO. Like a bunch of babies. It's nauseating it's pure unadulterated stupidity. If you think game lobbies with endless screamers shriekers music blasters ragers etc are bad... The forums are just as bad or worse probably because some of the worste ones are 3rd parties hiding who they are. They will be here to thumbs down this review but that's ok. It will still be here to show some truth.Save your money or buy something else. The people that would benefit from your money don't deserve it.

review: I've played this game a lot. Running this on a nvida 770 with an i5 3.2gHz cpu and 24 gb ram it runs smoothly on okay Graphics. The devs constantly updating the game and posting about all the new features and the bugfixes every week and a major patch every month. The game is a solid game and the best BR(Battle Royale) game as of now... and it's still only in early access. Pros Different game modes allowing 1 2 or teams of 4 to play. Both First Person mode and 3rd person. You pick which one you wanna play. Tons of different attachments for the weapons. Tons of different weapons.Tons of different cosmetic features. Tons of vehicles including a motorbike on which you can perform sick flips.Cons It's still early access... so plenty of bugs many which have already been removed. The community's complaints on every single thing the Devs do even if it benefits the game/community.

review: I really tried to like this game. I played for around 80 minutes before giving up on it. I didn't get too many rounds in but in all my rounds i had only three real shootouts and one was rubberbandy which is okay cause I get its still being developed. Just one of the shootouts however was fun and felt like a real back and forth altercation which i lost. The importnat thing is that it was fun. It was exciting. I never got that again. I barely saw anyone even after trying to jump out with the denser groups of people. After 80 minutes of gameplay and only 15 seconds of fun I really can't justify spending any more time on it. Hopefully it grows into a great game because at its core i see potential.

review: I don't recommend this game in it's current form even though it is early access. The servers are extremely low quality and the developers have announced that they have to rebuild a large portion of the core game code in order to stop the horrendous desync and other player lag. Being shot and killed seconds after taking cover is unfortunately a normality in this game (think early Battlefield 3 style only much worse).As for gameplay this is absolutely NOT H1Z1. The gunplay is far better and the overall feel is aimed towards a realistic approach. It's essentially a game of who spots who first in a lot of cases and unfortunately again with the desync sometimes even that's not good enough. Gunfights are largely a coin toss to see who's hits register first if at all.The good news is that the developers are very attentive to problems and are quickly working on improving the game and adding new features along the way. I will update this once the desync issues are fixed and the game is in a much better state. If the majority of the desync can be eliminated and the server quality improved this will be a really great battle royale. It's popularity has already gotten Daybreak to move their butts and actually work on fixing H1Z1 and communicating with their playerbase which is tremendous as well.Edit Love the downvotes for honesty and transparency keep 'em coming. Broken game is broken don't believe the hype folks.Edit 6/25/17 Performance on the GPU side has increased tremendously which is to be congratulated. Hit reg especially melee is still a massive issue whereas desync doesn't seem to be as bad as it was. Unfortunately I've also come across my first definite cheater though I suppose that's to be expected with the massive increase in popularity lately. Unfortunate really ruined an otherwise okay run.Edit 4/14/18 Recently revisited PUBG with a friend and I have to say the optimization is currently feeling really great. My i7 2600K/GTX 980 system didn't have a single complaint in the frame department. The new map is also pretty cool and the updated UI is clean and minimally intrusive which I always approve of. I can't speak on network stability since we only managed to squeak in about 3 very quick rounds. I understand there is much to be desired in the area of destructable objects (fences window bars etc) which is unfortunate. Once I manage to get a few good rounds in I'll update again.Edit 4/17/18 Having played a few more rounds I have to say I still really haven't had a good chance to shoot at anyone. The game continues to be one of whoever spots the other first generally wins the exchange. One major complaint I have is that at one point I ended shooting at a duo with my duo partner he ended up getting dropped and we got flanked by another team. I peeked into a guy around a shack and fired about 5 rounds directly into his face and I died. My teammate in spectator reports that I fired once at best. I'm not sure if this continues to be due to the abysmal tick rate the game runs at or if desync/lag is still a major issue but I was pretty disappointed. I'm still looking to get a couple solid rounds in where I'm able to fire at people multiple times in the round before I commit to an updated score.

review: I really do like this game but it's sad I HAVE to give this game a negative review. Now the main reason why this is all negative is because of the god damn optimization. It's complete crap! It's worse then GTA IV for crying out loud!I was in a match just a second ago and I had 5 kills I was on a role. There was 20 people left I was in cover waiting for someone. Then boom. The game freezes and crashes. My specs aren't even bad I have an i3 4160 3.60 GHz 16 GB DDR3 RAM 2000 MHz and a GTX 1050... like seriously? It crashed... And I can bet you I didn't get any credit for that match at all like it didn't even happen. That was actually my best match ever until it crashed...Another thing I forgot to mention the loading times are now horrid as hell it usually hasn't taken me that long to get into any matches but it took so long one time I spawned in when there was only 60 people left... Yes I said 60 when it started at 100 players. My internet isn't even bad I don't suffer from ping lag or teleporting in the game at all.So I'll go over some pros and cons.Pros Great Graphics Pretty entertaining as a battle royale typed gameCons Horrible optimization Servers USUALLY aren't always working... Textures take for ever to load in Good amount of hackersIf anything I don't recommend getting this game at full price only because of the reasons I've listed. It isn't worth 30 dollars unless they fix the god damn optimization... That's my big issue that I honestly can't stand. I can run all new games in 2018 usually at 60 FPS maxed out and it runs better then this game. smh

review: I was hoping for this game to be the ultimate battle royale game but I think PLAYERUNKNOWN and his asian dev team bit off a bit more than they can chew.THE GRAPHICS Long story short this game is not a looker. I run everything at 2K on ultra but still the graphics are mediocre and the design choices are nothing special at all. It's like they just decided slavic name y towns and cities are survival themed so they went with it. Character customization is pretty much non existant with very limited choices in different models of hair and the likes. Even the clothing options are limited with only 2 jackets with 5 skins in total. This means every character you meet will look like the other one you just got shot by.The map is not up to standards with todays other games. The scale is off with roads being maybe up to 3 times the size of a normal road so they could fill the map more. The landscape has no real life to it with a severe lack of bushes rocks and difference in terrain height something that is even more noticeable with the washed out and lifeless grass textures. Things are pretty samey aswell when it comes to construction you will see buildings being repeated and small details like most doors looking the same. In graphics and design the tiny details matter and I'm not familiar with the development teams previous games but it looks like they don't have the creative art &amp design department to think of something intresting and original.THE GAMEPLAY It's OK. It's nothing new if you have ever played H1Z1 ArmA or Rust's Battle Royales. Once you go through the small amount of lootable weapons there are in the shipping of the early access theres only the PvP perspective left to the game. Which is quite enjoyable but hindered by a bad FOV (It's pretty bad if you look down your head is in your chest.) meaning you try to use 3rd person as often as possible. This brings the review to the fatal flaw of the game so far which is the implementation of 3rd person. You will always be able to win through hiding in grass and behind buildings using 3rd person to look over the obstacles. The person who is moving is more than often the one who loses any fight. The gameplay is therefore slowed down to a crawl in some moments with no one wanting to show themselves. I've heard roumors about a first person only server but I dont know if theres any confirmation. It's the same problem that plauged ArmAs BR until people started enforcing first person only on their servers.The game is basically an inbetweener of ArmA and H1Z1 with the good sides and bad sides of both. Im guessing if you like both you'll find this game an alright game to play with friends. If you really like either one you will be fanny flustered about having to deal with the flaws of another game.FINAL RATING 4/10Atrocious creative work with a bland unoriginal game setting. Too much emphasis on gameplay without dealing with the flaws of either of the two games that PLAYERUNKNOWN previously worked on. The gameplay is still alright though meaning the game does have alot of potential but it's probably too late in the development to change any of its major flaws. I'll keep an eye out on this game to see if it ever changes it's course but for now I see no reason to play it.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Lets be honest in my earlier review of this game i had a LOT of gripes with it. However the devs have been moderatley active in working with this game to make it a more enjoyable experience. so far they have made much needed balance adjustments to most weapons which has "shifted the meta" to a more pleasant pvp point. they have still neglected the plethora of physics problems in the game however driving and jumping in PUBG are still almost unbearable tasks that are neccisary in every match. im not going to touch on my problems with the 3rd person camera at the moment since news suggests its a feature that may very well be on its way out fingers crossed. hopefully that will be the last nail in the coffin that is some of the super campy playstyle of this game. where people can watch you from total saftey without giving up any info on themselves until they can easily jump you without any risk at all.while being lacking in content each match still feels unique and interesting. they have introduced a new custom match system that adds some diversity to the matches however it is not accesable for anyone to set up an unfortunate decision. all of that being said i still would not reccomend this game at its current state at the 30$ price point.

review: Personally I find this game hard to recommend. I really don't see how much fun it is when you end up spending so much time trying to find people. And I don't mean matchmaking. This game has got plenty of people playing and not even close to dead. I'm talking about how long it takes to find people when you decide to avoid high traffic areas to minimize your chances of dying early in the match. It's a first for me but I actually have a problem with the map size being so huge. Like ridiculously huge. It's larger than anything I've seen in Battlefield 1's multiplayer. Sure there's a player limit of 100 but that's very little for the amount of ground you'll have to cover if you can't get any long range weapons or a vehicle. There's also no tutorial so go on Youtube or hope your favorite streamer that plays this game is willing to teach you how to play. Other than that my only other issue is the frame drops but it's pretty minor for my PC. Not sure how it would fair on a mid range PC but I've heard it does pretty decent on a gtx 1060 and any decent CPU. The controls feel a little weird at first but you get used to it after a while. Now as for the positives. The game starts you off in a pre game lobby where you can pick up weapons and practice using them until the 100th player joins. Usually not a long wait as those lobbies fill up in seconds. I really like the survival feel of the game. You have to find weapons and supplies to survive and run away from a blue dome of death. There's also random airstrikes and supply drops with valueble items such as a sniper or medkit. It has this sort of Hunger Games like fell to it just without some prize at the end and the gaming telling something about a chicken dinner. All in all it's not a bad game. I just don't enjoy it much and think that people who play similarly to me might also feel the same. I'd say give it a shot if the game is on sale. Otherwise you may or may not feel like you just wasted $30 on an over hyped game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: The developers of this game are slowly pulling a "The Culling".
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Let me start by saying this is the best battle royal game i have played and i have played all except h1z1's but that waas due to UI and loot mechanics(i didnt like the inventory).First ill give the pro points.PRO Large map it has a lot of areas from thick forest to thinned out forest and lots of cover from rocks to bushes and other random set pieces. Lots of swimmable areas and even a town that is flooded. Military bases and military checkpoints all the way to hunting huts. There are also nice little hidden loot spots too which is nice. Loot. As said every building you can see spawns loot. All of them. There is not one human made structure that doesn't give you loot. Weapons. As of now there isn't a massive array of weaponary but what is there is very useful from pisols smg to sniper rifles ALL have a high leathality. My highest killing gun is the UMP which is a 9mm varient in this game and it destroys people within 20meters. There is not one gun that doesn't feel like it is useless. Also lots of attachments from RDS SIlencers and 12x scopes. Buildings. All are very well designed and i feel that the layout inside feels realistic to what a house would have. I mean compared to something like ARMA where you don't know where someone would sleep let alone take a dump this game actually has toilets pantrys bedrooms and kitchens. This is useful because it lets you pick better locations in side of the house to have a gunfight in and more objects to hide behind. Servers. OCE Asian South American North American and Euro as of now are in the game which is nice. The latency is great and i have not had one issue yet with my connection to any of the servers i have tried (Asian NA and OCE) with 180ms to NA servers and 30ms to Australian/OCE servers. Server load. 100 people in a lobby/match. Short que time with minimal lobby time wait of only 2 minutes tops. If the lobby notices that no one else is joining it will auto start the game after a count down. This means you can have 30 or so people in a lobby then it will start which can at times be annoying but still is nice if you want to play late at night and just have a really intense match with a small amount of people. Cars/boat. 3 to choose from at the moment and one boat. All drive very nice compared to Wildlands(the ubisoft game) with minimal issues bar one for me which is that some times it takes a while for the game to notice im trying to enter the car. Not sure if bug or just locational activation issue. Weather. It can rain. Not sure if anything else but its nice to have that feature to change up the match. I personally hate it because you can hardly hear anyone around you plus it causes frame issues for me but thats because my computer is pretty garbage. Team and solo mode. Okay now this is what worried me about this game. But it was instantly settled once i started playing. Solo means SOLO no teams at all or teaming. I mean people could team up but i have never seen it. Duo is 2 people only and Squad is up to 4 players you can enter with 2 or 4 if you want or you can just go totally solo into squad for an insane challange. Medical supplies. It takes time to use meds i know as a BR player healing can be very irritating to deal with in a fight as some can be fast and others non existant. In this game it takes 3 seconds for Bandage 6 for pain pills(which is an over time heal) 6 for first aid kits and 10 seconds or more for Medkit. CONS LOD issues. I personally get this because i have a normal HDD which is very old and needs to be replaced. But some other people i know have had this issue before. It causes buildings not to load in properly and feels like you are running 1 2fps. You think its your GPU but it isn't its your HDD or RAM being overloaded so it causes the computer to freeze up. A good fix for this is to make sure nothing else is running in the background prior to joining a game. This issue can last as long as your HDD is jammed up or at 100% load. Terrain/map issues. Remember with an Alpha or BETA game you will always run into these. Some times if you jump up onto something it will get you stuck and there are some locations on the ground or next to walls which will cause this same issue where you are floating. There are also some invisible walls but very few of those. Overall Optomization. Pretty much not fully optomized. Expect to change your settings to medium or low/verylow. This can be a pain but later the game will be fully optomized so just take your time. Voice chat. Lots of spam so you may aswell turn it off most times. Price. Pretty high right now so it can put you off. But if you love Battle Royal games it is so damn worth it i swear on me mum. Other than that i can't think of any other problems with the game. I am by no means a fanboi of this game i didn't even try get an Alpha version when they offered it. I thought it would be another Culling or a crappy version of H1Z1 but i am happily proven wrong. I know there are probably more pros/cons i could add but right now none are so glaringly visable that i need to add to this review. The only thing that bothers me the most is just my own hardware not keeping up with this game and that i can fix myself in my own time.REMEMBER THIS IS A BETA RELEASE REVIEW. I will continue to update this as they update their game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I personally really like this game. I think it has a lot of potential concidering it's only in the beta faze. There are a lot of things that need fixed. For example better optimization. I shouldn't have any problems streaming the game in ultra when I spent $2 000.00 on my PC (hand built). Other than that it has a lot of fun moments especially with friends. Maybe consider making the game 150 players to have more action throughout the game rather than have a game where getting 6 kills is decent. Also enabling FPP leaderboards (which I am aware will eventually happen) and enabling some form of system disallowing countries playing outside of their servers. This creates inconsistency with the game because of lag compensation. Regardless of all of the flaws it's a great game and I still recommend. Just some constructive critisism in a positive light. Thumbs up!

review: PUBG is a pretty great game but it can also be pretty annoying when you die 20 times in a row and cant get a single kill. When I first wrote this review I said I have never met hackers while playing this but now I take it back most games I play (not actually most games but pretty frequent) usually end up with me dying from either really skilled players or hackers (I hope its hackers) and thank god they added death cams it helps me determine who is legit and whos a hacker (sometimes its hard to tell as lag could just be a result of how the player was able to kill)Another thing about PUBG is that everyone got butthurt over the loot crates being added to the game the only thing lootcrates do is give your character clothes to wear and the clothes only change how your character looks they dont change how much damage you do or anything it just changes the way your character looks and heck its a great way to make some steam wallet money too.Also whenever i play a squad match or duos (i play in NA servers) i always seem to be paired with people who dont speak english it isnt all that bad but its hard to communicate when you dont understand what your teamate is saying and vice versa Im not sure if i just have bad luck at finding partners but its either im in a team filled with non english speakers or theres only one person who speaks english besides me. (Ive had some pretty fun squad matches though with guys that dont or can barley speak/understand english so it isnt all that bad but its hard to coordinate)Finally in terms of rubberbanding matches and shots not registering none of those things have ever happened to me. The only time I have had rubberband connection was when my wifi was incredibly slow so slow that it would take me 10 mins to connect to youtube (not really). For shot registration ive never seemed to have a problem with that but there have been times where when i kill a player right when they shoot and if the bullet hits me I don't take any damage at all.I would definitley recommend this game and play it with friends its much more fun that wayAlso with the recent updates they have fixed fps i can finally now get a solid 60 fps with most of my settings at low or medium
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: best battle royale best pubg #1

review: I would 100% recommend this game as it's extremely fun to play. If you have a group of friends to play with it makes it even better.I like the direciton the game is going (except the key and crate system that requires use of real money) and I'm excited for the new maps mod support and vaulting. I love FPP and I love the strategic squad combat that this game enables. All in all I would definitely recommend this game to anyone considering buying it.Thank you Bluehole and PLAYERUNKNOWN for this great game!

review: So I bought this game in EA status in August 2017 and back then I really liked this game although the performance and the movement system was awful. Right now i really wouldnt recommend this game because a few but major things 1. It's has left EA too early.Too many things like bad servers (it's impossible to pick up a weapon within the first 2 minutes) bad performance( e.g. I don't have a great PC but its still enough for games like BF1 but in this game i always get my frames dropping down to the 20 mark when sombody shoots im a radius where i can see the muzzle flash. A really big disadvantage in endgame scenarios) the awful netcode(bullets just disapearing when you are shooting with a sniper rifle with zeoring on) or bugs (my best one was when I drove with a 3 P motorcycle on Miramar and me and my car just teleported in the air where i fall of the motorcycle.. happened to me at least 3 times or the "bug" I really don't know if this is done by purpose or not when a nade is near you you'll get blown away or more just teleported 3m to your right/left which isn't that bad but you also catch speed so you'll most likley die because of "falling" *gg*) ruin the game but these things are present in most games right now and which I don't really feel disturbed.2. Loot allocationThis is by far the most common reason why people die early and I think is really unfair.In one of my scenarios I landed in Primorsk at a small cafe and 2 houses. I looted them and neither i found a weapon nor a backpack i died because someone pushed me. Sure this whole game is based on luck and less on skill(which is also not really nice) but this is just disatvantaging people and stealing their fun with the game.3. The communityThis is by far the most thing i hate about the game. The ability to "revive" a teammate wfter he got downed is meanwhile useless because of all the people finishing you because they are greedy. Sure somtimes its usefull tu finish somebody off but for example in early game when you land with 1 maybe 2 teams and one of them downs and finshes you off instead of baiting the other teammate to come to them. This is by far the most stupid thing people make and is the only thing why this game pisses me off sometimes. Also there are 3rd person abuser who are only camping behind walls or in houses. Fair enough yes when you play 3rd person you'll have to expect this to happen but some people are using 3rd person so execssive you will have no chance. But most important there are people just iterrupting a firefight by killing the site which isn't even a danger to the team interrupting and these most likley get killed by te site that was and is a danger but they didnt killed them because.. I DON'T KNOW. Well back then you really had fun playing this game because there weren't so many people playing this.. now it's only a massacre of tryhards and trolls which is the only thing why I don't really enjoy this game so much I did in EA.. right now I still like it because I am probably here since EAbut because of the changes PUBG has gone through i like to switch between PUBG and Fortnite because Fortnite is making more fun so far. So for everyone wanting to buy this game don't you wont enjoy it but also dont buy H1Z1 its also trash. I would recommend Fortnite because it's less competitive and it has stable servers and a good performance.04/10 EoG Reviews

review: So far in PUBG I realized that I cannot mute earrape player in the spawn zone which lead to my headset literally ing breaking. Just like H1Z1 I get spawns with either only armor or only a weapon but never both. Hit registration seems to be laggy and I spectating is delayed and not as fun to watch. Nonetheless I am going to sink hundreds of hours into this game hoping that it wont become a dead cause like H1Z1. Good times have been had so far with duo and squad queues and I think that the game should get an optimization patch fairly soon. (Having a fairly great computer) I find it hard to run the game at 60+ FPS without heavy drops. I do recommend the game though to anyone that enjoys KOTH sort of games and I am certain these little things will be fixed with small patch releases in the future. We all have high hopes for the game and I really am excited to see this game work wonders. Good job 7.5/10!

review: July 25th The devs announced they would be bringing microtransactions into the game before the full release was finished. This contradicts their promise from months ago that before bringing in any additional content they would finish the game in its entirety. A concerning trend in dishonesty and unprofessionalism by PlayerUnknown and his team is beginning to form.July 21st The current state of the game is decent and has potential but there are 2 areas the development team needs to take more seriously Improving in game performance and community moderation. The game runs better than it used a couple months ago but is still pretty bad especially when compared to other popular titles. Bullets rubber banding lag poor server performance and fps drops are all pretty significant issues. In regards to community moderation they need to actually start taking the way the banning and reporting system works more seriously. The current format is perfect for people that want to troll other groups of players and ruin their experience while recieving no punishment in return. This review is subject to change

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Listen BlueHole just because someone makes the same style of game as you doesn't mean they flat out copied you. You don't own the Battle Royal genre no one does. If it were the case that Medal of Honor's developers would've sued the living Hell of out of studios like Infinity Ward Treyarch and Activision for making Call of Duty. Blizzard would've sued Jagex over the MMO genre claiming Runescape ripped off World of Warcraft and Valve would've probably sued Blizzard on the grounds that Overwatch copies Team Fortress 2. No one own a game genre. The reason you're losing to Fortnite is because your game is more or less an asset flip with hardly any identity at all. Fortnite on the other hand has its assets made by competent artists and a very talented team of programmers and games designers. It's neither their fault nor their problem that you got salty because they out sold you. It's not their fault they were able to take a simple mechanic and do it better as well as give it its own identity. The most you own rights to are your Title screen and a few pieces of in game art that aren't even featured in the main portion of the game. Let's explore their talent vs your own shall we?In PUBG how do players drop into the map at the start of each match? They parachute in after leaping out of the back of a C 130 gunship. Okay pretty standard pretty generic. Not very exciting but not exactly appaling either.Now in Fortnite how do they do the same exact mechanic which you don't own btw BlueHole don't get it twisted that you own the mechanic of dropping into a map from the sky. How does Fortnite accomplish that? One jumps out of a bus carried by balloons and use a glider to land safely in the play space. That's unique. That's pretty exciting too. It stands out among other drop in sequences by being anything but run of the mill. Point for Fortnite.In PUBG aside from the Storm and shooting other players what unique mechanics do players work with? Well you can drive motorcycles and cars in PUBG. Some of them. Not all of them. Okay once again pretty run of the mill for a standard multiplayer focused shooter. Can be exciting to turn someone into paste if they step in front of you but nothing that most gamers haven't seen before.In Fortnite however they said to hell with vehicles (unless you count rocket hopping) and gave you a Minecraft esque building mechanic that lets you create structures cover and ammunition if you have the right materials on the fly and pretty damn quickly. Building properly is almost as important as being able to land shots on a target in Fortnite as it can mean the difference between defeat and Victory Royale.That previous point is up to the player preference. I personally prefer PUBG in this regard as it is a much more straight forward concept. However straightforwardness doesn't ship units and sadly Fortnite simply beats out PUBG in the realm of unique mechanics building mechanics like the ones displayed in Fortnite are really only seen in crafting heavy games such as Terraria and Minecraft.What's the art style for PUBG? And I mean the in game assets that players will be seeing from the moment they open the game to the moment they close to desktop (or shut of the console if they perfer to play there). Well PUBG has a somewhat "in your face" logo that shows up in the main menu and in some of the loading screens. The in game assets are...well generic. It looks like what it sets out to be. A map of a generic island in the middle of nowhere with a base a port a few small towns a school etc. But there's not a lot else there to set it apart from other games thrown together with store bought assets. PUBG's world is very bland and run of the mill and in my opinion boring.Fortnite on the other hand reminds me strikingly of a Saturday Morning Cartoon. It's art style is colorful and vibrant and with the addition of Save the World mode there's actually a narritive here a story that one can follow along and appreciate for what it is. The way the story is handled in Fortnite actually reminds me of how Titanfall 2 handled its story. The Campaign was designed to equate one to the mechanics of the Battle Royale mode. In this regard the world really shines when suddenly the whole mape is full of grotesque creature that wish nothing but ill towards the players that defend the generators.Art assets definitely go to Fortnite Fortnites style from its cartoony aesthetic to how it implements emotes and cosmetic items for its player base simply out classes and out paces PUBG piece for piece.How much is PUBG? $20 US plus any microtansactions made there in.How much is Fortnite? Anywhere from Free to Play to $30 if you want to play story mode.PUBG spends no time teaching you how to play it but then again if you're going the Free play route neither does Fortnite. However only ones of these games bothers to teach you how to play at all. The first 3 or so mission of Fortnite campaign are the essentials. It teaches you the basics all the way up to building entire structures laying traps and crafting items.The concensus here is that if you're good at learning stuff on the fly Fortnite is the way to go. If you wanna be taught through an in game tutorial Fortnite will cost you $30 US for the full campaign even though you only really need the first three missions.Conclusion while I would prefer to play PUBG over Fortnite I cannot recommend PUBG in its current state. It has no identity it's servers go unmonitored so cheaters run rampant and its developer is more focused on sueing the competition than actually competeing. I don't recommend this game at all. If you want THE premire Battle Royale game go play Fortnite.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game is atrocious. First off the textures are not very good at all. The servers are extremely laggy and the game is poorly optomized. The servers hold 100 players which is far too much and you are lucky to not be shot at by 5 different people at once. Looting is also terrible. Extremely unbalanced. In a few buildings you could find a lvl 3 vest lvl 3 helmet and lvl 3 backpack 2 guns with tons of ammo and 5 med packs. However sometimes you are lucky to even find a pistol in one whole town. In buildings most rooms are completely empty. And there is something about certain rooms that are too plain and simple. The beds look terrible grass comes through the floor. Also there are tons of bugs and being killed by no one in sight. The circle spawns too fast. Scopes are seldom unless you are in a prominent spot on the map. Grenades are bugged. Too many trees you can hide behind making PVP less about skill and more about who has the bigger tree. Try this game if you want i'm just warning you it is far from being polished or fixed. I have 1.5k hours on A3 BR and I made it to second place on the leaderboards at one point so I am not a noob just saying all of this because I suck. I do not suck.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: The game is ruined for people who genuinely want to kill until the lat person by the people who hide in buildings fopr 20 minutes to come out and kill once theres 3 people left. This game needs more of an incentive for people to actually balls up and play the game instead of finding 60 rounds of 5.56 and an M16 and hiding in the midlle of the zone for an entire game and make more points then someone who got 6 Kills but came 23rd...Edit After playing for another 50 hours i've now come to the conclusion that not only was I right with the above steatment but now I have a problem with the gas. A forcefield bringing players within the circle is needed and we all know this but if you get into a fight on the edge of one forcefield only to have to run and not make it to the next because it is too strong then there is something wrong with the game. Also why in the are the loading screens so buggy and slow. For such a high budget this game is just dissapointing and has left me with the most depressing limp of my life. you PlayerUnknown you overrated cuck.

review: I recommend it if you a have a good pc to run it. Although my specs exceed the recommended requirements it runs very bad on my laptop. Even after I did all nvidia settings drivers launch options video settings etc. It is very poorly optimized. And what's even worse is that steam refused to refund it because I played 3 hours and their policy says max 2. So now I've paid 27 pounds for something that I won't really enjoy. My opinion? Not worth paying that much for an early access game. Don't waste your money unless you buy it when it's on sale.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Worst game I have ever playedI'm getting around 30fps with a GTX 1080 (even after optimization update) and both of my friends can't get past 20fpsThe lack of weapons reused 3D models and bland environment are enough to warrant PUBG COMPLETE TRASH.Couple that in with the frequent stutters in fps and it's clear that ANYONE with half a brain should STAY FAR AWAY FROM THIS "GAME."Luckily I am still under the 2 hour mark so I will definitely be refunding my misinformed purchase.Needless to say I still feel ROBBED of the 70 minutes I spent in this trash...Do yourself a favor and get Arma 3 instead

review: Buy this game only if it's for sale. For 30 bucks there is zero content and next to no weapon choice. You will be using the same thing every round. The part that makes it bad is the latency. The servers are beyond terrible. The latency makes the game unplayable. Never before in a game have I put my crosshairs on a target and watched every single round miss. I understand the game is early access but has been top of the charts since it came out. They have enough money to fix their god awful servers by now. Once they fix their servers I will recommend this game.

review: Honest Review.PUBG Create your character lalala configure graphics settingsso it looks cute lalala.Get into a Solo lobby.Sure the plane took its time to let me out or it took me a while to figure out which key to press to get out of it (knowing this ain't gameplay yet ANYKEY SHOULD DO by common sense/logic). It made me land on the southeasttestestestestestestestestestestestestestestestestest side of the map. Nice all the loot for me!Game &gt YOU HAVE TO GET TO THE ZONE IN LESS THAN 5 MINUTESNiiiiiice... I'll just walk up there I guess.Checked the map.The marked zone was on the northwestestestestestestestestest... you know by now.No actual functioning vehicles nearby and a transparent blue wall thingie ran through me. I started to lose health by this point.Aaaaaaand when I found an actual working vehicle I just die because the game previously decided so with the time limit!1/10. Haven't felt that much mix of dissapointed+frustrated feeling in a videogame before (IN A SINGLE ROUND) probably not the type of gameplay or gamemode I'm used to so that really cuts down the number of people that would enjoy this (people that are great players but have little to no patience to silly caprices).But the game looks (graphically) great tho! Sadly by the time the company decides to finish this it'll look ugly outdated...Aaaaaaaaaaaaaand not gonna be a sucker on this one. Refunding.

review: All in all A very fun game. Yes it has its issues server lag hackers poor optimisationn ect. But for a game that has been adopted on this magnitude it should be expected that the developers will be perpetually behind on these issues. Despite the issues patches are constantly pushed and the developers are responsive to issues. Despite issues this game is ever challenging luck based and fun. If you do well you can make money as well. With the responsivness of the dev team this game can only improve.

review: I played it at a friend's house and it was extremely fun. However I can't recommend it in the alpha state. I always tell myself not to buy alpha games but this game pulled me in with its gameplay. Unfortunetely it is the most poorly optimized game I think I've ever played. On a computer that can run the Witcher 3 Skyrim Fallout 4 etc. the game is basically unplayable with the fps drops and sound glitches. I've done every troubleshoot I can find and think of but alas it is all for naught. I really hope that fix these issues because it seems like a great game.

The more we as consumers support this kind of behavior from developers by buying and playing their broken garbage games the more they will keep doing this. Its honestly a sad day for gaming when developers get away with things like this.

review: It is really fun with one or two other people. Solo gets really hard in the last 15 people with the circle being so small tho. Overall it gets a 8/10 I would like to give it more but the game isnt really optimised and there is a few bugs. I started out playing this game with family share so I couldnt really give a review then but now I played it more and dear god... I think im addicted xD. The snipers are good the shotguns are good the pistols are trash but not bad for the first minute or two. The melee... I just hit people with a frying pan and I get top 10 xD P. The armour is very good at level 3 and that pan I was talking about before? If you have one holstered on your back it can block bullets xD. The assault rifles are not bad but only good really for long range sniping unless you have a sniper that is. The game is blowing up and I can see that this game has a ton of potential they just need to fix server lag and add more guns and maybe more armour and pans xD.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

You can hope that the milions they made will go to hire people that know what their doing but you will most likely be waiting in vein as they spend that money on late night taco bell runs. review: My favorite part of the reviews are the ignorant people who actually believe stream sniping is either ok or that players are actually being falsely banned for it. Game's fun I promise the community isn't as stupid as the players writing those reviews. If you were actually worried here are some stupid things people are saying in negative reviews all of which are not true.1) I got banned for killing a streamer even though I don't watch streams!2) The developers favor streamers3) They will ban players with little proof for stream sniping just because the streamer whines That one is particularly hilarous not only because of the stupidity required to believe they lack evidence but how it's outright a tinfoil hat conspiracy. It's literally no different than the Flat Earth Society in terms of lack of understanding and conspiracy required to believe it. Point is enjoy the game. Don't let the tinfoil hat playerbase diswade you from considering the game. I can assure you that issues involve false banning for stream sniping and stream favoritism do not exist(Hence why nobodies been able to prove it). The game is buggy might not run well even if your computer is beefy and the RNG can be anoyying. But it's still fun.

review: Product received for free. I was gifted this game about a week from my friend (and I in turn gifted it to another friend) and after 89hrs of playtime I must say I've really enjoyed it.I really like the tactical nature of the game and how fun it is to play either solo in a pair or a group of four with friends. It's specially fun with friends because of the inherit "randomness" in the game that can lead to some awesome or rather humorous situations that are pretty unlike anything I've played before (this is my first battle royale style game mind you). So while in duos or squads the fun comes from playing with friends in solo it's all about testing your wits and tenacity as well as your strategic and tactical mindset to win because you may have the best gear and equipment in the game but it doesn't mean anything if you can't get a good position toward the end of the game and that really counts once it's down to the top 10 players.Overall I'd definitely recommend this game to just about anyone interested in the genre to try it out or to play with your friend(s) though it does kind of require an SSD an more than 8GB of RAM in my experience. Having a good GPU/CPU is also a must to run it well enough. I've had to run it at low settings but even still I've had great success in a few games and have had loads of fun with this game. Of course keep in mind it's still under Early Access so expect some things to break or not work right every now and then and also a lot of patience and not rage too much because you'll die a lot to things you had no control over. I'd score this game a 8/10 in its current state.EDIT 1100hrs later and I still had fun up until I could not play it anymore because of some bug with BattlEye so while I had tons of fun for all those hours and I can't play it anymore and that sucks.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Playerunknown's Battlegrounds is a battle royale game that brings 100 people into a deserted map with buildings scattered along it and other sorts of structures. The goal is to be the final person standing out of the 100 in an all out deathmatch. There have been plenty of games like this such as H1Z1 King of the Kill and The Culling. But what makes this game so good? Lets go through the pro's and cons of this gamePro's Good Graphics Variety of weapons (New ones being added pretty often) Active Developers Can be played at your own pace Easy to pick up Play in a squad with 3 of your friends Can completely turn random matching off (Play in a three player squad without getting a random player)Cons Along with being easy to pickup it's definitely hard to master. Along with good graphics there is the issue of this game being kinda poorly optimized (May just be a problem for me but I average 40 50 fps on this game.) You can get banned for stupid reasons (Killing a streamer having glitches and even teamkilling someone who team kills your team.) Servers can sometimes be pretty bad but thats typically because this is the MOST PLAYED game of all time on Steam.Despite these flaws I really do believe this game is worth picking up and I believe that you should give it a try. Its not as chaotic as H1Z1 and Its a lot faster paced than The Culling. (The Culling in 2017 though lol)

review: Product received for free. Tried the game out was pretty poor performance. Better than the new H1Z1 but still nowhere near the level of old H1Z1.+Different weapons+Can put attachments to weapons+Can eject anywhere you want from the plane+Price is too much compared to H1Z1(less hackers)+Still in alpha(Room for improvement and will be improved)+Instead of poison there is electricity and therefore more visibility+People can't survive outside safezone for long No bullet drop? Too hyped by streamers Can eject anywhere you want Price is too much compared to H1Z1(less players) Kevlar too strong No bleeding apparently Everyone has a map now even a dumbass can win(Old H1Z1 you had to navigate yourself) Character creation sucks Servers laggy Poorly optimized Movement is weird as if you're sliding Hunchback character Too large map No tutorial or anything Can't customize crosshair? Can only pick one weapon even with backpack Muffled sounds I got shot nonstop but couldn't figure out from where Bad graphics I see people as squares and pixelated even on Ultra with 90FPS It feels like motionblur is on by default even though it's unchecked Poor FXAA/SMAA
