review: Player Unknown's Battlegrounds has been blowing up lately. Breaking records on steam while still being in Early Access.Now let's start with the core gameplay of PUBG. You drop out of a plane on a large island with 99 other people. While looting the island and all its buildings you'll be forced to stay within a certain area called the Player Zone. The Player Zone get's smaller and smaller during the game. Since loot is spawned randomly games will have a certain factor of "luck". The graphics in PUBG look great if everything is maxed out and the map is 8x8km which is rather big. However unfortunately the map is pretty boring. While roaming the island and looting your way through it you'll come across loads of attachments. These make looting a lot more interesting. Now you have a reason to keep looting once you have a gun armor and some medical supplies. Deciding what place to go next takes a bit of strategical planning would it already be looted? Where will the player zone move to? Do I use the car or do I go walking so they won't hear me? Etc.Player Unknown's Battleground is rather buggy. The game doesn't have the best optimization and has a lot of buys/flaws. You can't climb/vault at all putting your gun to a window and peaking doesn't work great and loads of other small bugs. Now don't get me wrong the game does get updated and new weapons get added from time to time but they honestly should focus on fixing the bugs a bit more.Now why is Player Unknown's Battlegrounds receiving so much negative attention? It's due to a couple of reasons. First of all the bigger your game gets the more people you get that dislike it of course. Second of all the developers broke a couple of promises. They've promised us there would be no micro transactions during Early access yet here they are. They've delayed the vaulting update 3 times now they're calling out and threatening other Battle Royale games for copying PUBG banning people who kill streamers with the reason "stream sniping" &amp they're not really fast on fixing updates and bringing out new content. Does this mean Player Unknown's Battleground is a bad game? No. In fact it's a great game and although it's a bit boring if you play solo the game is great and one of the better Battle Royale games out there at the moment. It's a blast with friends and before you know you have been playing for hours. Looting until your loadout is perfect and sneaking up on players is really fun and killing enemy's is satisfying for sure.Overall if you're looking for a good Battle Royale game Player Unknown is a great option. Just be sure you like the slow paced gameplay. If you're not entirely sure if PUBG is something for you I can highly suggest looking at other Battle Royale variants such as H1Z1.

review: Player Unknown's Battlegrounds or more commonly known as PUBG is fun and simply put addictive. Overall I think once the bugs are fixed the game will greatly improve and could possibly amplify the success the game already has received.

Most of them are solved rather quickly and most of the time the bugs only make you laugh (I'm fine with losing a match if it's by being catapulted 500 meters into the air after my car hits a tiny bump!).Would definitely recommend to anyone enjoying the Battle Royale genre.

review: COMPLETE CANCEROUS CAMPERFEST NOT RECCOMMENDED unless you are a serious hardcore gamer who takes this game religiously. TLDR This game has some fatal flaws that ruin the immersion for a filthy casual like me and seem to be targetted at very hardcore gamers. I reccommend casual gamers to turn to other cheaper or free alternatives. Let me preface this by saying when a game is outperformed by cheap China knock offs that blatantly rip it off (in this case the NettEase and Rules of Survival etc.) then there is something wrong. A lot of the great games out there are copied left right and center but they manage to remain competitive by ensuring that they will always be more attractive and better than crappy clones thereby ensuring people will still be willing to pay for them. The same cannot be said for PUBG in my opinion. This game is a classic example of something that has IMMENSE potential but was ruined by a few utterly stupid mistakes that allowed clones like Rules of Survival and Fortnite to easily surpass it. Pros 1) It has very detailed maps that are visually beautiful and there is clearly a lot of effort put into the graphical design.2) It has elements of realism added in such as better physics engines for vehicle movement and projectile motion (Both a good and a bad thing)3) It was the original game of it's kind thereby being the pioneer of innovationCons 1) It seems to be very poorly Beta tested or it was simply intended for super hardcore gamers because The player to map size ratio is so terribly skewed that the game in my experience has been nothing more than a MASSIVE CAMPER FEST. Because of the sheer abundance of camping spots and the very small number of players relative to the size literally EVERY game I just see everyone camping nonstop and the first one to make a move dies. This is just idiotic because it just means they didn't test it properly to optimize the player to size to intensity ratios. 2) The Increased realism is more of a detriment in my opinion. Realism is good but the developers have to remember that it is ultimately A VIDEO GAME. Casual gamers want some casual fun not a full on military training scheme. The projectile motion especially makes it quite unpleasant to shoot and more importantly it means that shooting at a even a moderate distance without a scope is very difficult this results in it being luck based If you find a scope you win. if not you die. 3) It is VERY luck based. Before all the addicted fools start shouting "l2p" consider the facts The scattering of weapons is VERY Sparse with tons of useless shotguns everywhere and very few good rifles or scopes around. This means that there is a high element of luck involved because in a game where EVERYONE IS JUST CAMPING getting a good rifle is akin to winning. 4) the aiming mechanism seems highly faulty. I make an attempt to watch killcams all the time (I did so just to verify this point) and I have noticed many times that shots that had the crosshairs completely off target were able to headshot me. And YES I am considering projectile motion and bullet travel time. I once got hit by a shot that was fired BEHIND me while running. This seems like a fatal bug to an already annoying system5) Price for something that costs quite a high sum it is clearly not very well planned out. In conclusion This game had a TON of potential but due to some fatal flaws in my opinion the free to play games do a better job. For all but the most serious and hardcore gamers I strongly encourage you to save your money and use the F2P games like Rules of Survival. (there is a PC version for it by scanning a QR code on your phone) NOTE Having said all that I did about the game I am not trying to encourage the sickening piracy of the clones. If you feel that you wish to support innovation and intelligence the perhaps give this game a shot as I did.

review: People claiming that it was better at launch than it is now are straight up liars. The game is better than it ever was and runs the best it ever did and everybody saying that it's "full of bugs" are full of and haven't either played the game after it's initial release or at all. The chinese meme hasn't been relevant for over a year. Chinese have their own server and even then they are roughly 20% of the entire game's population with Europeans and americans being the majority.The only problem is that if your GPU is anything but 1060 and up you're gonna have a bad time. Consider getting a job and buying a decent GPU to run it. 1080ti here and works on my machine at 144fps )Gameplay is robust and satisfying skill is aptly rewarded. s cry about blue zone and "looting for 15 minutes only to die to a sniper shot" don't listen to them because they're bad. They'll die twice quit the game and never touch it again and think they know everything. Drop to a hotspot if you want action and practice play smaller maps if you want more confrontations use vehicles and smart movement to not get screwed by the zone plan your movement ahead and choose the optimal terrain to combat in. Choose your fights carefully if you start shooting willy nilly you attract attention from other groups / individuals.It's a good game tarnished by the cluster of problems in release and contrarians. Give it a try don't expect a win in the first match.

review: PUBG's gameplay is fun but runs dry quick after a while. Play in short bursts so you don't die of a heart attack.Optimization is hit or miss with every update some updates make it smooth while others make it less than 30 fpsLootboxes are in this game but are only cosmetic. I don't like lootboxes or any microtransactions but thankfully these aren't shoved in your face.If you have friends you can have lots of good and frustrating games. But if you're only solo your experience might fall flat due to the repetitive nature of the game.Recently there has been a surge of hackers and the cheat system implemented hasn't been doing a good job of detecting them. Chinese players have been swarming most of the servers in America and others which has lead to many latency issues and hackers. This has been an issue for months and I haven't noticed any fixes.If the game looks fun to you and you have friends to play it with go ahead and buy it. If not I'd save the money for something else. I wish there were a mixed opinion setting on Steam because I don't reccommend this game nor do I hate it. The issues I've encountered make me lean on the negative side but I still have great moments in the game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: the game is still in alpha.give it a chance.so many bugs that blue hole are undoubtably working 24/7 to fix.This game is very popular in china. so much so that the chinee servers are full and they populate the european and american servers in droves.I love practicing my chinee language with them in the game. In testiment to the chinee sports and education they are very good and 1 shot kills and fast res. they can even shoot through the map. i hope to learn this skill one day.the thing i love about this game is the curved bullets. i still havent found them. You will know you were killed by one when you are 3metres around the corner and bullet follows you around and hits you in the back. Vehicle physics and mechanics are the best around. f1 2017 forza gta have nothing on this game. bumps on the road and small stones give true to life realism and the vehicle hurtles through the air randomly and spins around wildly.To promote motorbike safety the guys at bluehole implimented the "Death Bike" physics. this enables the rider to be killed knocked out or thrown from a bike at the slightest bump or if the speed exceeds 20kph. Medic items are true to life aswell. swallowing painkillers take twice the time to take than finishing a can of red bull... just like real life. adrenaline syringes in the game resemble the 1950's injections. which is a nice touch. finally my last positive remark on this game.... using first aid kits is impossible in a moving vehicle. taking painkillers is out too. i mean how realistic is this game. 10/10. i often drive to work and see lots of vehicles and ambulances pulled in to the side of the road so occupants can take pills and wrap bandages. fantastic job blueballs...10/10 for me.

review: Is it just me or does this game get worse every update.UPDATED FOR WHY I FEEL LIKE IT GETS WORSE EVERY UPDATE This game apparently gets optimized every patch but I've lost 40 fps since the second update.Went from 60 80 fps after the second update to barely able to get 60 fps now.It seems they are more focused on making money and doing content (similar to DayZ).I don't understand how I went from getting 60 80 fps stable to 30 60 fps.Just makes zero sense how the optimizations make the game run worse everytime.It's not even optimizations that get worse the graphics become worse and worse every patch.If you looked at the world from the airplane before you dropped it looked stunning now the beaches look extremely jagged and things don't render in from afar.I would recommend this game when it is properly updated with actual optimizations that make it easier to run the game.Specs GPU EVGA Geforce GTX 1080 SCCPU Intel i7 4770KRAM 16 GB

review: I love the concept of Battle Royale. It's a great way to get the adrenaline flowing. This game executes the concept very well. Some of the animations might be goofy but the gameplay is fun reactive and rewarding (if a little beta clunky).The problem I have with this game and most pvp games in general is cheaters. If you give the customer your client and tell them exactly where they are in the world by way of coordinates they will use a program like SoftIce to trace the variables and manipulate them in memory. Because the program has too much say in what you are able to do in the game world values can be injected into those variables and you get players teleporting all over the place. To be honest unlike in H1Z1 or even GTA V I have seen very little of this type of cheater but I have not played the game long enough to verify whether I'm just missing it. Perhaps they even have cheat detection in game which would essentially be verifying client/server variables are behaving properly.A more subtle cheat which I think is prolific in this game is the detection of other player data which is then used to determine where you are in the world and where other players are in the world. What happens is that other player data is sent to your computer through the interwebz so that you computer can draw players and such smoothly when they are supposed to interact with you in the game. If the game didn't do this players and specifically their different textures would tend to pop in and cause lag which is usually pretty annoying if not downright gamebreaking. The game's communication variable data needs to be encrypted with a simple encryption algorithm changed daily. This would eliminate the radar headshot and tracking cheats which are ubiquitous in this game right now. Until this is done stay away from this game.As the game is in beta I won't harp on the fact that graphics options need to be minimized so that players can actually hide in foliage etc. and use the environment (which can be pretty beautiful tbh) to their advantage.One day I hope that the interwebz somehow institutes this type of game as a streaming game. Unfortunately I think I'll be a little too old to enjoy it without having a heart attack. Anyways game is better then H1Z1 but cheater parasites are ruining it.Update for July 1st 2017 Some cheat detection is in game. So Headshots are still a thing but you'll find that you can get a decent fight once in a while because not everyone is cheating. Player detection ... um... detection... has also been instituted quite nicely. People seem to not notice you are there until you commit to a fight as opposed to heading directly for you when you haven't moved inside the attic of a barn for 5 to 10 minutes.Two new cheats seem to be prevalent however 1. There seems to be some sort of vectored head shot where if you shoot a character they automatically shoot you in the head/torso. My theory is they are detecting the vector of the shot and then sending a bullet back along the vector to your gun. Has happened to me twice now so cannot completely confirm. You'll notice this cheat easier if you play a hide and snipe strategy instead of full on fps.2. There seems to be lag when players get nearby at random occasions. Player induced lag is a thing and is detectable quite easily so hopefully they add some sort of detection into the game. Still a negative review however until game becomes more playable.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Product received for free. Do not buy this game.....atleast not yet.There are many reasons for this but i feel like i had to just say that first to save you before figuring out this game isnt what you expected 3 hours after buying it. My Experience My friend bought me this game during early access during that time i hated this game due to the reason that it had microtransactions before it was even a full game even after they say they wouldn't add microtransactions until the game was done. Also was the price of $30.00 seemed to high for a game that was brand new and as i have previously stated in ealry access. But it was a new multiplayer game and my friend bought it for me so i had no choice but to play it with them atlast a couple times. The first match was amazing it wasnt what i expected the fuel of adrenaline was amazing as you'r natural split second choices had more effect on the you'r matches future than in other games. Eventually glitches started to apppear and it frustrating as all hell but somtimes they would be enjoyable giving me and my friends good laughs as our jeep does 3 flips before crashing on the ground in a fiery explosion in pure MURICA fashion. But when we would try to win the glitches would seem to pop in more and more and only when we were messing around did the glitches just seem to dissappear. But that didnt stop us from trying our damn hardest. When we got our first chicken dinner it felt amazing as the endorphines from this stress simulator started to rolll in and we realized we outplayed 97 other players. I only having about 20 or so hours at the time got only 1 2 kills as my team rolled with 4 or more. But the game was fun and i loved it.So why do i not recommend this game? Well what i just sayed were memories of a time months ago. Sound The guns sound good but thats about it. Sound is what can save you in any situation in this game. It can help you pinpoint an enemys location weather thats through gun shots or foot steps it is one of the most important tools in this game. When it works that is. Sound is compltely ed. You can get shot at and when you look in the direction of were the first shot sounded like it came from only to have a second shot come sounding like it came from behind you. Not to mention footsteps were if you are running it can sound like there is another set of first steps running alongside you. And the sound of vehicles can suck especially if you cant hear them if they are behind you only noticing them after they have ran you over. Hackers/China I am just gonna put both hacking and china in the same catagory as they are basically within the same cesspool of exploiting and cheating. If you scroll down the reviews you will see people screaming to region lock china now this isnt racism China is the most toxic people you will see in this game as they go to North American servers to exploit ping and end up shooting you from behind walls as they teleport across the map because of their 200+ ping. And Hackers god ing damnit the hackers. Its hard to go one game without getting a hacker shooting you somehow without seeing you or having their croos haris on you. My experience is when i was in a gamer and i got headshotted by a kar98k while driving in a car which i though was suspicious so i watched the deathcam. it was a guy named Francorea he was invisble for about 2 seconds in the kill cam i thought it was just a glitch so i let it go then as he saw my car he turned invisible again. He aimed his kar98k straight at the ground he shot and he got me with a headshot. WTF i instantly go to click the report button but after i clicked it my game crashed......ARE YOU ING KIDDING ME?Stop adding cosmetics and fix you'r damn game Bluehole Glitches Yes they can be funny and cool as hell but when the same glitch has been in the game for months and still havent been fixed dude wtf BlueHole got $720000000 from this game and still cant fix a glitch that has been in for months. And For sake fix that damn 3 seater motorcycle it does nothing but lean to the right and god forbid you hit a pebble and get sent flying headfirst just to get knocked out of you'r bike and get ran over by air.So why do i still play this game?I only play this game because well it can give alot of money sorry but its true. This game just isnt as fun as it use to be but whenever they add a new crate and it is $5 instantly on the community market? Well how am i not supposed to only play for the free money? Thats all this game is good for at this point in my opinion.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: bought this game when it just came out on steam as the graphics looked stunning and the concept was interesting.this game offered a gameplay experience that was fresh at that time and i enjoyed every hour i spent on this game.every match felt newmy thoughts on the gameplay at first i thought getting a chicken dinner in this game was just a matter of luck i thought the guy with the better loot or the better position in the circle would win and not to mention man disadvantage in squad plays but after hundreds of games and being put in difficult situations i realise that this game is in fact really skill based. better weapon does not mean better aim positioning should always be part of your strategy for winning and ive won in a 1v4 scenario a dozen times by playing smart.my concerns i stopped playing this game a couple months ago due to the sheer amount of cheaters in a single match getting killed by cheaters every f***ing game is frustating and i felt like this game was just a waste of time.came back every now and then to check if cheaters are gone and always dissapointed.cheaters still there but devs keeps releasing new crates. what pisses me off even more is that these crates requires keys to open. i mean i know i shouldnt be mad as i play csgo and its the same system there and they have cheaters too and such thats why i still recommed this game to those who likes playing these 'battle royale' type of games. but i for one am done playing. i just like the old pubg better with no weapon skins just player skins.

review: I am refunding Playerunknown's Battlegrounds on the grounds that it is literally unplayable for meI know and understand that this is an early access game but when you release a product for mass market sale it is generally accepted that that product should at the very least function when used under proper conditions. Imagine if you bought a gun and although that gun was a prototype you were given a promise it would get better later and a list of things you needed for it to work. you get it working as you have everything you need and the gun refuses to shoot for several minutes at a time spits out a random number of bullets when it does sometimes ejects shells for no reason and has the accuracy of a one armed drunken welshman attempting to fire a M2 browning unbraced. This is my experience with the game thus far.I am getting random bursts of not 3 frames a second but 3 seconds a frame then when that stops i am still getting low but bearable fps but with constant random length and unstoppable Freezes while doing anything at all but standing stillI have spent 5 10 minutes frozen at one point and requiring a hard restart of my computer the second and third of my attempts to play a match. i effectively bought a 30 dollar desktop background of a parachuting manIf the game doesnt want me to play it ing fineThey have lost a customer and a fan hereGood ing jobI MORE than meet the minimum requirementsand i tried both the lowest settings and the highest with absolutely no difference in its preformance

review: For all it could be the game is fantastic. For the current condition its just a ing mess. Don't let yourself be deluded into thinking you win because of anything other than good circles good loot spawns. Dont delude yourself into thinking you lose for any other reason than desync lag fps drops due to poor optimization and the privation of every other reason you might win. Sometimes you will be fully kitted within the first 2 minutes. Sometimes you will spend 20 minutes running bandaging and boosting to make it to the top 10 without firing a shot and dying to the playzone when you run out of meds. 90% of the time this game is just a giant Kobyashi Maru simulator driven by mostly non game elements. Rather its development issues such as poor optimization poor server and connection issues. As far as the player base goes the best way to make it to the top10 is to collect meds prone in a house with all the doors closed and go take a until right before death circle. Then med up grab a vehicle and hit one of the poor bastards that spent 20 minutes looting and take all his top off with more meds and just camp while the rest of the people kill eachother and then shoot the last person who has no earthly clue where you are because you havent made a osund or moved for the last 10 minutes. Compelling gameplay? No.

review: I watched some videos thinking this is really a good game but after I tried for 2 games I did had some fun but I have to refund the game here are my reasons 1. I have a decent Alienware PC from 2 years ago the graphic card is GTX960 with i7 CPU and 16 GB System RAM it might be a little outdated but running this not too fancy game at medium settings barely hits 60FPS is unacceptable to me. The game looks fun but it is simple even for $30 still this game should be optimized better than this. Movement is weird as well. I just don't have a smooth feeling of everything in this game.2. My home network is pretty good playing league always at 23 ms latency but I still I can't move get warnings like I have connection issues several times within an hour. 3. The game does not have a tutorial to start with you will have to learn all the stuff through youtube videos. Which I already did but still having a little difficulty on how to use the items. This game may not need a tutorial but at least should have an empty room allow new players to try the weapons and equipment out. The waiting area before the game starts is not helping anything.4. The price I have some people saying this game's price is high. I was like it is not an old game and on steam No.3. $30 can t be overpriced now I take it back... The game is simple content is focused on the equipment and weapons which are good but the graphic does not look so good and optimized so badly is unacceptable at this price. If they optimize the graphic and fix the network issues I would consider buying again. Otherwise in its current state personally I would say the game worth at most $15 to $20 depending on how you like this type of this games.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: WOW!! I love this game. its takes strategy and fps to a whole new level.It can be a little glitchy but its tsill early access so all is forgiven.Graphics are very nice but could do with a little polishing when you parachute out the plane. I suppose rendering is an issue here. from a height the ground looks pretty standard.Guns work lovely and the inventory system is great! this is how games should be made.sort out the minor fps drops and glitches and this could be up in my top 5 games ever!!! well done devs!! you can tell you've worked hard and I love how you communicate with the players with updates etc!! best 30 quid I've spent in a long time! it even made me start playing mouse and keyboard again. camp like a boss!please check out my video for gameplay!https //www.youtube.com/watch?v rfZ2PMBgtw0&amp feature youtu.be

review: 1.0 is out! and it's the biggest and best update PUBG has had. Now with the full release many improvements to the game have been added not only that but additions aswell such as the New Map and Vaulting. Yes this game is not perfect and yes it can get annoying but in the end of the day it's good fun. Playing this game has been the best thing to do with my friends instead of playing other dead games like CS GO playing something new and fresh that works is very good. Although the biggest demerit is you need a good PC to run this game before i had a laptop which ran this game at 20 30fps on low it sucked. BUT it was still fun it was playable (like the XBOX ONE version) now with a $2.5k PC i run this game at a solid 100fps and with more compatability changes from the creators i think it will become more usable for those with bad PC's. Overall a great game to play solo and with friends. A Definate Recommend. 9.5/10

review: you're looking for a game review you've come to the wrong place. But if youre looking for a fantastic ravioli recipe you've come to the right place.Ingredients To Make the Dough375 grams (3 cups) plain flour1/2 teaspoon salt2 eggs1/4 cup (50 ml / 3½ tablespoons) olive oil1/2 cup (120 ml / 8 tablespoons) waterExtra flour for dusting To Make Cheese Filling15 ounces (425 grams) container Ricotta cheese5 ounces (142 g/about 1/2 cup plus 2 tablespoons) "3 Cheese Italian Blend" (Parmesan Romano &amp Asiago)Note grate these cheeses yourself and create your own custom blend.1/2 cup cheddar cheese2 eggs lightly beaten1/2 teaspoon salt1/2 teaspoon pepper ExtrasYour favorite sauce for the ravioli (i.e. marinara/ marijuana)Parmesan cheeseBasilFried vegetablesShrimpFish slicesChicken pieces Make the Ravioli filling. In a small mixing bowl add the ricotta and mash with a fork. Add in the 3 cheese blend Cheddar cheese eggs salt and pepper. Mix all ingredients thoroughly until you have a smooth paste like consistency. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and place it in the refrigerator for about 30 minutes. Make the Ravioli dough. Crack eggs into a large mixing bowl and beat them with a fork. Add water oil and salt. Mix. Add 1 cup flour to the bowl. Use a fork to mix the flour with the eggs water oil and salt. Repeat with the rest of the flour. Mix until a smooth dough is formed. Clear and clean off a large work surface and dust it with flour. This is where you are going to roll out your dough. Take the dough out of the mixing bowl shape it into a ball and place it on your work surface. Knead for at least 10 minutes or until it becomes elastic. Dust a rolling pin with flour to prevent the dough from sticking. Roll out the dough until it is about 1/8 inch (1/3 cm) thick or about the thickness of 2 stacked quarters. With a cookie cutter or upside down water glass cut out circles in the dough (will make about 15 20 dough circles). Ball up the unused dough and either roll it out and make a couple more raviolis or wrap it and put in the freezer for another time. Dough can keep for weeks when frozen. Just make sure to wrap well so that it doesn t suffer from freezer burn or absorb freezer odor. Fill the Ravioli shells. Take the ravioli filling out of the refrigerator and place a tablespoon of it in middle of a dough. Fill a small bowl with water dip your fingers in and moisten around the outer edge of the dough circle. Fold the dough in half over the filling making a half moon shape. Be sure all the filling stays inside. Pinch the edges together and then seal the edges of the ravioli with a fork. Make sure to press firmly and go all the way around. This will add a homemade touch as well. Repeat this process for all your dough circles. Dust the finished ravioli with flour to keep them from sticking together. Form the Shells and Fill Using a Ravioli maker. Roll the dough into two sheets Place one sheet on the ravioli maker and form the filling cups. Fill with the ravioli mixture. Lay the second sheet of dough on top and roll it out. This will seal in the filling. Remove and separate the finished raviolis.Cook the Ravioli. Fill a large pot with water and bring to a boil. Place the ravioli in boiling water for 5 6 minutes or until they float. You can also test for doneness by nibbling on the edges to test. If you don't want to make all the ravioli at one time you can freeze the rest Take ravioli out of boiling water with large slotted spoon and place on warmed platesServe it up.Top with your favorite sauce grate some fresh cheese over it and enjoy!

review: I feel like I have to give this game a thumbs up based solely on the fact that I'm having an immense amount of fun playing it with my friends. Everyone has their own criteria to determine their review. Mine is the fun factor. If I'm enjoying it it gets a thumbs up. However there's just so much that I don't like. The following are just a few things that I feel MUST be changed soon.1. Don't believe the lie that this game isn't as "clunky" as Arma 3 or DayZ. Because it IS. It's miserable. I'm not asking for it to be Call of Duty or something like that. But sheesh after all the talk from the Beta players I expected a bit more smoothness in opening doors entering vehicles picking up loot player movement etc...you know the basics. But it's not. 2. As soon as a little bit of optimization happens they need to LOCK FOLIAGE at a certain preset for all players. Preferably I'd like to see foliage locked at a much higher preset than "very low" to encourage tactical/stealth gameplay. As it is right now even if you have a supercomputer setting foliage any higher than the lowest preset only puts you at a disadvantage since everyone else has it turned down. That bush or grass you think you're using for cover doesn't exist on everyone elses client. You might think you're nice and hidden. But that sniper 200m away is laughing his butt off at this moron who's standing out in the middle of a field like an idot. *headshot* sucker!3. I'm personally not a fan of the map. I'm not talking about the map you pull up when you press "m " I'm talking about the actualy play area. It's just far too open. The terrain is not all that rugged there are only a few trees and rocks here and there. It's just a copy/pasted bland map. You can clearly tell they haven't spent a whole lot of time creating the map. They probably used a random terrain generator threw in a few of the same buildings everywhere and called it a day. Which is fine it's Early Access. I just hope they invest in the map and make more than a sniper's paradise. 4a. This is perhaps my biggest gripe with this game. And this speaks to points #2 &amp #3. With foliage giving you absolutely no cover and given the fact that the game map is basically an open field with a few hills and limited cover you can forget tactical gameplay. Basically 4x scopes win this game. It's a sniper camp fest until the final circle (the 3rd person peaking only makes this worse). It's bland and it's going to get old really fast unless they make foliage more dense and saturate the map with more than just a few copy/pasted rocks and trees every 50m. 4b. Due to the fact that this game favors the camping sniper they've had to make the player a bullet sponge. It takes several shots of even the 7.62 to kill a player. And when I say several I'm talking WAY TOO MANY. But they had to make it this way becasue without any cover to escape a sniper it would make them far more deadly than they already are. So I propose that the devs would give us more forests/foligae denser terrain more obstacles etc (basically favor cqb) and make bullets do more damage this would reward the sniper who will now only have a short window to engage their target (and must therefore actually require real skill in making shots rather than having 1 minute to unload your entire clip on someone hoping to land 5 or 6 shots) and would also reward the cqb player who uses tactics to gain the element of surprise. Honestly a map like Arma 3's Apex or even Chernaurus would be better than this. Give us more rugged terrain that we can use for tactical maneuvers instead of the stereotypical hill that we simply peak over in 3rd person waiting for the other guy to move. Make the forests more dense. Make foliage ACTUALLY do something. Allow people to flee snipers by finding cover. Heck give us more cover that we can use to flank the sniper. As it is right now that's very rarely an option. Force snipers to have to pack cqb weapons incase the circle ends in a dense area. Please Please Please take the advantage away from the 3rd person peaking camping sniper. That type of gameplay is fun for a while but it will not sustain this game.

review: UPDATED March 6 2018I gave it a chance a LONG hard fought chance and its just crap. Over 800 Hours Rated in the top 1% multiple seasons. So I am not just some salty little loser who never was good at the game. This game is ATROCIOUS! There is no chance of it every getting better. The quality of the game itself its entire concept is total garbage. Jump in to a battle zone with no weapons HOPE to find something before someone else kills you while the hackers know where every vehicle quality piece of gear and person is on the map. I am a top 1% player 3 seasons in a row and I still find this game to be horifically unbalanced horifically coded and horifically thought out. Random Red Zones Dsync Random weapon recoil cause the weapons are coded like one game the gins are fine the next they are jumping all over the screen. There is NO WAY to get good at aiming in this game cause its TOTAL RNG.... The RNG favors top tier players EVERY GAME. I know cause I went from loot when I was rated lower to amazing loot when I was rated high. Loot spawns AFTER you land so the servers can decide what to give you. This game is total trash. There are hackers in EVERY match Aim bots ESP Insta Heal God Mode you shoot a dude in the head 4 times with a sniper rifle and he never dies. Its garbage. Lets hope it dies the horrible death it deserves and someone comes out with a QUALITY Battle Royale game without cartoon graphics (fortnite &amp h1z1). PUBG was a great idea just VERY poory implemented. I blame Player Unknown for seeing how much money he could make and just turning it into a money grab. Shame on you!

review: Alright. So after the amount of hours I've put into this game I can safely say it wouldn't be dumb of me to make a reivew. Let me start off by saying I love this game and I hate it. I hate it becasue I'm mostly a scrub and almost all of your bad experiences in this game will be because of that. I love it because it's the first early access game I've invested in that actually paid off. People will claim that the devs don't care and prioritize useless things but that's simply not true. They constantly update their twitter and website with where they are aiming their focus and don't leave playerbases in the dark. They've admitted that they are pushing all their resources into getting the game finished and released on console but at the same time we can expect a new map vehicles and more within the first quarter of december january. That being said they also have an update coming out that includes new guns and a vaulting system which I've tried out on the test server and lemme tell you it's the People claim hackers are a huge issue buuuuuut in all my time I've only encountered about 3 hackers and that ain't t because I am a horribly salty person so if I really did have an issue with them then you'd all hear about it. Or at least see the censored profanity. Pros Gunplay actually worksVehicles (except motorcycle) don't normally fycuk you over if they do you're just a bad driverCommunity is cancer as hell but not the kind that ruins the game in here it just makes every kill feel that much sweetergameplay can be varied by gamestyles and only after my 200+ hours is it starting to get boring but hey new map soon!Cons Me and my friends voice chat does not work. We can't use our in game mics at all to talk nor can we hear anyone. We've tried all the common trouble shooting even going into tslgame files and still nothing works. Dev's if you read this please help. My kills feel hollow if I can insult them after they lose and my deaths feel bland if i can't bargain with my would be murders for life in exchange for a suck job.Sniping is hard not like oh you just need practice and skill but more like its a tad too much luck.My bottom line is this It's the first battleroyale game to actually work and be fun while also get updates. for those who have bad experiences it's mostly because you have bad skills.&gt inb4 all the comments about how "i was trained sniper with 300 confirmed kills"

review: This game is good and bad at times the bad times come wayyy more often than the good ones trust me on this.When you first get the game you are really get hooked onto it you'll play it hours on end.Getting good at the game is not difficult but really tough to master. The latest update brought alot of new things to the game but they forgot to optimize the game. The game runs properly on mid range pcs but you will get Fps drops very often. The lag spikes hits you hard during the most critical times of the game i.e when you are in a 1v1 and other situations. Instead of adding new content to the game they should focus on fixing their game first. This game will get you hyped during the end game playing with friends is extremely fun. Solo can be fun if you get better at the game which will require time. Even though I have only 100+ hours in this game I have experienced most of the pros and cons of the game. PUBG is better than Fortnite in my perspective as I like FPS shooters alot and like the strategical realism of the PUBG which Fortnite does not have. If you come to the hackers they are quite alot of them. Especially in Asian servers out of nowhere some dude with a 8x on a S12K will shoot you through a wall miles away in this aspect Fortnite does it better than PUBG. This game will get i you some really nice and enjoyable moments but at the same time will make you want to uninstall it at the same time.If I had to rate it I would give it a 7/10 for various reasons.Overall playing the game will be a good experience for every gamer.

I've decided to refund it as performance wasn't amazing same goes for graphics. I found the graphics to be a big turn off. My settings were all on medium execpt texture and view distance which were on Higy yet the game still looked somewhat bad. It wasn't clear. I found it difficult to see other people at far distances and couldn't tell if it was human or not.I did give this game a shot but with a price tag of 26 and being early access I didn't want to take the risk. It's a shame that steam only offers 2 hours of play before it expires then you can't refund it. IF it had more hours then I would put more into this game.

review: UPDATE The whole point of this game is to do away with your ability to own and run an independant server. We have been baited into a trap.I figured this out ENTIRELY too lateMAIN REVIEW All Hype. No Real Benefit. There is only one game mode and it favors people who were in closed alpha heavily. People in alpha know the map the feel of the controls there is not even a shooting range to practice. Obvious troll for money as dev favorites stream having a great time slaughtering noobs which of course motivates sales. Servers are attrocious. "It's alpha". All the more reason not to buy it. Pros Nicely balanced weapons working toward all the realistic little touches of Arma III. Smaller maps so games don't take for EVAR.Cons This game is hyped all to hell. It is an unfinished game in every sense and is likely to remain so. It's Arma III with one game mode that doesn't even really allow you to learn to aim. Basically a single mod for the Arma III server made into a stand alone game because the developer didn't want to make a better mod for free for Arma. I am deeply disappointed in the character movement as well which is the most basic limited clunky set of moves I can imagine for a 2017 game.Seriously. Start from the ground up with the ability to climb jump and so forth like about a cool half dozen games already on the market none of which seem to be realistic shooters. Why is it the realistic FPS genre somehow always features the MOST disgustingly glitchy and unrealistic move sets available in video games at the moment?P.S. Little item drops you get for collecting ... coins or whatever.. per game...? RNG B.S. Your later game 4500 coin shirt is as likely as not to be the same damned shirt you got from the first crate. Microtransactional Hell Ensues.

review: Geez what a waste of time. I gave this game many chances reinstalling it every time another friend bought a copy but my first impressions were spot on. The gameplay is shallow and arbitrary. You can't replace gameplay depth with RNG. I don't even really mind the tons of bugs. At least they make the game somewhat interesting momentarily.The early game is engaging in a stupid way where you're either in a safe area mindlessly gathering loot or in a hotzone mindlessly gunning mindless gunners. The middle game is boring in a comfortable way consisting mostly of looking for better loot and occassionally getting shot at or shooting at someone. The end game is a cluster . And none of it is fun...Graphics are mediocre and the visual design is as bland as they come. Sound design is poor to say the least. Every update makes these things marginally better but the core gameplay is still a trudge.If you're looking for something tactical go get Rainbow 6 Siege.If you're looking for tight gunplay go get Titanfall 2 or Call of Duty or Battlefield.If you're looking for a battle royale game get Rust or Fortnite.If you're looking for a game which relies on randomization instead of genuine gameplay variety and depth then by all means play the dull unoptimized trash that is PUBG.Edit March 2018 Game is less buggy now. Loot now regularly spawns clipping inside the floor and objects. Framerate is better but the framerate is inconsistent so 144fps still feels worse than a 30fps PS2 game. Netcode is still TRASH. Who uses client side hit detection..? Despite the improvements in performance the core gameplay is still pointless. There is nothing to learn from losing. Winning does not feel good. It just feels like winning the lottery if instead of money you just got a poorly designed anticlimactic static image.P.S. I wonder how vegetarians feel about seeing Winner Winner Chicken Dinner...

review: Woe to those complaining about paid crating during early access! The fact of the matter is that's the generation we live in now where microtransactions for costumes that influence nothing relative to gameplay are demanded by "some"! I personally need to focus more on my tactics in game rather than what my character looks like but that's just me. Guess what I'm NOT gonna do today? I'm going to strive to learn the game better to strengthen my stealth and agility to learn the world map &amp it's imperative loot drops. Who the hell cares what overcoat you're wearing or what facemask you don? It's never going to stop a bullet from penetraing your skull with a headshot so just let the weak look as "cool" as they want!... Of course I digress. The costumes are important to someone out there and if Bluehole is striving to make literally everyone happy then I've got no complaints. Let them work out their bugs for every situation and let's keep in mind this is still undoubtedly the best PC game of 2017. The energy you waste complaining about something that doesn't involve you is ultimately time wasted not boosting your player stats am I right??? STFU buy this game and I'll see you in battle.

review: I Love this game with a passionI am disabled and play alot I rank around 300 in europe.HOWEVER... Just lately the amount of hackers has increased significantly and the Devs are turning a blind eye. I generally report 2 3 per day and used to get a notification saying 'Thank you' and letting me know what action was taken. Since the introduction of the new ranking system 4 weeks ago not a single ban.I play so much I know every rock on every map I don't mid the odd bugs this is quite simply the best game I have played of this genre in years (and at 60 years of age I have played alot lol)But I must thumbs down on PUBG until the Devs start to take cheating seriously again. I am fully aware that there will always be hackers but for the Devs just to give up is not acceptable.Also they should consider rewarding playes who correctly and successfully report by awarding ranking points to offset the losses caused by cheats.

review: My issue with PUBG is that it's incredibly boring. You jump onto the map loot for 25 minutes and then get shot by someone you can't even see. Those are 25 minutes that you can never get back. I have spent over 17 HOURS on this game and I have NOTHING to show for it. The only two emotions I felt while playing this were frustration and boredom. Only ONCE did I ever feel an emotion other than frustration or boredom while playing this game. I was in the final four and as I was looking for the other players someone with a sniper rifle shoots me through the wall of a shed. That emotion wasn't frustration. It was anger. I was tired of getting killed by a hacker shooting me through the wall so what did I do? I uninstalled. Please do not spend your $30 on this game. Spend it on something that actually deserves your money like Superhot or Black Mesa.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game is horrible because of how poorly it runs on my gaming PC. It is full of hackers. You can literally go google PUBG hacks and purchase them in 5 minutes. People are so bad at this game that in order to win they need hacks. The game is full of bugs. You can die spontaneously. The game crashes spontaneously. Motorcycles are possessed by demons. They will explode when you drive over a pebble. The list is endless. This is the worst game and I do not know why it is so popular. But it is still fun somehow.

review: I get that everyone out there cries because they died because bugs and stuff like that.I really don't care about it like yeah i get mad too when I die like that but I don't go to the steam page just to cry!I wait like 30 mins to chill out and then i start playing the game again!Here's why I RECOMMEND PUBG to anyone out there First it is a unique game with unique mechanics (sure it can get buggy but guys this is what makes the game special!) Bunch of weapons I get that people cry about weapon balance but hey you can't just give everyone the same loot and then tell 'em to go kill each other (you have War Mode there for that ) ) because that would be boring! 2+1 maps (Sanhok will be coming out this month i think) Custom games will be available for everyone later this year Fun especially with friends but you can even play with some rando from japan or the UK I just don't get why do people want the weapon balance. The point of the BR genre is to get better loot as you change locations and not to get the same loot and the same gun over and over and over again. Weapon balance is good as it is right now. The AWM is far superior to the Kar98K that's why it's in the Supply drop. People don't like this game because they say it doesn't require skill. Well that's one hell of a big in' mistake right there! You can give a player who haven't played a single match in PUBG a Groza with an RDS and a suppressor and EXT.Quickdraw mag + an AWM 15x he will still have no clue how to use them because the Groza has quite a little recoil and all the weapons have bullet drop that's where the AWM comes in he won't know the bullet drop he won't know the recoil pattern he won't know the muzzle velocity. THIS GAME DOES REQUIRE SKILLJust look at shroud or grimmz or ibiza or ETC.Even if they join a fight with the worst pistol in the game against a normal player with an m416 they will win 'cause they know how to use the guns.If they would make the weapons the same just in the name of "balance" the game would be boring.I get that people get mad because they died because of a bug but just relax for 30 mins then try again.I know that 30 is a little bit too much for this game since Fortnite is f2p but be serious please.At least 60% of the fortnite players spend more than 30 on fortnite emotes or skins or whatever.That's all i wanted to say.Thank you for listening and go ahead and PLAY PUBG!

review: This game is absolute trash. Don't waste your time or money. Found myself driving out of the blue to only have my truck flip onto its side from what looked to be flat terrain only to wait for the truck to flip back over. However it did not in almost 3 seconds of time it took me to wait. It wasn't until I EXITED THE VEHICLE that the vehicle decided to FLIP BACK ON TOP OF ME. The damage output on minor vehicle collision is overpowered. The weapons are unbalanced and calls for you to use the exact same weapon every game with little to no variation. The optimization is really as bad as everyone says it is. Im using a $3500 computer running everything on Very Low and getting less than 100 fps. LIKE COMMON. This company does not care for their player base or thier game they care about a paycheck. There for I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS GAME.

review: VINDICATED!!! I Been saying this for over a year and they finally admit that the game is F'd up and they are going to fix it...Gee thanks for FINALLY realizing you never gave us the finished game you sold us and after making enough money to start a corporation NOW you wanna fix it...All those people talking crap about how good they are and ppl must just suck when they say B.S. this is proof you are just trying to convince yourselves that it's all you and not a broken game...I rest my case. Now on to my review that has been proven to be correct and PubG Corp just admitted it they sold us a broken game and people have been making them rich and making all these I'm so awesome at Pubg YT videos. Let's see if they actually fix it or just placate us.I really wanted to like this game I like the coop play working as a team against other teams. I like the tactical aspect of PUBG. They did a great job upgrading the graphics with the PC 1.0 release. Driving cars can almost be fun. But I really feel like there is an imaginary 3 year old boy's arm behind the car who is really driving. The driving physics are no where near good. They are stiff and clunky driving around going over hills and bumps in the terrain can cost you your life as you slow down alot going over uneven or uphill terrain. I've literally crashed against nothing because there seems to be an invisible wedge on the front of vehicles that seems to grab the ground and stop you dead if the ground meets at too sharp an angle. Like coming down a steep hill. Riding bikes isn't a death trap as long as you ride smooth ground. If you get into a really hilly area your going to die because bike physics are way off and as soon as you flip you die instantly if your going a certain speed or faster. I honestly can't believe with all the problems that this game blew up like it did. This game is not so much based on skill as it is in your chances of the prgramming actually working the way it supposed...to which it rarely does. People just love acting like playing this game is the like equivalent of playing paintball game where it's all on your skill whether you win or lose. There are too many variables. Internet connection compnents imprefect programming the list goes on...If they worried more about the game and making it a great experience FIRST worry about money SECOND then this would be a spectacular game to play and the money would come. Because as is evidenced by the many great games out there GTA Witcher 3 Assassin's Creed(most of them)etc.. Having a great game and having it work consistently will bring in the money naturally. GTA had mad problems when it first released and they went into overdrive to fix things...If only they took a lesson from that line of thinking...If you have a shooter the shooting should work!Before I go into this(lol)... I know there are gonna be people who say I probably just suck I must not know how to shoot very good no skill...blah blah blah. Stop trying to convince yourselves cause you ain't convincing me. I know how badly some would like to believe that it takes super human skills to play a video game. This isn't rocket science sorry but practice is all you really need to get good. Now I understand why developer's like this exist. WE LET THEM! I also know why PC games suffer and it isn't because of consoles. PC gamers actually act like paying for a subscription service is blasphemy like PC gamers never pay more than they should have to for anything. But if there is a Leather Jacket or some stupid shoes or outfits or skins for guns...they'll pay HUNDREDS for THAT! LMAO! Don't wanna pay for a service that can put an end to the rampant cheating on PC. Have to pay with Time/Money to access more features on your Steam profile. Since more money can always be made and time is the most precious commodity we have...Giving your time is as important to them as giving your moneyFirst and foremost this game isn't based on skill...It's based on chance. They really should call this game Player Unknown's Loot Lottery and Running Man Simulator. I mean you name your game after what your doing in the game most of the time. So you would think by the name that it's gonna be a battleground. Then why do we spend 90% or more of the time Running and looking for crap or staying ahead of that stupid line. Like 2 10% of playing this game is actually "battlegrounds". The loot in this game in SO inconsistent. I've gotten in the habit of going as far away from the plane line as I can so I have time to search. Cause usually I can search entire apartment buildings and not find anything that works together. I don't care what anyone says there is NO FUN in getting killed a majority of the time... Because if I land in a town with other ppl. Run into a spot to search find a a box of AR bullets no gun 3 health kits 2 red dot sights 4x scope and finally a pistol with ONE box of bullets! I run outside and I see this guy goin around my house and I open up on him point blank range with my pistol from behind...hitting him with %80 of my shots at the very least( I seen all the blood) he spins while prey n spraying and shoots off my pinky toe and I bleed out instantly! Of course the one place he searched happened to have level 3 helmut vest backpack M416 with plenty of ammo silencer and now a 4x scope off my dead body! But I still Keep playing...I have finally figured out why I kept playing...It's all about the money...They have literally turned video games into Las Vegas slot machines with NO JACKPOT! Everytime I'm running around searching and find a good weapon or a good attachment...I feel like I've won something...When I call a good spot and we get good loot AND the Circle...I feel like I've won something. everytime I get a kill I feel like I've won something.THAT is how they hook us! Now we got ppl paying hundreds or even thousands of dollars for some digital NOTHINGS to put on their character's. I have games like 3 kills and 11 headshots...I consistently shoot ppl 5 6 even 7 times all upper body and head. They don't die. People somehow can shoot you from so far away in full auto and hit you with every single bullet from like 2 300 meters away. Like they don't have recoil. Same thing happens when I'm driving...somehow ppl can shoot in full auto and never miss one shot while your driving 100 kph over hilly terrain. This game has one of the worst bullet physics systems I've ever seen. I always die in 3 or less shots...no matter if I have level 3 helmut vest and when I watch they replay their reticle isnt over me and bullets come out on an angle and go right to me...These issues should've been fixed ages ago. But they got us so brainwashed pulling the bandit arm hoping we get some empty "win" to get a dopamine hit in our head. They don't need to fix anything they have the perfect forumla. Vegas should take a cue from the gaming industry...look at all the money we spend to Kill Time they don't ever have to pay out random jackpot's to ppl. Our "Jackpot" is finding good weapons or good attachments getting kills callin the circle winning a "chicken dinner". This is also why they are coming out with more and more...maps weapons vehicles crap to buy cause people are starting to wake up and the brainwash is wearing off. I really can't believe people will pay hundreds of dollars for digital clothing and skins for weapons but not 5.99 a month so cheaters don't ruin so many games...smh

review: GRAPHICS 6/10 Acceptably modern but lazy.SOUND 7/10 Good gun sounds bad vehicular and limited environmental sounds.GAMEPLAY 6/10 Fun with friends but too repetitive and unrewarding to play alone.PERFORMANCE 7/10 Pretty smooth often suffers from high ping and hackers.SUMMARY 6.5/10PUBG is a well balanced shooter that is fun to play with a team of friends. It is however let down by repetitive gameplay server issues and microtransactions galore in an already unrewarding and overpriced game.Buy if You have friends to play it with. You want to be the very best that no one ever was. You just love killin'.Don't Buy if No one you know plays it. You want to be immersed in setting and story. You have rage issues. TLDR! PUBG is a well refined shooter that parachutes you into a shrinking area with up to 99 other players in a rush to gather equipment and eliminate any opposition so that you can have a chicken dinner all to your greedy self.Choose a landing zone in a city for high stakes high reward action surrounded by players desperately grabbing anything from the floor and defending themselves with whatever they can find or land in a rural area to buy yourself time to loot before heading out to meet others who have survived the deadly initial rush!This game is tough being the top player or team in 100 is quite the feat of skill and luck and getting your first chicken dinner feels good! The game offers the well paced tactical action of Battlefield along with the compelling kleptomania of DayZ's looting. It's truly a winning chicken dinning combination. The maps are large and varied and offer all types of situations for some duelling.Unfortunately by the time you have won your first chicken dinner you will have done and seen everything that the game has to offer. The gameplay whilst fun is extremely repetitive there isn't a vast amount of weapons and items and unlocking any fancy new threads or gun skins is highly unlikely with the introduction of microtransactions and season passes. The game is also plagued by hackers especially in America and high ping players in Europe.The game does get a recommendation as it is a good thing to have in your library for a round or ten with a team or friends but at it's core it's a very simple and generic game that is very lucky to have the attention that it's received.GRAPHICS 6/10It has the semi realistic stylized graphics familiar to all Unreal 4 games. The 3D models of characters are good though there are few varients but the weapons and items are stylized and cartoon like. The textures are passable but somewhat flat lacking in detail and unnatural in colour. The environmental lighting is good but everything has that sheen that seems to be in all UE4 games which I personally think is ugly. There is no artificial lighting as of yet. The animations individually are fair although when being utilized in the fast paced gameplay become as unnatural as in all PVP shooters. The three large arenas have a lot of variation and give the feeling of different locations but have a lot of copied and pasted elements inside them. Graphic options are fairly extensive to accommodate performance.ARMA and DayZ players will recognize elements still remaining from being lifted from DayZ Battle Royal. Although acceptable it feels very lazily done.SOUND 7/10The sounds of weapons are decent they are well recorded and produced although they seem a little too enhanced to the point of not properly representing the real life weapons. The effects used to imply distance and location are especially impressive and give a perfect impression of the trajectory of the projectile. Environmental sounds are well done although limited to waves light wind and rain. Some extra sounds to add as distractions and for immersion would be effective. Sounds for vehicle engines tyres and collisions are dissapointing and sound like something cut from Wacky Races. The footstep sounds which are used for locating an enemy player are also not fit for purpose they sound far too close even when in the next building and lack obvious direction and sound as though they were recorded by jogging in place.GAMEPLAY 6/10The gameplay has a good balance between realism and an arcade feel so players of Call of Duty and ARMA can feel relatively at home here. The maps have a lot of internal variation and provide very differing and unpredictable settings for firefights. They are a little too sparse for the intended gameplay you can sometimes spend a lot of time traversing the fields to get to the playzone rather than actually fighting.The game is equally fun and frustrating mainly because of a seeming lack of an AI director to effectively disperse loot and to choose intuitive playzones sometimes leaving you without equipment and having to travel for 10 minutes before being shot by a luckier player. Firefights are fun and quite exhilerating to start with but the game is SO repetitive and games so short that it quickly feels completely mundane. The game isn't realistic enough to be immersive or rewarding enough to warrant any disappointment in failure. The introduction of cash for stash lootboxes further reduces any rewarding feeling that you get from receiving points and reduces the game to a 'Guitar Hero' with guns a cashgrab that is fun to play with friends but requires a certain possibly undesirable mindset to play alone.Gameplay could aslo be improved by optional experience based servers. Some people have already spent more than a thousand hours playing this game which makes it hard for newcomers to enjoy or gain experience.PERFORMANCE 7/10It runs smoothly enough for a fast paced shooter it's not completely seamless but it works. The main issue comes from high ping players from out of the server region which will cause massive lag and desync when you are close to them rendering you defenceless. American players suffer massively with hackers but the problem isn't as extensive in Europe. Clearly the game needs a region lock and it is bizarre (although explainable by the amount of transactions that hackers make in the marketplace) that it doesn't have one.SUMMARY 6.5/10PUBG is a well balanced shooter that is fun to play with a team of friends. It is however let down by repetitive gameplay server issues and microtransactions galore in an already unrewarding and overpriced game.Buy if You have friends to play it with. You want to be the very best that no one ever was. You love killin'.Don't Buy if No one you know plays it. You want to be immersed in setting and story. You have rage issues.

review: It's a buggy and unoptimized mess that isn't even fun to me. And by unoptimized I mean I've played alphas of games that crashed constantly and required some serious hacks to even load in Win8 that had better framerates and loading times than this. At least this game is stable it's not gonna crash although there was a memory leak while I played.I tried to give it a chance I did even fairly well on my first few attempts but it's just a game that has huge technical issues and a few gameplay design choices I can't understand although it had bullet drop and felt sorta fair when playing. Melee hit registration is stupidly wonky though. A huge upside is that vehicles actually felt right because I was expecting them to be awful.If you liked H1Z1 or DayZ or any of those this is the game for you but personally? Can't recommend it. Only game I've refunded so far and I've backed quite a few Early Access games over the years.

review: Check out our Steam Curator Page and Website bluntlyhonest.review for even reviews and exclusive content!It's widely popular so was the Macarena.PUBG is a success story that's without question rocketing from day one into the position of most played battle Royale on steam and holding it for over a year is no simple task the game is "good" but is it great? honestly I don't think so to me it's clearly the best battle royale game on steam/best realistic graphics battle royale.Jack of all trades master of none.If I feel a battle royale itch I choose Fortnite BR when the urge for some tactical shooter actions strikes Rainbow Siege 6 is my port of call when I feel like 1 million and 6 options to customise my guns Escape from Tarkov is first on my list while PUBG could fill any of these roles for me it fills none of them as well as other titles I just cant bring myself to play it as it feels to me a waste of time settling for a second best in any of the specific itches I may have for pvp mayhem.It's the Best you can get that combines all 3 but sometimes the best isn't good enough.All my friends play it!The massive positive to the title is it's huge and you will find most of your friends strangers and the old lady who knits cat sweaters all play it you will find matches instantly and constantly.Lag is a feature not a bug!For the first year of its life the games greatest challenge was lag with freezing frame drops and sometimes epic rubberbanding that threw you outside the building you just entered the greatest challenge wasn't the other players but the servers themselves graphics would load oddly at times even on way over spec machines and twitch based firefights could turn into slideshows the devs have made massive gains in these areas and latest builds are much better optimised most recent build gaining me a 15 20fps boost over the previous build..Nations at War!Battle Royle games seem to attract a special subset of gamers nationalist extremists it's not totally uncommon to be team killed by a player changing racist remarks or the classic "China numa 1" there is also heavy Chinese vs West hostility with extremists on both sides which is disruptive to the community at large.Pay to Win?No.. I am so tired of having to clarify that cosmetics aren't P2W and that not all Microtransactions are of the devil.Worth it?If you don't like the cartoon gameplay of fortnite BR find Tarkov too Mil Sim dull dislike the Salt of Rainbow Siege or simply want an extremely active game you know will be active for 5+ years to come then Pubg is a great investment you will easily get your money worth.In conclusion?In conclusion its the best "realistic graphics" BR game on the market its wildly active and a cult trend right now i can see why its so popular even if I personally have it on my "revisit later" list worth a purchase but its not as amazing as you would think good but not great a decent burger but not a steak.https //bluntlyhonest.review/2018/01/26/player unknown battlegrounds prime steak or budget burger/

review: When I first got this game I enjoyed 200+ hours of messing around with my friends tryharding in duos or just plain losing my mind to the god tier skills of some people in this game. I played enough to be top 5k NA. I played enough to get bored then have my interest sparked again. To that I tip my hat. This game has one of the absolute best battle royal feels to it. However there are still problems to be addressed (as that "Early Access" banner will assure you). For instance I find that more and more my deaths a lag related. I see the person shoot at them but I die without seeing any shot fired from their gun. It is.... strange. Then theres the fact that I get put in the Asia server half the time. This means i have to change server before every single match which kinda sucks. But even though there are some major issues I must say I have never enjoyed a game more. Every match is different every player is different and every kill gives me a rush. 8.5/10 would recommend.

review: so far ive been actualy rather happy with this game its like a simplified arma survival like game theres not much more to say. you can actually MAKE money if you play this game enough kinda like gambling in csgo only its all free.the graphics are pretty good especially for a indie game (even though they have over 4 million players.) it is a little beefy on gpu and cpu but so long as your not using the basic or cheapest gpu you can get you can acheive optimal frames. also the physics could use some work but other then that thats really it. I know many people are complaining about how they get banned unfairly. but this IS a game where teamwork and stream sniping can happen and in all honesty i think if you need to watch a persons stream just to get a kill that should be a bannible offence and there are clear ways to tell. also for the people who shoot your buddys for fun then whine about being banned thats kinda fair otherwise people who group up together and get shot at the beginning have no fun at all.now as for the game currently it is early access which puts a little dip in things but i do think the cosmetics improved the game at least in terms of lasting appeal. while this isn't tf2 in its day it may make a decent subsitute for now. in all honesty i give this game a 8.5 out of 10.

That's the exact situation I see in this game. People with no taste in real games see this game on literally every ing where being played by every ing person you see on twitch youtube etc. and they start playing and try having fun like them.Yes surely this game has its moments as well. I remember my heart beating like crazy on my first couple of solo wins feeling the thrill of trying to survive was pretty exciting. It has a very interesting and appealing concept at first glance but when you get in to it more it turns into a snoozefest after some time. review: If you are looking for a fast paced game then you might want to turn around and second guess your purchase. Even while running the game at 60+ fps there is still alot of server lag including looting ping issues with players teleporting as well as frame rate drop consistently in many areas of the map. The game would be much better if it was optimized to fix some of the issues but the slow movement and people flying around like fairies while jumping is just boring to me and super unrealistic. The new update for H1Z1 may look horrible to some but i can guarantee it will play much better with ping lock they are bringing to the table with the new features. Meaning it will cut out alot of those unwanted foreign players that desync hard and hack to win. To me H1Z1 has a much better play style by having a much quicker reaction including not taking a thousand years to parachute into the map like BG. I run H1Z1 at roughly 140fps even without optimization but for some reason this game locks me at 62fps. I prefer a much smoother gameplay without all the fanboys that bought this game due to their favorite streamers playing it and pretending that it is good and better than a game that is much better in its gamestyle. Nothing will match H1z1 because it is unique and overall better minus all the cheaters. Though im sure BG will have cheaters before you know it and then it will be and unplayable game quote on quote just like Day Z.

review: my honest Opinion on it because there are so many bad reviews here+ pros Greatest BR game I have played so far (I have played ArmA 2 BR H1Z1 ArmA 3 BR and Fortnite) New Map (Sanhok) is great Bugs get fixed when they appear Such much fun playing it with friends in Duos or Squad Games Optimization has improved a ton. (FPS are fine) Few Cheaters. (I have seen 2 Cheaters in 380 hours of Gameplay thats very very low when I compare it to CSGO) I like the Event Pass so you are killing people with weapons you normally wont Low queue times Weapon balancing and spawn rates specially on Sanhok cons People complain about things that are not really a problem Wish there was a lobby with 3 Players and not 3 man Squad Game Can't queue for Erangel or Miramar onlyconclusion Category Rating Graphics for a BR Game 9/10 Gameplay 10/10 Audio Quality 9/10 Audio Effects (Ghost Steps Shots) 6/10 FUN with Friends 10/10 Price Worth the money overall I would recommend this game to everyone!
