review: First of all if you are going to buy the game make sure you have some mates to play with because it makes the overall experience more enjoyable. Now with the game itself I can say that the controls aren't clunky and are relatively easy to get use to (if you are familiar with fps controls). The frames aren't too bad for lower end computer users and will continualusly get better as the devs update the games compatibility. To get a smooth experience (if you are playing on a lower end compouter) make sure you set the video settings to the lowest which maximises performance (and the game doesn't look too ugly). Overall the game at the moment is defiantly worth an investment of 30$ as it is constantly being updated and has a high replay ability level.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: PEOPLE ARE IN LOVE WITH THE IDEA OF WHAT THIS GAME COULD BE NOT WHAT IT CURRENTLY ISI never write reviews because generally I'm never this unsatisified about something I buy and I've been playing video games my entire life I generally will play anything. However there is just so much going wrong with this game that I feel people need to get the other side of the conversation that is just being ignored by people that are in love with the idea of what this game could be but not what this game really is.That's really what this game is it's a battle royale dream in theory but the game really fails to meet that expectation. My biggest issue is the inconsistancy in the level of experience you encounter between each game. Right now there is significant lag issues because the seller got greedy and didn't limit the amount of alpha users. This is an industry problem no one has really addressed. Early access should be limited based on what the provider can currently offer. Why in the world would you allow a game company that can only currently be able to support 5k members but sell 10s of thousands of game keys? It's downright idiotic. And when I say inconsistant level of play I mean it. Lag is a game killer. The game can lag at the worst times and either get you killed or you get a free klill. I would say both suck in their own ways. Another huge issue is optimization this game is a total trainwreck. Most people are just playing on minimal settings with high level gaming computers because it's highly unoptimized. Expect to play on the lowest setting possible if you don't want to struggle with FPS issues.The nail in the coffin is the large amounts of hackers cheaters and aimbots. They said they have already banned 25k hackers that's less then 1% of the popluation I've heard. Yet there are companies currently advertising selling these kinds of products and we the players have no way of really determining if it's hacking cheating aimbot or even just lag. You have no replay system which they are talking about putting it but it makes knowing how or what killed you nearly impossible unless you just record every single video and even then it's unlikely to give you enough feedback.Another thing to note is the current matchmaking system providers little to no level of play regulation between your current skill level and the people you're playing with. I'm not master aimer especially on a computer I was more of an old school Halo 2 guy but most times I just get utterly destoryed in a firefight unless I have a significant advantage which just isn't fun. There is also no real way to focus on improving you skills besides throwing yourself at new games over and over at the most populated area dying till you make a little progress. It's kind of weird to say it but it would be nice if they had a smaller team deathmatch map so people could die a bunch and learn how to actually use the guns. My last point is just more of a balance issue and how unfair some guns are. You have a sigificant advantage if you get a sniper with at least an 8x scope. As well guns like the S12K make close combat downright dreadful and grenades are very weak so you have little recourse. I think another significant improvement they could add to the game is don't make the collapse random. It would be much better especially in the later stages of collapse if it had a high prefence to close on areas where there is the least amount of people. So that it actually makes people have to stop camping and fight. It would make for much more interesting gameplay then just getting really lucky and getting a fantastic camping spot early and just riding it out.I would not recommend this game at its current price. At most it's worth only about 5 10 dollars.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: The concept is pretty fun if a little shallow and the gameplay and UIs are very nice especially gunplay. However it is currently plagued with performance issues and bugs.Unless you have an SSD you will be lucky to load in before the match starts. The world itself loads incredibly slowly when you first land.The physics is reminiscent of ARMA compelete with getting stuck in walls and wacky weightless vehicles.These are the sort of things that are forgiveable for an early access title.Honestly i would give this a neutral/mixed review if i could.The only other issues i have are with the price and a few small issues like being unable to see where your shots land making it hard to adjust for bullet drop.Their tonnes of battle royale games and mods out their in a much more content rich and stable state. I however have high hopes the game once its in a more playable state.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: If you're thinking about buying this game I can safely say don't...for right now anyway. From my experience this is a buggy mess which needs optimized. For example when I open the inventory I usually can't close it right away (I have to press tab multiple times to close it this is the same with the map). This game is the most buggy when you first touchdown from the plane and sometimes things have not loaded completely making it impossible to start looting however it does eventually load and will not be as laggy...after about 5 minutes. This is also a very slow game which is the way it was intended to be but it doesn't have to be THIS slow. The current map is way too large and the new map is about the same size and even more barren than the original one. I don't hate the concept or even the gameplay of this game (all they need to do is make smaller maps) but until they optimize and fix some of the bugs I'll just stick with Fortnite. Unfortunately it seems like the developers care more about adding more things into the game than actually fixing it. Which is great don't get me wrong but I just think they should focus more on optimizing right now than continually adding more and more. I hope to change my review to a recommend later when they hopefully fix it
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game is awful! Do not waste your money and time on this game!Briefly PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS can be characterized as follows this game is an unoptimized piece of trash code. The game has a very interesting concept but everything spoils the terrible technical performance of the game. This game is terrible even for game in early access.If you want to spend a bunch of your time picking in the configuration files of the game trying to make the game work. If you like to spend your nerves on sudden crashes of the game in the middle of the battle. If you adore firing at the enemy at point blank all your ammunition and dying from one single bullet in response from a completely unharmed opponent because of the clumsy network code of the game. If you like to spend your time in games getting stuck in the textures and enjoying watching how opponents shoot your defenseless character at that moment.If you can not live without such "trifles" as horrible ballistics terrible character animation awful in game physics. If you are having fun when your opponents in the game get an unquestionable advantage over you due to flaws of the game and easily kill you.In this case this game is created for you! Welcome to the world of pain suffering and humiliation! Welcome to PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS! Enjoy!
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I m seeing a BUNCH of reviews giving negative comments and how there are Hackers everywhere in the game. Thing is I have pretty much never run into a hacker or spoofer in the playtime I have in this game. I m gonna be honest and say my mind. I believe most of the people giving bad reviews either just could never get far in the game and win or are salty as .Yes there is probably a few hackers still wandering around the game but the developers have been cracking down on them like no other. That also why there s a report function if you believe you got killed by a hacker. Most of the time the killer probably just got the jump on you or spayed more bullets into you before you could react. Though if it was a hacker it would be obvious and ban them. Getting into my next point. I ll admit if you die right at the beginning at the game and/or never make it to the end and possibly win. I admit it would probably get old. Thing is that s why people practice and play for countless hours so they can actually win a game. If your computer can t run the game then just don t play it! 1) it will ruin your experience in the game2) You will NOT win a game so don t bother. I hate it when people leave bad reviews saying there are hackers or are just triggered cuz they can t play the game due to bad computers. The game requires a decent rig to play so if you don t have one then just wait to play to game until you do. I have about 16 wins on record that I have been counting since release since the leaderboards reset due to early access. Personally I ve been having a blast with this game since it came out and I can t wait for the new map update. NOTE I know I may not have as many hours as other player s but that doesn t mean a thing. Everything I have said in this post is my opinion on the game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: First off i have to say that this game lives up to its reputation. I highly reccomend getting this game whether you are debating about getting it or not. Its all you could hope a battle royale game to be it has no ridiculous twists just the plain find equipment and weapons and fight against time and players. The combat is a lot hard than you would think compared to other FPS so dont go in expecting to destroy instantly as a simple 2v2 can last up to 5 minutes that said they can end quickly if you let your guard down. This game is extremely fun and don't think that only the amazing players will always win and you will die within 10 minutes because within 24 hours of the game i had come in top 10 twice in duo and won with a duo partner. Playing solo is also extremely fun and it is a game that you can play solo or with others for a whole diffrent experience. I think this game is worth the 27 and its only in its Beta stage.Now about the actual game there are less bugs than you would expect as i havent encounterd any and the game works smoothly as my PC allows it. The mechanics are easy to learn and not complicated. I can't think of anything to say really good about it to make someone buy it because its just an overall very well made game. The only down sides to the game is that the jumping is a bit iffy at time I.e you cant get over a fence the first time and fall damage is only really high buildings. the intial parachuting could be improved when about to land as you kinda just stall in the air for a while. And the scroll for weapons is delayed although I think this is done on purpose to give it a realistic effect but the U.I for the weapons is also delayed so somethimes you switch to far or too little leading to having to use the numbers. And thats the only downs to the game really. It runs smoothly and has no real big flaws in my opinion.

review: playerunkowns campgrounds... where do i start? This game is amazing if you enjoy the culling battle royale or h1z1 you'll enjoy this game however just being released... we come into issues that should have been addressed before releasing i know its alpha but lets be real being in alpha should no longer be a reason to have a bugged game at release let me start off by saying that they are addressing these issues currently and those issues are 1. lag the devs KNOW that theres server lag and client lag claiming that they miscalculated numbers you built a simple game has 1 map and has guns which are simple to code then the movement mechanics and what not for $30 you get 1 map and what not really? lets get past this get rich quick scams on alpha games an example of the lag is i started off could move fine for 1 sec then would warp forward or to an area i wasnt even moving to very very annoying as its constant the whole match and is a good chance it will happen next match it doesnt help that you get into a vehicle and the lag is non existant which the lag really effects fighting be ready to die after you spent 10 minutes finding 1 guy while pushing through the annoying lag. 2. glitches theres not too to many glitches but a big was is being able to go prone between stuff then getting stuck you can walk all over the area but once you crouch or go prone boom you're screwed enjoy sitting there til you die. 3. gathering items this issue plagues a lot of games for some reason you go to pick up an item and have to spam your pick up key or wait 1 2 seconds per item its not a game changer however h1z1 is bad with this and shouldn't be an issue what so ever however devs seem to not care cause we buy their games anyways. this also happens with opening doors and getting in vehicles 1 2 second delay for no apparent reason which can cause you to get in and out of a vehicle or open a door walk through then it closes and youre back where you were before you went through the door. just take note that is still there. 4. combat pistols are some what over powered you can have a level 3 helmet and vest with a coat on and get 2 shot same can happen with some rifles and i understand that headshots take a ton of health if not 1 shot kill however... with a level 3 helm i dont see why an akm or an m16a4 will being a 1 shot kill in the head top tier helmet but who am i to speak about it. also be aware that even if your sights are over a wall your shots might not go where youre aiming in 3rd person i find that acceptable as theres a red indicator showing your shots wont hit your target cause of the wall however aiming down sights thats very very annoying. other than all those issues which aren't entirely game breaking someone with a low amount of patients make break their gaming gear not good. also remember this game is an EXACT COPY of h1z1 you fly in gather stuff go to the marked location maybe find someone maybe not maybe find a vehicle maybe not and FYI THERE IS NO CRAFTING so dont come into the game expecting crafting. and using painkillers or energy drinks can replenish that extra 5% of your health bar as well as heal you over time.

review: On a clear day (in game) I get 55 60 fps with some medium and high settings. But stuttering like crazy. on very low settings same fps but still stuttering a little bit.Then it rains.. For some reason that's the only thing that makes the game run really smooth.Then it's really foggy. Like something taken out of the movie ''The Fog''. FPS are alright but still stuttering like crazy. What it boils down to On a bad day 40fps On a god day 55 60 fpsThat sounds playable right? Well as I said before the stuttering is crazy.Stutter simulator 2017! 10/10 would stutter like crazy again.If they focused on optimizing the game it would be really good. But it is playable as is right now and it's awesome! I do recommend it but I also dont until they optimize it. But one thing is certain This game is NOT worth the price they are charging for it. Get it at a discount if possible!my specs i5 6600k oc to 4 2ghz R9 390 gpu and 16 gigs of ram

review: Ah Yes PlayerUnkown's Battlegrounds. The open map battle royale sensation that took the pc gaming world by storm. A game with a steep learning curve and a lot of early access bugs that can really take away from the experience and the fun. In the games current state it's more or less if the game wants to cooperate with the hardware you have. I'm running a Gtx Titan and all of the other high end hardware to go along with it. I can only play the game on Medium settings right now. If I go any higher than that buildings can take up to a minute to fully load and be accessible. That can be detrimental to game play. So in short at the moment the hardware/optimization aspect needs a lot of work and it's more or less a gamble whether or not the game will run well for you. As far as the core game. It is in my opinion one of the funnest multiplayer shooters I have ever played. The large open map exploration looting countless buildings for new equipment armor and accessories brings hours worth of fun. As I mentioned in the beginning of the review PUBG does have a steep learning curve. There are people who have been here since day one. Growing and learning the game and bringing experience from other games that controll similar to PUBG and absolutely destroying their competition. There can be a lot of frusteration that occurs after searching for all your equipment finally having a full set up and boom you've been shot from who knows where. PUBG is a game just as much about listening to your surroundings as it is keeping a close eye on it. The audio levels do needs some work though. It can be a little much when you have gunfire an airplane flying overhead and a redzone going off all at once it's very loud. There is also an issue with the sounds of players footsteps it's an important part of the game to be able to hear where another player is as of now that audio is shoddy at best and can be misleading when trying to find the player you're hearing. You may thing you hear them in a building you are in when they're really in the next building over. Over all even though there is no definite way of knowing how the game will run/play for you until you buy it. The working fully optimized PUBG will be one of the best multiplayer games out on both PC and consoles. There is hours worth of fun to be had and it will be exciting to see how they improve the game over time. The Devs have a lot to work on and progress can seem slow but progress is being made an it's noticeable. For me personall the game plays much better than it did even a month ago. It's been worth every penny. I've talked my buddies into buying it and they all have enjoyed the game as well.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: You are stranded from your squad in a farmhouse looting for med kits and weapons when another squad happens upon your location and stops outside. You radio your teammates who hop in a jeep and drive to your location while you crouch in a closet. An enemy reaches the top floor and begins searching through rooms while you ready your shotgun.. He just about reaches your closet when he hears your team arrive and runs to the window to engage them. All hell breaks loose as you emerge from your hiding place and open fire on the unsuspecting enemy.This is just one of the infinite number of scenarios that can unfold each time you play a round of Playerunknown's Battlegrounds.This battle royale format of FPS suits many different playing styles stealth run and gun camping sniping etc etc. But don't get too comfortable with that style because the gameplay setup will routinely force you to go outside your comfort zone.You start in the lobby area which allows you to pick up and try the weapons for a short time while the server fills up with players. The game starts with a plane flying over a massive island where players choose their position to parachute from. Choose a remote area for relatively uninterrupted looting go into a city for a quicker ability to gear up jump to a key location like the school a hospital or the power plant or find a vehicle and drive to a location outside the path the plane took.If you encounter someone early on you may only have a melee weapon or a pistol or your bare knuckles to defend yourself. Looting up quickly is key.Soon after dropping in a circle appears that you must work your way inside of because when a countdown time is finished a poisonous closes in and can drain your health if caught outside the circle. This circle gets gradually smaller while the gas becomes more toxic as the game progresses.The gameplay increases in intensity as players are forced into ever smaller tracts of land until one person duo or 4 man squad is declared the winner.A wide range of weapons and attachments available including rarer weapons only available by daring to approach an air drop.It's fun intense challenging and incredibly addictive with no two rounds ever the same. This game will hold your attention for a long time Given it is an early access game PUBG is not without its flaws but a dev team is working tirelessly to address them and listens well to the feedback from fans.If you enjoy shooters you can't go go wrong with this game!!! As an early access game PUBG gets 5 out of 5.stars from me!!!

review: Pros Better gameplay Attachments to guns You can choose where to parachute in More variety of weapons More interesting map filled with exciting areas to fight in Actually fun air drop system (better than h1z1) Interesting explosive area mechanic (better than h1z1) Manageable recoil Nice graphics Good sounds Extremely fast matchmaking system Thrill of playing the game Doesn't take a master hardcore gamer to understand and play better than everyone else Nice cosmetics Exremely fun team playing experience Fun solo experience Fun squad experience Fun duo experience Interesting and fun choice of unique veichles Well developed camera modes (first person and third) Less chance of being spawn killed (compared to h1z1) Good weapon and car/boat spawns around the map Large detailed buildings Well designed UI and HUD for enjoyable gameplayCons For a game this new the optimisation needs a lot of work but I'm confident they can fix it in the next few updates Some hackers not many compared to other games Server lag stuttering frequently Toxic voice chat at spawn Some bugs but manageable ones Needs a 5 man queue matchmaking mode (4 people is the max people you can have in this so far) Steam overlay is laggy when in gameIn conclusion This game is better than h1z1 in every way.I know this because I have played both games and have considered their differences.The sad thing is h1z1 has been out for way longer has less than 10 different weapons and this game just came out has more weapons better gameplay and a more fair spawning system.*Warning you need a good pc to run this game don't get it if you have a potato.*

Time to get moving and someone under me has come there watched me through tower and as soon as I opened the door instant 2 headshotted while jumping off the stairs.10/10 would never play solo again.Dont forget how desync is pure horror. Scoping and tracking an enemy when suddenly the guy moves up 50 meters within half a second.AKA if u shoot you give away position and you shoot nothing but air.Fun idea yes.Horrible experience HELL YES.

review: The good Good movementWeaponsVehiclesFast gamesThe bad Jump mechanic is terribleItem spawns can be terrible sometimesHacks (not uncommon to be shot in the head with one bullet while zooming over uneven terrain at full speed in a vehicle) aint that many skilled players.Line of sightHit boxes are not greatThe worst Sound the sound in this game is one of the worst for a shooter. Gun shots might be the only good directional audio however foot steps (crouching walking ads movement) sound like they're either 5 ft away or you don't hear them or the direction isn't what you thought it was. Vehicles have decent directional sound but judging distance can sometimes be tough.Constant bombs and planes take over your headset.Overall It's okay needs a focus on hitboxes and sounds.

review: O.K. game. Very frequent updates Dev transparency Weekly/monthly updates that introduce new content bug fixes A/C tweaks and optimization. Some cons though are the vehicle systems (unstable death traps) server lag/de sync issues and the absense of a shooting range in which players can test/practice the many weapons in game. Another thing that grinds my gears is the Red Zone a BR game should not do random damage like this. Also the loot tables. there have been times where I have been in 4 different houses and I have yet to find a gun. If you are new to PC games I would not recommend. If you have a background in other shooters then I would definitely recommend. There are several minor issues which if fixed could easily compete with it's competitors. I feel that PUBG corp. is slowly making the game better focusing on the bigger issues such as cheaters optimization and bug fixes. Though I feel like minor issues such as server lag/de sync bad vehicle system etc. should be rolled out before new content such as new guns maps etc.

review: Reasons not to buy the game.1 So buggy that 50% of the time you will die to bugs or crash or some other unexpected event will occur that will ruin your game.2 Controls are clunky and unresponsive most of the time.3 90% of the time you're dependent upon RNG. Will that shot land? Will there actually be a gun in this house that's worth firing? Will the circle land nearby? If not will there be a car nearby that I can use to get to the circle cause the map is so huge that there's no way I'll get there without one.There's many other battle royale games out there... pick one of those let this one die.

review: I reallyyyyyyyyyyy want to tell you this game is great and it's worth the $30 you will spend on it as well as all the hype behind it being true but honestly I can't. As someone with over 350 hours plus in the game please listen to me when I say stay away and save your $30 for now. Think about spending that money on a gmae thats far better developed than this. The game isn't anywhere near worth $30 in its current state. Maybe down the road when they fix all of the issues that destroy this game then it will be amazing but for right now I wouldn't buy it if I knew what I was getting into to.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This is my first experience with the game. Other people might have better or worst experience. Would be a decent game if there was not some much server lag. For an ealry access game $30 is steep just to try it and to have server lag. If there was lag in a game or two I would recommend trying it but 5 game in a row is not reasonable for the amount of money being spent. Game bugs would be understandable but to have server lag trying out the game preventing me from enjoy it and able to help in providing feedback is something that needs to be dealt with.Liked Time / Area Limit Matches ( Safe Zone shrinks over time )Easy Inventory Management ( Easily Interact with items ect First Aid Weapons/Weapon Attachments Armor/Clothes )Easy Keyboard and GamePad Controls ( Simple commonly used controls )Disliked Server Lag ( As stated about 5 game in a row server lag effected gameplay )Aim Sensitivity ( Tried adjusting higher and lower just does not like to have middle ground ) No ingame friends list ( Steam Friends Only ) Currently only one map (Hopefully more map later )Price Tag ( $30 is pretty high for EA game with unstable servers )Overall First Impression Not worth the time and money for something I really could not play.Fix the server lag problems then the game would be worth trying out and might be enjoyable to play with friends. I would write a better review when the game gets more stable but for now I am going to get my money back.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I'm really disappointed in this game as it was fun to play with friends early on but few fixes have been made to things that ruin the game. I purchased the game pretty early on in early access and ran into many bugs which is fine as it is an early access game. 2 months later lots of things have been added but I still experienced the same bugs. Bugs including buildings not loading in unable to use meds not being able to pick up items etcetera. Things that make the game truely unplayable. Though they still had time to add crates and keys to earn more money. And i don't even care about the whole "They said they wouldnt add micro transactions until after EA". It just bothers me that they prioritize profits over a fully fleshed out great game especially when they made over 100 million USD after first couple months of release.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Fun as hell best multiplayer game out there atm. Just look at the current players despite only being out for a couple months it tops the most popular steam games Dota 2 and CSGO. With the new crates that you can sell on the market for around 60 to 80 cents you can make quite a bit of money back from this game depending on how much you play and win. Overall I highly recommend this game for anyone who is into comptetive shooters. If you do purchase this game then please do the community a favor and don't be a camper. Actually try and go kill people instead of cowering inside a building or behind cover so you up your placement. It is a lot more fun to play this game aggresive and get lots of kills rather than win with only 1 kill from being a camper. The game does need a lot of work and new maps/guns would be greatly appreciated but I am confident that those features will be implemented in the near future. Overall 9/10

review: As of right now I literally cannot play the game that I bought it crashes thirty seconds in on my GTX 1080Ti 32 Gb core i7 machine. I'm not the only one either. Go look at the PUBG official forums or filter for crashing on the PUBG subreddit. The game would actually be decent if the developers weren't absolutely terrible at releasing software. Literally. Does. Not. Work. This the only time I've been upset enough to post a negative review. Even if the game doesn't crash outright you'll still risk the chance of the devs releasing versions that drag down performance to levels that make the game unplayable. Kind of hard to shoot when the character you're playing rubber bands every ten feet.You want to spend $30 on an early access game? Well I hope it works out for you and that you're able to actually play it. If I could get a refund I would.

review: system requirementBasic i5 any gen 8 GB RAM ANY GTX Graphic card Eq. or better than GTX 650 2 GB and 30 GB HDD spaceSPECIFIC Requirement Gaming Monitor more than 75 Hz 1 ms response time connected through Display Port HDMi or DVI D NB VGA monitors are at disadvantageinstall the GAME PUBG in the SSD Advantage your invironment will load faster better and will help you to locate the enemyHEADPHONE MUST BE ATLEAST 5.1 Surround Sound if your Motherboard does not have this feature then install a sound card 5.1 or better 7.1Broadband internet 10 Mbps down 4 Mbps up at leastNow you are ready to explore the deserted IslandThe game is in early access and is not optimized at all sometimes you cannot enter a car sometimes you cannot enter a house after opening the door sometimes you cannot jump a wall and guns sounds a lot and the freaking crosshair of the guns are as big as a tree and recoil are so much that if you fire at the target in brust or auto mod and the chances are only one or two bullets will hit.CONS you might die due to heart attackyou may never see who killed youthere are hackers in the game who do not die and have all best weapons when they landyou might have to search tens of houses to find a rifle or SMGthe ammo you need will be 30 or 60 clip size is small usually 30The game is addictive and frustrating

review: Honestly worth every penny. I don't understand why some people are so upset about the microtransactions that have absolutely no affect on gameplay whatsoever. If someone want's to pay $10 for a random chance of getting a dope coat to wear while they play (that doesn't affect the players storage or anything) then why should anyone be able to stop them? It doesn't hurt anyone or the playerbase and the microtransactions are good for long term development so long as they stay unaffecting gameplay. Onto the game itself. Freaking. Fantastic. It has that intense action packed gunplay of games like DayZ and the original DayZ mod but in a far more condensed version and without the literal hours of looting and running that those games entailed. The gun mechanics are tight and there is truly a difficult decision to be made when picking which weapon to use in a match as they're nearly all viable (lookin at you VSS). It is honestly some of the best fun I've had playing with friends in duo and squad games. I'm personally not as big of a fan of solos but to each his own. The devs as much as people complain really are fantastic and really do care about this game and the playerbase. I can see the time and the love that they have poured into this game and it really shines through when playing. I have full faith that the game will only improve over time as they have already fufilled so many of their early access promises and only continue to do so. In conclusion I highly reccomend this game. When playing with friends and even solos it's an action packed heart pounding adrenaline rush of a game that just never seems to get old. The devs are incredibly active and even though they've made some mistakes have a real heart for this game and the players. I would highly reccomend this game if a battle royale shooter sounds like the type of thing for you (yes even for $30).

review: Good game and good concept however some minor tweaks could be made to make this game even better for example the chance you have to find a gun other than a pistol or shotgun is quite small when you first land except when you got to the larger areas this makes the gameplay quite unfair in my perspective. Another thing that i think should be added is a smaller map this can be better for the aggressive playstyles having a smaller map also eleminates the long runs you have to make to the safe zone. Having a large map creates an extended amount of time in which players will not see another player for a long time. In many of my games i have spent 5 10 minutes running across the lage map just to be killed by a player camping in a building. Having a smaller map would take away these problems and make a fun quick and explosive gaming experience. Other than these issues this game is good and would be fun for any FPS player.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: PUBG is possibly my new all time favorite game. I originally came from the Battle Royale Mod that PlayerUnknown made for Arma 3 and as soon as I saw that he had began developing his own standalone game I knew I needed to get it. I waited a while to write this review because I wanted to soak alot before I expressed my opinion. I'm going to start by saying that PUBG without a doubt has some problems. Some of these include the occasional server lag and the chinese takeover of the NA servers. This I feel will be getting fixed in the long run seeing that the devs are very enthusiastic about their game. Now some people say its stupid that you can get banned from stream sniping/ team killing this is their way of trying to fix trolls and people that ruin the experience. There are ways they can change that and better ways to prevent the cheaters but the game hasnt been out for a year yet. The devs are trying and will find a way to fix these problems. The game also has a great deal of good things. This includes but is not limited to monthly updates and weekly patches. The monthly updates always add new items or aspects into the game some are small and some are big. They are also working on more maps to try to prevent the game getting boring and repetitive. Another pro is that the game is realistic but not too realistic there are realistic aspects but they arent too hardcore. Some examples could be bullet ballistics muzzle flashes bullet types and grenades some things that prevent it from being too hardcore is there is no bleeding unlike H1Z1's bleeding mechanic. This game is a very fun and chill game to play with your friends or by yourself I highly recommend it.

review: Game seems to have issues with AMD processors. I well exceed the minimum requirements by at least 8 gb in every direction yet the game runs incredibly choppy with FPS lag as low as 20. There isn't a noticable difference in FPS and performance when operating the game at ultra or very low. I still have FPS spikes. The volume needs work as shots echo as if they were passing through a tunnel. The recent patch made a VERY small improvement on my end in terms of performance and has seemed to make it more difficult to find any weapons (6 attempted games after patch and located only 1 AK despite being first in that area). Typically I end up locating a pistol and just getting easy kills on unfortunate players that have a frying pan. This is idiotic and takes away from the fun and the reason why I would play this game. Currently I would reccommend H1Z1 heavily over Battlegrounds mostly due to performance issues and lack of quality gameplay. Save your $30 until they improve the game significantly.

review: Dear PUBG fanboys hear me out here.For me personally I enjoy a fast paced action game and not a slow paced laggy mess of a game.As of right now the community of this game unless you drop somewhere like say Military or School there is barely any action. Maybe you end a game with a kill or not even. This game encourages coward playstyles unlike titles like H1Z1 or Fortnite. Don't get me wrong the final circle is incredibly intense but this point is worthless when you spend half the game trying to get attachments just to pimp out all your guns and make minor changes. In other titles of the same genre you pick up one gun and it is all up to skill. Not up to how many attachments you may have or how much loot you spent hiding in a game.Don't recommend this game in its current unoptimised state. slanee

review: PUBG is a very fun early access game. Like many early access games however it suffers from the necessary bugs and glitches. At the start PUBG was truly a game "by gamers for gamers". The developer has officially stated to not go into micro transactions and the like. Only to throw that completely overboard in the latest patches. Instead of focusing on core bugs the game has (lag glitches the amount of system resources it eats) it seems money in an early access game is more important. Beside that banning people who kill streamers because the streamers refuse to put a delay on their streams.. priceless. TL DR Developer is breaking all 'his/their' promises. Are in it for the easy money. They focus more on getting more money (by way of streamer advertisement/loot boxes for money (like CSGO) and less to actually tackle issues that need to be tackled. Right now I can't recommend this game to anyone. All we can do is wait and hope the developer has a change of heart...

review: Alright. Lets start with the positives. The plot and the gun play is good but jsut like most early access game it was released way too soon. I've experienced so far to dieing to vehichle explotion while swimming together with 2 teammates yet no vehicle or enemy player was even arround. I've shot people in the chest close up with shotgunsmultiple times and gotten 2 shot by a rifle.yet I always die to the first shot from a shotgun every signle time with body armour and helmets.The movement on uneven ground is clounky and it gets me stuck a lot and specially in the worst time it could happen it always does. The game runs like complete (With a good setup). There's a lot of internet lag and fps lag. I would wait to buy this game until they've fixed that to save yourself from the frustrating feeling you'll get from playing it. I get it everytime. Hope it was helpful to some.

review: THE GAMEPLAY its a fun third/first person shooter where you need to race the zone closing in on a random center point whilst poeple try to kill you.THE NEGATIVE COMMENTS Ignore the ing comments about micro transactions ruining the game becouse of 1 thing.IT DOESENT MATTER.It wont inpact the gameplay and until the game is out you will be abel to buy boxes whit ingame currency.O boohoo they broke 1 of the most unimportant promises to make a fun effent more interesting.And then we have the "they have enough money they dont need more" argument.remember the servers and that they might do more of these Esports events? wel any 1 whit the argument above doesent becouse suprice suprice they have costs too and cant afort to fund everything themselfs over and over again i mean eventualy servers would close becouse they couldnt see the benefit to keeping them online UNLLESS you have micro transactions.TLDR.game is fun all negative comments are about the micro transactions which they need for the event and the argument "they have enough money they dont need more" is invalid aslong as you want the servers online and more events and other fun things poeple whining about microtransactions dont deserve.

review: In disregard of all the negativ reviews i really enjoy this game. The new map is really good. It puts a faster pace to the game and forces people to "bump" into each other more often. I started playing this spring so haven't been here for a while but in my opinion i dont expirience many bugs. Not really a in depth review but seeing so many negativ reviews i wanted to shed some light to the game. Yes they are adding content that makes people want to spend money but hey who doesn't now a days? and the money spending part is just for character design clothes weapon skins etc. No pay to win bs. Oh and the graphics and gameplay is much better looking (and feeling) than that cartoonish weird child game "Fortnite". Just sayin.

I got PUBG for Christmas on the Xbox one and as you may know the performance on xbox is subpar to say the least. Now I have a relatively beefy PC and it runs on Ultra Graphics and it is much more enjoyable. I would highly recommend this game to anyone who likes a challenge and it is superior to other Battle Royale games in my eyes.

review: First of all This game is spectacular. If you don't like it you don't like quality. Solo mode is like going headfirst into the "IT" drain. Its scary you could get spooked at any moment and the feeling of victory is unmatched.Duo mode is a good way to blame your friend for your mistakes. Also gratifying.Squad mode. Now this is the best game mode and quite frankly in my 22 years on this planet I have never enjoyed vehicular combat with bros more then the squad mode in this game. Halo 3 is a close second but cmon now that game did not have sand buggys.Buy it and be happy or don't buy it and live a life of utter misery. The choice is yours.

From customizable attachments bullet lead leaning breath holding.This game has so much potential if they can fix all the underlying issues. Performance fixes de sync optimizations 64 tick rate servers (or 128). They should have leader board for 8x8 maps and 4x4 maps and whatever size maps they come out with. You should get randomed into a list of just 8x8 just 4x4 or both(for those who don't care about which map size they get).

The gameplay is solid which is a plus for a early access game and it really feels like you have total control of your character. games length is comfortable but gets really intense towards end game. review: Buggy but hell lot of fun.Edit First of all the community is very toxic who only wants to nit pick the negative aspects of the game. These are the people who don't know about developing a game and maintaining it. Not every problem can be fixed overnight. People will try to run it below minimum requirements and then call it "unplayable". Does it have it's issues? Yeah it does. The netcode is very unoptimized and the servers tend to take a hit sometimes but it's not like you'll get that "unplayable experience" every damn time. Bluehole said they are working on improving the game which is definitely going to take some time. You can compare the state the game is in now and the state in which it was one year ago. Tell me you don't see the difference. If you want to buy it then I recommend trying it out first if your friend or colleague has it and then judge for yourself instead of coming out and shouting the same damn thing everyday at the devs.Thankyou for your time.

review: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS (PUBG) is a Battle Royale Game that features back to back matches of fighting to the death and I love it.In the game as of Dec 21st 2017 there are two maps 1 Forest Rural/Urban Map and a Desert Rural/Urban Map. The Maps are set up quite nicely with a good amount of space with cities and a great amount of space for forests and other rural type buildings. The game offers nice houses to hide in or fast paced streets to run through.The various vehicles allow for fast travel and work nicely. I dont have much to complain about themA random red zone bombs an area every so often attempting to kill anything in its radius.The Gunplay is great in my opinion and the guns sound and feel great. The only thing I might like to be different would be adding more power to pistols just cause they feel pointless against anything else. Which of course they should but I still feel like there should be a bit more power.The Game offers a small but nice customization system where in game currency from winning and killing in matches.The Only con to this game is the lag and fps drops. I do wish that fps was steady and the map would load in completely before dropping as it offers a disadvantage to some players if there buildings to not load in (I myself have not had this problem but the people I play with do).Overall PUBG offers hours of fun and is great to play with friends or alone if your feeling it. It is definately worth 30 dollars.I recommend PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS.

review: This game is anything but perfect.The servers can be horrendous. There are many many bug often game breaking when they occur.The game is in fact slow which to some is a major problem. A "running simulator" some call it. Which is fair.There are notorious quantities of hackers despite my encounter of only one over 400 hours.Such complaints can go on for days and many of them are valid.But the game is fun. That's the honest truth. It's a flawed product despite leaving early access I expect it will remain glitchy and laggy for the foreseeable future but the game remains fun. It's true that it can be slow and much of the round is. The first 5 minutes generally consist of scouring the area for any viable loot mostly with little to no items of real value found. And then the trek begins if you're unlucky with the spawn of the zone. In my experience 95% of the time it's on the opposite side of the map. It's infuriating. If you can't find a vehicle you're stuck running for several minutes hoping its enough to outrun the zone. When you finally make it you're sitting behind a tree and healing looking around for someone anyone who would ambush you. The landscape is barren devoid of life. And then as soon as you begin to move to the next zone a sniper bullet goes through your head. That's it. You're dead. All the time you spent looting running all that is gone to waste and you never saw a soul the whole game. So what do you do? Well you either quit in fury or you immediately start another game. I am of the latter. Immediately you can start doing it all over again.When you actually find an enemy it's a flurry of action. Suddenly having bullets whizz past your head from a suppressed gun in an unknown location is legitimately intimidating. Being caught in the open is a nightmare. Anyone could have the tactical advantage on you and you've got to find a way out or forward. The gunplay itself is not snappy and ultra responsive like Call of Duty or Battlefield. It's in many ways slow and clunky. You will wrestle with the insane recoil the sway of long range scopes and the drop and speed of bullets. Often it seems as if hits simply aren't registering or the person is an invincible hacker. But when you manage to defeat your attacker it's a small moment of exhilaration. That's what keeps me hooked on this game The feeling of victory. I feel so much satisfaction lining up a headshot on a far away foe with a Kar98k. The game is nominated in the steam awards for "Mom's Spaghetti" and I believe it's the only game not in the horror genre nominated. There's good reasoning for that. When it comes down to you and a few others in one tiny zone everything silent as everyone tries to spot each other it gets you shaky. There's a legitimate adrenaline rush in the gameplay unlike anything I've ever played. The sheer ecstasy in winning my first chicken dinner is one of the best moments I've had in gaming.The fact of the matter is Battlegrounds is a flawed game. From a matter of design its a mess. But what has made it the most played game on steam is the strength in the experience of actually playing. This game is simply fun to play from the quiet moments running through a forest to the roaring firefights in a city. It's the lowest of lows as you take loss after loss but the highest of highs when you claim victory. That's the experience of Battlegrounds not a perfect game but a damn good time.

review: Pubg.... Intense Social Aggravating Challenging and alot of fun. Is there buggs? YES are they enraging at times YES are they hillarious at times oh by god YES. Sometimes your motorbike gets sent into orbit after hitting an invisble pebble on the road. At first you might be mad but you laugh at it later. Sometimes you run into some guy named ChengLong who shoots you from across the map through a rock with an AWM he got from who knows where? But sometimes just sometimes you are in luck you get 15 kills you out play your opponents and at last you and your brothers/sisters in arms stands there with a the bright Yellow text saying Winner Winner Chicken Dinner and at that moment you are truly on top of the world.Now I got about 384 hours in this game and I'm still playing is it for everyone? No. But it is a good game by my standards despite its short comings. Now is it worth 30 euros yes I would say so especially if you have friends playing it. I do reccomend however that you have a HDD with high rpm or an SSD otherwise you might end up with a problem a friend of mine have that it takes forever for him to load in and sometimes he dosent even make it in. But if you have either I will say that the game has alot of replay value. It does not have a Singleplayer campaign you can play it as solo. It does not have a Multiplayer Campaign and you do require internet connection to play it. If you have read or seen anything about PUBG you would probably know this already but I'll mention it none the less.I hope this has been informative and if so see you in the battlegrounds and remember Memento Mori and show no Mercy

review: This is by far the most delicately crafted piece of sh**ty optimization I've ever seen in a game. I bought the game some months ago and the optimization was quite terrible and now it is just as crappy as before. As if there aren't enough glitches in game the developers seemingly thought "Hey let's include glitches "out game" as well!". The game is so problematic that it's instabilty even interferes with the Windows itself. While the game is open everything outside the game starts to act extremely sluggish and sometimes simply freezes. EVEN THE TASK MANAGER ITSELF. And the funny thing is that these problems supposedly occur when a internet browser is open. How come they made something that interferes with a browser I'll never get to know. I never encountered this problem in any other game whatsoever. And that just means that the programmers weren't thinking straight. We're in the year 2017 and yet developers still can't find a way to optimize a game? Did they code this game in Visual Studio 2010? Seems like they actually did it with "Brainfu**"(and yeah there is a programming language called like that). I don't care that everyone likes this game and claims that it is awesome and whatever I don't care that it made its way into eSports Gaming Events so quickly if one can't get the game properly working unless one satisfies some extremely odd and cryptic conditions then everything else is worthless. And don't come to me stating that my pc is crappy and I should buy a new pc or this game is still in beta stage and not fully completed. I can play most games made in this year without any problems (at least problems like this) but I can barely play this "particular" game. I wonder why? It doesn't help that I mostly suck at these kind of games but here there are just too many problems within this game. review: GUYs DONT LISTEN TO THE RECENT BAD REVIEWS. THEY ARE NOT DOWNVOTING THE GAME BECUASE OF THE GAME IT SELF. The game has come to a so high popularity stage that theese "critcs" have come. They are angry at the develops for many diffrent reasons. They find a single little thing they can attack the developers for so they have a reason to spread negativity in the community. so i a honest normal gamer will give you a reviewFor Casual gamers BUY THIS GAME. if you are not person thinking about rank and stuff you will absolutly love this game. The possibilities are endless. Yes the goal of a match is to get the sweet victory but you can also just do completely insane strats just for fun because noone is stopping you from it. You might think the game i filled up with proffesional gamers so you cant win it kinda is but it dosent really matter. The skill gap in this game is very low. you dont need to have top notch aim or inhuman reflexes to win. the recoil pattern on the guns are fairly simple and nearly everytime a player wins a game luck is also a big part of their victory. So you as a casual gamer also have the chance to get sweet winFor the Competitive gamers If you are in it for the win its kinda mixed if i should recommend it for you. If you have the spare money sure buy it but if theese 30 euro could have better use wait till the game is out of early accses. The game is way too buggy to have a fair and balanced score keeping system. I wouldent say im truly competitive but there i times where i have gone tryhard mode to get up in the ranks and then get killed simply because of the bugs in this game. Its frustrating but it dosent make the game bad. The Basics of this game are great. it has everything to make a fun addictive game. So i wouldent keep you from buying this game because of the bugs because it only happens sometimes. This game is hard to review for a cometitive gamer. Either you like it or you dont like it.

review: Player's Unknown's Battlegrounds is an amazing game but has some querks to it wichch i will tell you about shortly. First off i have over 200 Hours in this game and was not very keen on it at first but as i gradually played it more and more i started to enjoy it. The game it self at first had some bad performance issues which have seem to been fixed in a short amount of space due to the montly updates that the team does. The Comabt system is iffy as sometimes you can be fustrated by the your bullets going into to space for no apprent reason but the Comabt over all is good as it only takes a couple of shots to kill a person. There are two ways that you can play this game 1. either camp which i do not suggest since in ruins the fun out of the game or 2. constatly push people and hope that you can kill them. Most of the palyerbase are good palyers and they push but you come across some campers that just stay in the same place and can annoy you the the max because you dont know where they are. Speaking of the playerbase it has very few hackers on it which is a good as the team were very good in banning hackers from the get go. Loot is decent you can get some games with zero loot and just have to work your way around or you can get a game that has a ton of AR's are you are loaded with ammo and meds. The massive down side to this is that the safe zone seems unfair as when you are in the top 5 of people the zone seems to give an unfair advantge as it is not even for most players which helps the people in the zone to win the game the people outside the zone in the top 5 normally have to push and even then you are most likly going to get killed because of the people seeing you in the zone. With all this said it is a wonderful game to play 99% of the time and has many great things to come to it with the monthly updates and so forth i would 100% recommend this game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: So like everyone else coming to this game from H1Z1 is instantly a huge improvement. everything about this game already feels super nice and fluent. so far i have not run into any bugs that have caused any issues in game at all.Pros gameplay is fun lots of different guns and attachments you arent always going to get the best gun right away when you get kills you are rewareded has full leaderboards for singles duos and squads (something H1Z1 needs) cars work very nicecons poor optimization (the first update is going to start fixing this) graphics arent the best but im sure will be improved over time servers are slightly laggy at times due to game just launchingOverall i really dont have many complaints for this game as i know it just lauched only a little over 24 hours ago there really arent as many problems as some game lauches have had in the past. i hope the devs keep going with this game and continue to do what they are planning to do with it. i do not see myself stopping playing this game anytime soon!would reccomend this game for anyone looking for a battle royale style game it is going to be updated frequently and is coming in at a price point of only 30$!

review: I am a huge fan of PUBG you may not think that seeing I only have 50hrs logged at the time of writing this and I am writing this review because I like the game and the flaws need to be adressed as I want the game to be as great as possible but these flaws are holding it back. 1. Map Size. The new map aims to fix this issue. The two maps we have are too big therfore making gameplay feel alot slower and increasing game time turning off some people who do not have time to deticate like 30 minutes to a round just to die ( I am exagerating but the point remains) 2. FPS This has been mostly fixed but I think they could squeeze a few more frames out of the game. (Espescialy on Xbox One)3.Cheaters. you can ask many different people and they will say many different things about cheaters in PUBG I have encountered my share of cheaters and it is %100 not fun dealing with them in any Battle Royale game Alot of people complain about PUBG cheaters because the games Anti Cheat needs to be better to stop cheaters from well CHEATING! If I had to give the game a final verdict I would give it a 7/10Do I recommend you go buy this game att its full price of $36.99cnd yes I do just be aware of the issues. I also know Bluehole is not a freindly company to Epic Games in particular with the whole lawsuit and everything. I try to sperate artists from their work and not form my oppinion of the game until I have tried it and I quite like the game.

review: 1k+ hours and I can not recommend this game in this current state. Will I keep playing it? Yeah probably I'm a sucker for punishment. The game itself is fun simple even. Drop in get loot kill. Fight or hide your way to the number one spot for that tasty chicken dinner. The gunplay is satisfying (even with the rework to ballistics). Gunfights are intense. But the number one problem the game is facing right now? Blatant hackers. Might have to do with my ranking but I'm getting one pretty much every match. From blatant ESP instant heal/revives shooting THROUGH WALLS all the way to aimbots. It just never seems to end and is only seeming to get worse as we go on. (INB4 Xenophone) Most of these hackers seem to be chinese players as well. Which NORMALY wouldn't irk me so much seeing as I play on NA servers... but here's the thing the majority of NA games seemed to be utterly filled with Chinese players. Every.Single.Game. Every game I have joined for months now have been filled with chinese players mic spamming (CHYNA NUMBA WUN) or just have an open mic in some game cafe. Lets say they were not even cheating (crazy I know) they shouldn't be allowed to play on the servers just from the massive ping advantage they get. Too many things are client side in this game so the ping advantage they get from playing on NA servers is just frustrating at best. The amount of times I get shot from a player after I run behind cover is just disgusting and everytime it happens well what do you know... its a chinese player on the NA servers.I remember this game having a ping lock. Your ping goes to high? The game froze you in place and told you that your ping was too high. That has been removed you some odd reason. I get the the dev doesn't want to region lock their money making region (as scummy as that is) but really? Removing the ping lock? One of the smartest things they added to the game just gone. And why? Hell if I know.This game is going down the same path as H1Z1 and I have a feeling people will jump ship as soon as a competent developer tries their hand at the BR genre. I know I will. I love this game but the lack of action from the devs its slowly going to kill this game.To wrap this up it's a good idea of a game. Its fun at its best moments. Satisfying gunplay. But its broken buggy and has one of the worst hacker problems I have ever seen in a game. And with a either stubborn or inexperienced dev team I don't see this game lasting when some actual competition enters the genre.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Great gameplay experience moderately poor optimization. If you're interested in trying it out I definitely recommend it. Buyers with older systems beware however. They are (so far) continuing to push out patches and are continuing to plan and tease new content. Don't let the vocal minority sway you from at least trying this game it's a great BR experience. Definitely recommend trying it with friends as well definitely improves my experience. Overall Maybe one of my favorite games in a while albeit with frustrating moments with bugs and crashes. 3.5/5 rating in its current state if optimization increases and new content is continued to be rolled out then it could possibly be an amazing game.

review: amazeballsEDIT Amendment while this game is still incredible and has only gotten better with age (!!!) the server management is probably close to the worst I've seen. Let's not even talk about the fact that you literally can't even find servers to play on a lot of the times in your home county. NA is full probably 20% of the times I try to play at night. But even worst You will NOT find English speaking people in your NA server groups 99.9% of the time. In the last 40 games I haven't had a single one. Mind blowing. Further A LOT of the chinese players are just cheats or don't give a FU$% and will constantly throw games teamkill run off with their buddy etc..And now I hear the EA servers are also having terrible stuff like instead of better policing BlueHole is actually ADVERTISING game speed boosting VPN services for them...as if after buying the game and then seeing PAID ADS in a game you BOUGHT the next logical step would be BUYING a service that would make that game playable.Jesus. What a clusterFU#$. And what sucks is that it's either put up with it and watch the cancer spread or let a beautiful game die and wait another 1 2 years for a worthy replacement to be at its current level.I'm heartbroken and confused. It's a very love hate thing going on. I just really hope they get their together and make a 180 degree turn from the dark place they're moving towards before they end up like the next "The Culling".Hopefully I'll get another reason/chance to edit this again. Really hoping steamsalty I still recommend the game but only because of the faith I think BlueHole deserves here that they will course correct and fix these issues soon. Amen.

review: Pro + Battle Royale System is a nice game structure+ It is fun to play solo or with friends+ The amount of possible changes at every weapon is good+ Different weather settings+ Quite good optimization for better performance+ Frequently given updatesContra Weather settings like foggy and rainy does rise the difficulty a lot. Many bugs (But that's okay it's an Early Access game) Many cheaters many trollers (if you forget to disable Auto Matchmaking in Squad) No killcam (Would be nice to replay it to change your tactics and improve your playstyle) Laggy servers doesn't matter in which region. The Blue Zone Update was gamebreaking. If you jumped out at the other end of the map you can leave. Many low blue zone or house campers who just lay down at the border and wait in a bush like Gaddafi in his dirthole. The announced updates like the new map and Vaulting update come later than announced. This game has no VAC Status so Bluehole has to ban every cheater themself. They ban players for several reasons without giving evidence. (Kill a streamer and you'll get banned)Conclusion I think this game has great potential and it is on a good way. It is also fun to play but the contra points are really heavy sometimes so after one game you might lose the fun at it for a day. I hope Bluehole keeps developing the game as good as they done until now (except the Blue Zone Update) so the game will be one of the best in the Battle Royale genre.

review: This is the the second FPS shooter I've bought and played for any length of time. This feels realistic to me by bringing that fear factor along when you're hiding out in a wooded area thinking you're being stealthy and then BAM! Someone catches you slipping. You're off and running scrambling to find better cover and trying to figure out where the shots are coming from. BAM! You're hit again... you have to stop somewhere to heal but what you thought was better cover ISN"T. You keep running dodging bullets along the way. You take cover behind a rock. You heal as best you can you poke your head up to take in your surroundings and BAM! Headshot! No other game gives me this kind of excitement/frustration when I play.

review: This game has so much potential and I hope to change this to a positive review in the not too distant future the suspense is real and I find myself often holding my breath for what seems like minutes at a time. However even with a decently powerful computer and internet that shouldn't cause any issue the game's greatest foes are lag and framerates. Along with the framerate issues are brutal audio skips which feels like a heavy metal concert where every instrument is a helicopter with phantom skips and footprint sounds thrown in. Apart from optimisation woes I'd also love for the game to improve jumping mechanics as well as make it easier to discern where you're being shot from. It'd also be nice if spectactors could at least do a *little* something... maybe be able to pull up the map and navigate?

review: 95 people drop from a plane onto an island. You parachute to an area as far away from other people as you can but it's still uncomfortably close to a couple of other people (2 or 3) that you saw parachuting down nearby. You loot the first house or two (meaning you walk inside find a pistol and maybe a tactical vest and ammo laying in the middle of the floor in a pile). You go outside look around to be sure your friends haven't started closing in on you. You loot the next house (remember it's copy/paste pile in the middle of the floor). The game begins telling you that the playing area is shrinking and you have 2 minutes to get inside the new boundaries. You go outside happy with the amount of firearms/bandages/ammo/armor that you have and start making your way toward where the game is telling you the new zone is. Along the way you find a car. You get in the car and drive into a nearby micro town. Someone shoots at you. So you have a standoff on the edge of the town knowing that the person who was sniping at you will have to go to the new smaller zone at some point. He comes out armed with an sks and wearing underwear and an afro. You try to run him over and succeed taking a few hits to the car and some minor damage to your player. You hear gunshots nearby. You see that there are only 45 players remaining so you hurry to the middle of the new zone. You heal up with your bandages and prepare for the last bit of fighting. I mean there's half left so you're going to win right? You loot nearby structures carefully clearing them room by room. It's getting close to the finale now. There's 25 people left. You're stoked. You can see the magic blue boundaries for 360 degrees around you. So you're crouched down waiting licking your dorito stained lips in excitement for what is about to transpire. You see a small shack that is 2 stories high about 15 yards from you so you head that way. You carefully ascend the stairs and clear the room no loot. You go to open the bathro BAM BAM BAM BAM. You're dead cause someone was camping in there and you nearly sh*t your pants and your computer chair. Go back to lobby and queue for another game. 95 people drop from a plane onto an island. review: A blatant rip off of H1Z1 that is buggy full of cheaters and generally an unfun game. The game has managed to hit a bandwagon of hype that it doesn't deserve. Playing with a group of friends lends moments of humor but that is more laughing at the horrible physics and the obvious cheaters rather than actually enjoying the game itself.Add on to that the developers refusing to make regional servers (so rubber banding and lag related issues will forever plague the game) and PUBG shows that it has no ability or hope to become an actually enjoyable game.Edit After attempting to return the game due to technical issues I was refused twice from Valve. Please avoid this game at any cost!
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: GOOD
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: EDIT Alright. It didn't even take me 10 games with my new computer to win. Twice. I can finally see the difference between players and bushes from a distance. Aiming is easier as you don't have those pesky mini spikes anymore and opening/closing doors way are more consistent.I've also got more control over where my enemies are judging by the sound they make. I'm also pretty sure I can spot players from way further away though this might just be my imagination. But all in all the game still feels the same but it's a LOT more pleasant to play with a high end computer for sure. PRE EDIT The game's pretty fun. Requires skill luck patience and general knowledge about the game. Fun to play with friends but if you have an old computer this game will screw you over most times. It will lag as hell during the parashoot phase even simple tasks like opening doors will show to be a challenge. You can get glitched and stuck in doors under stairs or similar things. You can't spot players far away because the field of vision just doesn't reach that far with your currenct specs and optimalization. Even when every setting but Field of Vision is put on the lowest setting. I ended up spending over $3750 on a brand new high end computer for this game. I might update this review if I see drastic changes in FPS drops lag and/or screen tearing and other crucial gameplay changes. Because I would not recommend this game if it requires you to have a high end computer to play it properly. That is just not acceptable in my opinion.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I'm thoroughly enjoying this game and I have been for a while. I think the devs listen to the community but have selective hearing. "you want new guns? you got it." "you want us to fix the bikes to not be wonky and throw you off because you hit a pebble? That seems like a lot of work." The devs haven't been shown to put in as much work as this game needs. The servers are a mess the guns mechanics are inconsistent the bikes are the most enjoyable vehicle in the game but the shocks are near nonexistent they'll throw you off and instakill you for absolutely nothing even when you're only going about 10kmh. I will continue to play this game but mainly because I have nothing better to do. The desync is intense and now it's putting me in Asia? I live on the east coast for god sakes. It didn't always do this. I'm tired of the game but sadly I continue to play it. i don't recommend the game in its current state. I think it needs a serious amount of work.

review: Fortnite is just more complete compared to this game. This game is more based on luck with the circles then actual skill. In Fortnite you can out build the opponent in most if not all situations when they don't grasp that element of the game. Fortnite is also more satisfying because you see alot more people in the games and they go by faster. PUBG just seems to be a waste of time when you don't see anyone for like 30 minutes then get sprayed down from nowhere. Trust me I have the aim from 1600 hours of cs to be able to kill some oppnents but the long games don't make playing worth it. The game also gets terrible framerates still. On my 1070Ti I get around 80fps on lowest with textures high whilst fortnite gets 300 on the same settings. It's unbelievable how they can't optimize a game like this... its astonishing how much the devs don't give two s about the game and don't even try at all like AT ALL. They just don't try at all to compete with the opposing game... They are losing hard in the battle that's for sure.

review: I think this game is great. Of course there are bugs but every game is going to have bugs so stop ya in. This game is hard in general so it makes it worth my while to want to get better. Your going to need a decent pc to run this game as mine runs 60 fps with a gtx 970 gpu and a i7 8700k cpu. This game should not deserve the amount of hate it gets considering that most of the negative reviews I see are Fortnite fan boys but thats besides the point the game has great loot spawn rates (except for miramar can't find a gun to save my life) the shooting is great but people say it's bad due to them not knowing that recoil is a thing kills feel very satisfying not like a run n gun like cod where another kill doesn't feel special and the way games roll out is insanely fun because hearing someones footsteps in my building scares the out of me and makes me feel like my life is on the line like a real gun fight would be like. I think this game is amazing and you should definently pick it up if you haven't already there will be bad momenets but know that everyone is going to die so it shouldn't tilt you but it happens. I rest my case.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

You'll spend the first 5 8 min looting and the next 10 15 min carefully moving through the map hopefully doing a handful of 2 5 second adrenaline pumping shootouts. review: Theres two major things that I think need to be changed to make this a great game. The first is optimization. While being much better then what it was in early access there's still a lot that needs to be done. The second is the removal of keys for unlocking crates you had already unlocked by playing. If you're going to add a reward system let it actually be rewarding instead of charging you to unlock what you had earned. Overall I still recommend this game unless the devs keep ignoring these major issues. But it seems like they're making very small steps in the right direction.

review: So I bought the game and played it some hours. I thought I would get some action but here I am going in a house to get shotgun blasted by the guy that was camping behind the door. Not to mention that shotguns in this game have the range of a sniper. The game is slow paced glitchy camper infested and crashes after every other match.A lot of times my character freezes during a battle or I get stuck on switching weapons. If you happen to be in a match where all of the above don't take place then maybe you'll get some fun out of it. In general it is the most horrible unoptimised thing I have ever experienced.

review: Another game with Devs that say they will deliver on promise but fail to do so in spectacular fashion. Launced into 1.0 PC Launch and honestly this game doesn't feel any ing different in fact it feels worse. Optimization is still flat out garbage with horrible frame drops everywhere and some of the worst stuttering and lag in a game. In a game where it's one and done it's pretty pathetic to see no improvements found on the optimization side. Devs said the new map would be focused on close quarter combat and faster gameplay. What do the devs do in response? They make a new map that's even bigger then the first map (wtf?). This is my main issue with PUBG is that is just beyond ing boring anymore. You land hot and the game lags/stutters like crazy so you die so quick or you land safe gear up for 30 40mins only to die within the first engagement you see. I used to enjoy this game a lot but now it's just pathetic and nothing has been done to improve the game besides vaulting (which should have been in the game). I want to see things change and for the better after playing this game so much but instead we are just getting a mediocre game with some of the most boring and continous downtime I've seen in any game ever.If you're in need of sleep and don't have any Nyquil throw on some PUBG because this is the perfect sleeper agent. this game and these garbage devs with all these t lies and committments that are just following in the footsteps of how not to be a developer ala H1Z1.

review: This is a really fun game to play especially with friends. For me personally it's not really my main game since it doesn't really have any rewarding ranking system that keeps you motivated to play competitive. But the benefit with the game is that you can do both. For the people that not cares about levels or flashy borders etc you can tryhard to get that Top "x" per region or you could play more chill games with friends and have really enjoyable times playing. The downpart of the game is that it's very demanding which can be annoying for the people that not has 2000$ PC's since Ultra on some settings are necesarry if you want to play competitive. But overall I'd defenetly recommend buying the game!

review: This game continuously offers great fun with friends adrenaline fueled firefights and endless playability. That is of course if it actually manages to load in your textures not lag or crash and not disconnect you mid game. Blue Hole was supposed to fix many of these issues this patch but instead of making sure it worked well they rushed to charge us for crates and keys. I have always been unable to recommend this game to most people solely on the fact that my computer that can easily run Witcher 3 on Ultra oftentimes struggles to process this game due to memory leakage. 7 8 gb at a time to run this game at it's lowest settings which could be fixed if the devs didn't get so greedy.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS
