EDIT decided to give squads in NA another try today with some friends. SPOILER. there was a hacker in the first (and only) game we played.I think Valve and VAC fight hacks better than this garbage of a game. EDIT #2 Dec 11 died to hackers. multiple in 1 game.make this game region locked so the chinese filth cant play on NA servers.EDIT #3 "1.0" and still dying to the communist scum. review: I honestly played a limited amount of this game before requesting a refund the third game I have ever done so with. The servers lag and cause inconsistencies Damage seemed to be far from consitent gunplay is clunky and often makes absolutely no sense A shotgun point blank to the head won't kill sometimes but will decimate others. That being said the game wasn't terribly non fun it just wore on me quickly the little pleasure of winning a gunfight suddenly would be eclipsed by the end of match death where the kill cam shows almost a dozen rounds of which you heard or saw none and it shows a location you had left a full three minutes before. All in all A potentially fun game that is held back by terrible servers bad gunplay and an overall rather boring frustrating experience.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: As of 22 of Febuary 2018 they have actually managed to break the game even more than it previously was. Stuttering is now apparent all through out EVERY match and apparently I'm not the only one. 3570k 4.20 Ghz with 16GB RAM and 970 GTX was previously running perfectly with my settings. I made a mistake installing this game again as it seems no updates pushed to it NEVER had any game testing prior to public release. I sincerely hope you ed yourself over so bad that players will not be comming back this time Bluehole. You do not deserve the hype this game has gotten nor the players it has attracted. Brendan Greene go die in a ing fire.

review: Okay. I love the concept although it definitely needs some tweaking here and there. I picked up this game because it was on sale despite all of the negative reviews. I thought hell they may just have a poor system or a crappy connection. Well I have neither of those things and I get the same issues they were talking aboutMy connection speed is 25MB/s I dont have lag spikes on any other game of which are many and they are mostly pretty demanding. Yet on PUBG if I'm within 40ft of another player and I'm not standing perfectly still my framerate drops to unplayable. I dont really get the issue otherwise just around other players...of course the worst possible time to be having those issues. They need to figure out how to fix that issue.

review: So honestly guys this game is amazing. The devs are putting a lot of work into it and it just keeps getting better and better. All the negative reviews are from stream snipers. Regardless of whose side you take on this (streamers or stream snipers) the official rules of the game state that stream sniping is cheating so I'm not really sure what the counter argument could possibly be for this? That would be like if the rules of Monopoly state that you can't just take your opponents money you do it anyway and then get really mad when they don't want to play Monopoly with you anymore.I have just shy of 300 hours in it and I love it. The game is hard heavily skill and position based. It also takes a little bit of luck. Buy this game if you haven't already (though you probably already have).

WIll update later.Reasons I like PUBG (my opinions) Currently best game of its genre (Battle Royale) First person only mode (I don't like 3rd person shooters) Matchmaking is instant 100 player games fill in seconds Being able to trade or sell loot boxes on steam market Updates are constantly fixing and improving things Despite its shortcomings PUBG is still very fun to play with friendsReasons why I'm currently giving the game a downvote (my opinions) Developers banning people for "stream sniping" is disgusting Developers banning people for completely justified friendly fire is disgusting Developers banning people for "exploits" in an early access game is disgusting There's still an enormous number of gamebreaking bugs Overall gameplay still feels incredibly clunky Looting is still headache inducing and feels really bad most of the time Vehicles can still glitch out and kill you for no reason Netcode and hit detection aren't great and I don't think they can ever completely fix that Horribly unoptimized (I can run it just fine but most of friends cannot) Melee is still a sick jokeI don't regret my purchase (especially because I made most of my money back already by selling loot) but at $30 PUBG is a shakey recommendation at best. This is one of those games that feels like absolute trash but you put up with because it has some really good moments. There's a lot of downtime where you're just walking or looting but each time you win a match it's such an exhillirating feel. Overall I wouldn't recommend this to anyone in its current state unless you've got a group of friends to play with because it's just way too rough around the edges and the developers have been making some terrible decisions lately with the player bans and policy changes.

review: This game was pretty glitchy with the flashbang crashes and aweful server lag when it first came out and they have done a great job fixing all of that. Recently though with their severe cutting down on the availability of loot the game is For my last 11 games I drop down somewhere with other people and I can search a whole floor at the military base and not find anything better than a crowbar so of course I get instantly killed by someone else that already found a gun. I am pretty decent at this game and have won many times but when they are lowering my chances of getting any kind of gun within the first two minutes it just ruins the game and turns it into another RNG horror fest. Yeah I get reducing the number of ARs while also increasing the number of Uzi's and pistols but shrinking the entire loot pool is a horrible mistake at this part. If I want to play a game based off of RNG t I'll go play slots at the casino.

I hope they can fix most of the stuff and adress the mess they have with the hackers on NA server. Otherwise I'm done with it2/1/18 Ater all the recent updates the game is feeling better the lag on the beggining is less noticiable and the game plays out pretty good. I will get some lag while in game from time to time but nothing compare to before. One thing I hate is that the new map come on 90% of time when you start matchmaking and it is really boring to play on it becuase you know the match will last around 30 40 min or longer.

review: You know there's a lot of games that get a lot of hype. Some of those games really just don't live up to expectations and others well others go above and beyond. PUBG is definitely a game that soars above expectations and really delivers an amazing multiplayer experience. PUBG really puts a new twist on shooter combat and creates an intense drive for players to survive down to the last man. And yes before you ask there are single duo and 4 player ques available. PUBG doesn't force you to play with random strangers if you don't WANT to play with random strangers they even let you choose to only hear your squad's voicechat if you so wish! There's also a ranking system but instead of making the game more stressful it only drives the player to succeed. You can approach the game with stealthy slow tactics or just run in willy nilly and try to take all the enemies down with you. This game offers a genuinely enjoyable multiplayer experience whether you enjoy tactics or chaos playing on your own or working on a team FPS combat or third person shooter combat playing casually or hardcore. Anyone who knows me well knows that I don't say this often but this game is totally worth paying full price for.

The game also seems to have a built in store for cosmetics. Modding support would be better but at least it's just cosmetics.Bobtheburrito purchased this game for me.http //steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id 936903648

review: Absolutely THE BEST Battle Royale game that I've played and I've played most of them H1Z1 Culling etc.OVERALL 9.5/10DEFINITELY RECOMMEND.PROS + Graphics are phenomenal. The sunrays the lighting its all just perfect. The depth of field and the blur is enough to make it tastefuly instsead of nauseating. (NOTE Shadows can be a bit dark game needs a flashlight)+ The animations are SMOOTH as Can get a bit wonky sometimes but for the majority its easy to move in and out of houses pretty quickly.+ The sound is fantastic. The gun shot sounds are to die for (heh.. heh) like the way you shoot into a quiet area and you can hear your shot ringing out and echoing around you. Since there's no real in game music the silence can be quite intense sometimes. Especially when you hear footsteps in the building you're in.+ YOUR GUNS HAVE COLLISION. This is a bit of both a good and bad thing. When you face a wall you won't be able to pull your gun up to aim. But if you're in a position where there's a lot of physical objects/map assets in front of you you'll start to spazz out until you aim down or don't.+ Vehicles. There's 4 vehicles to choose from Buggy UAZ Motorcycle Car and they all drive pretty well for the most part. The vehicle physics can be real fun when you get the hang of it.CONS The hit detection is a bit Shot someone at least 5 or 6 times with a SCAR L and they lived enough to kill me. Some weapons are a little TOO inaccurate such as the SCAR L with an 8x on it and the AWM seems to be a bit off too though I may need to just adjust the sights. Getting run over by your own vehicle due to lag. Sometimes when bailing from a car the game will lag and I'll somehow end up underneath it and get killed. Has happened to me at least 3 times now. Have to restart the game every 4 or so games because after a while the performance begins to degrade. Still has a lot of optimization issues which has resulted in my ultimate death on much more than 1 occassion.OVERALL 9.5/10DEFINITELY RECOMMEND.

review: Game is pretty fun when it all works. I watch streamers play it pretty often and a lot of times they get killed they write the name down to get the guy who killed them banned because they assume it's stream sniping like 40% of the time. Sometimes you'll be fighting someone so you go behind cover and die behind cover because of desynch (in their game you weren't behind cover so they were able to shoot you even though in your game you appeared to already be behind cover) and that's stupid. I've walked into a bathroom saw a guy with a shotgun sitting in a corner got shot once backed out into the first room I was in and died from a second blast from the shotgun guy in a completely different room. But I guess it being in Early Access is their excuse for any bugs.I mean look at The Culling. It's had an alright following went in decline and then threw it's fan base out the window all while in Early Access which they're still in a year and a half later. It's an okay excuse for bugs I guess but it can't save you from being labeled a bad game.That being said PubG is fun and it appears that the devs are listening to the fan base in a much more productive way than the Culling devs which is great. And I assume desynch will always be somewhat of an issue with 100 player matches. All in all I guess I'd say buy it because it's fun but don't expect the best game ever.

review: Review based on current build as of 21/12/17.Now then What to say about this game. I think it has gained an insane amount of popularity which is hard to deny. I think that it has spent far too little time being worked on in 'Early Access'. The popularity burst has caused the Devs to implusivly update the game to a full release. I don't think this should've been done as there are a lot of tiny details and large details that have been ignored and instead main aspects of the game have been adressed and simplified for a console release I feel. One main example of the little things being ignored is in a sense a big thing but the servers being the backbone of the game and what we all use to play it with or without friends. Considering that factor I feel they have cheaped out on servers massivly. From someone that has worked for some of the biggest server companies in the UK I can say with confidence the hardware on their servers is lacking. I understand they're running 100 people per session and multiple sessions on one server. But bare in mind this company made hundreds of millions in their first few weeks of release. So where has that money gone? Not the servers. So far out of the new update I have played 5 games. 4/5 of those games I played I died to lag. Lag being an instance where I have been unable to move because I keep getting rubber banded backwards and other players are for some reason uneffected and by the time I am able to pickup and reload a gun I am already dead. They did try to address this issue by adding a ping cap. But that ping cap was only set to 200 really meaning little to no difference. Considering from the UK I can get a ping of under 200 playing on West coast US servers. So utterly useless. I think they have underestimated what their servers can handle. Because they keep adding features to the game and making things work smoother for clients but ultimatly not allowing the servers hardware room for these increased amount of features. I still stand by my previous review. I also stand by a none recommendation of this game. That is after 300+ hours of gameplay. I do admit I am not the best player in the world. But I am certainly not the worst. So there it is.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: The game is amazing in that way that you feel like you're playing a really great mod for a game that was ideal for it. Things are a little broken graphics are a bit routine and gameplay is certainly rote at this point but it doesn't matter because it works for what the game is.If you haven't played or read about it (which would bring me to wonder how you got here) this is a custom designed version of the Battle Royale/Hunger Games mods for other games. 99 people drop onto a map and find weapons/armour and last person standing wins. The map shrinks with magic blue fairy dust slowly killing anyout outside the designated area and there are random bombing areas to liven things up.I'm recommending this because I think it's a great game for just about anyone. Matches aren't too long so if you're an adult with responsibility you can play a quick round and set it aside and if you're a kid without anything you need to do there is plenty of room to replay and master the game. With the various rules and systems there's a bit of luck involved. In spite of having played only a handful of these military tactic convoluted control type shooters I was able to come in 3rd in onebof my first matches. I was lucky and happened tobplop into the right place and laid on the ground until somebody found me. I think that's great because it gives anyone a chance...othwrs may hate that their supreme talent loses to a lucky drop.Finally this is in early access so I'm hoping they adjust but when I created my character originally there was just a whole lotta white skin to choose from. There are arguments to be made for the ability to blend in with surroundings being a concern with this but for a game which offers clothing options in loot boxes...I think the ability for everyone to create an avatar which represents themselves could be added.That said it's an amazing game.

review: DISCLAMER (my spelling isnt the best sorry for any problems but please still read! also im not defending either game im just listing the Pros and Cons.) This game is a jem. Amazing gameplay and the guns feel nice to use. The game can use some optamazation but other then that it is a amazing game. It will give you a adernalin rush that H1Z1 cant give you. I made a post on a comment comparing the two games so i dont wanna re type all of that so here is the basics of what i said.H1Z1*fun sometimes *better optamazation *Unblanced guns *You have to grind your life away to get anything for your character.*Overuse of the shotgun since it can mostly one hit from any length. *the overuse of players useing head shots. (no really its insane. With a hand gun from across a open field? come on.)*no use of tactics at all its just run and gun*the Devs do not give a about the game.*slowly dying player base. Battlegrounds*Blanced guns *better gameply *Gunshots matter (meaning if the gunshot is close someone is near if its soft and far away people are far away. Same thing when rounds hot the ground next to you.)*muzzle flash matters (players can see it if they take they time and look for a shooter.) *you dont have to grind you life away to get stuff for you charater. *Yes there is not the best optamazation at the moment. The Devs are Activily fixing this. *A litter higher learning curve then H1Z1. It makes it a litter harder at first.*You can add atachments to your gun in game. *map is good easy to learn.*to win it really helps to use tactics. *the Devs are still working on the game and seem to love the game. Thats about all there is. Again sorry for my grammer and spelling.

review: I consider my PC to be decent 8 gigs ram GTX 860m video card. I know it isn't top of the line but it runs fairly well. I also know this is a pre release game and I shouldn't expect much optimization but I have to say this was a far less than stellar experience. I started the game with high detail it immediately loaded &gt 4 gigs of data into my ram and used all the disk space (I'm assuming this was just VRAM). I then settled for Low as Medium detail gave me horrible input lag. Finally I got into a game found a gun and pressed tab to open a menu. The game then crashed and I was informed I needed to install .NET 3.0 runtime. For the life of me I don't understand 1. Why .NET runtime is necessary to run a video game and 2. why these necessary files weren't Included on installation. I was really looking forward to this game but this turned me off for good. that noise.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: The circle moves way too fast about 1.5x the speed of sprinting (at its slowest) and the servers are not good enough to handle 100 players. Towns bring you down to &lt 20 fps no matter your system and the game runs at about 30 fps unless you spend over $2000 on a pc. Because of the laggy servers combat early in the game is extremely laggy and it is completely random if you will win the fight because of lag. Some players will shoot you through walls because you are outside the house on their screen.Don't fall for the early access bait and don't buy the game it will save you a lot of time and rage.EDIT Game has updated but nothing was changed. The circle moves waayyy too fast still and the game is entirely luck based and requires no skill. I have since gone about 5 games in a row only being able to find SMGs and shotguns(Recently only pistols with 1 2 mags max). The last game I played before giving up I had level 3 armor with an AK and was 2 shotted by a UMP. Can't play the game without getting the server side "Network lag" that can last from a few seconds to about 10 minutes stopping the entire round. Cancer.3/26/2018 EDIT I have tried to play this game twice in the span of 2 weeks and both times the servers were down I can't even play the game I paid $30 for.

review: It's a really fun game taht you can spend hours on end playing especially with friends. Running around trying to get to the border can be boring but once you're in a fight it gets really fun. Sometimes I don't even bother fighting I just grab a motorcycle and screw around. But this game does have problems. First of all the vehicle physics are crazy and unpredictable especially motorcycles (you can do a flip and crush your head and take no damage but hit a pebble and die). Another problem is if you are doing good and get to the top 15 ish you'll just get die from somebody who found a sniper rifle and got to the zone way before anyone knew where it was gonna end which makes the game kinda unfun. It didn't used to be like that and I did fairly well back then but now I havn't won in a long time. If sniper rifles were way more rare and not lasers then it might be a bit more balanced. My final problem with the game is that its damn near impossible to figure out where you're getting shot from unless they're out in the open and 1 You have a 7.1 surround sound headset (which thankfully I do) 2 There's no other noise at all 3 They keep shooting without moving and 4 They're close enough so that you can see them without a 8x scope which are extremely rare. But all in all it's a quite fun game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I have nearly 115 hours and it's time to make a review.PUBG to me is like that perfect balance between an ARMA game and a game like H1Z1. It has that tactical and survival part from ARMA then spiced a little up with some stuff from games like H1Z1. ARMA II is by far one of my favourite games to date so being able to play a game like PUBG that has some of the same aspects as ARMA is amazing.I can nothing but recommed this game but then again at this point I think we all have it(I even own 2 copies) of course the game has it's flaws like any game does.The thrill and the overall experience of being top 10 makes this game so unique feeling your heart pumping faster and faster as people get picked of one by one is one of the greatest feelings in the world and then the storm calms down when you finally get that sweet marinated chicken dinner.Me and many of my friends cannot wait to see what devs and future modders have in store for us I'm mostly hoping for an survival mode or do i dare say an DayZ like mode o Just buy it already. mDriveUnit

review: I reccomend this game for people who enjoy survival games and multiplayer. Once you get the hang of the basic movement the rest is pretty self explanatory. The controls are a little bit different from your basic shooters but after a few games i pretty much got it down. The load times are fast and i didnt expierence much lag. The clothing and cosmetics were a bit basic but they are probably going to add more items. With the new mode "First Person Only" this will make the game more diverse and probably appeal to a wider audience. Keep in mind that this game is in early access and has not been finished so most of what i have said might change in the future with the upincoming updatesScore 85%

review: While I have overall enjoyed the game I cannot recommend it at this time. For a company worth approximately 4 billion I would expect you to focus on optimization physics (vehicles and weapons) and server support instead of a new gun with a different skin paid loot crates and banning these "apparent stream snipers".Things that need to be fixed Optimization. I guess that is what we get when the assests are similar to those that are available for free on Unreal Engine and Unity. Bugs/glitches/rendering Tons of problems with building rendering/other assests. Fix these first instead of pushing for more unoptimized content Servers low tick rate and dsync problems. You can shoot someone standing still 6 7 times with the m16 see blood each hit and they turn around and 1 shot you. Hackers There has been a huge increase lately. I have seen people running as fast as a vehicle killing people while they go. Solution HARDWARE BAN THEM and take legal action against those who make the cheat client. Look at how Gears of War 4 encrypts their files so they cannot be accessed. You don't hear about people cheating in that game. Physics If I am shooting out of a vehicle window there is no reason I should knock out the person in the driver seat if I am in the back seat shooting away from them.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I dont understand where all the hate comes from this game not running. I get 50 to 80 fps (on high presets) consistently and not encountered a single game breaking error other than the audio being a little wonkie. Devs communicate what their plans are frequently. and have regualry updated the game. So far so good would run over myself again first time getting out of vehichle before stooping!SpecsGtx 1070 fei5 6600k overclocked 4.0 ghz16 gbs ddr4 ram 2400 mhz850 watt power supplyAsus hero maximus viiiUpdated ReviewAfter sinking many hours into this game i can see that it is going places but they need to tweak some thing along the way 7+ chest shots from less the 50 meters away should kill a player no matter what armor lvl they have with a fully decked out scar L. The audio is still utter garbage. And last but not least people are able to one shot head shot me with a ump from god knows where while my lvl 3 helmet does nothing in the way of protection.Updated Again Vaulting

review: By far the best battle royal game I have played. Less arcadey then h1 but less tectical then arma. It's got that perfect balance. Gun play feels great and looting is easy and rewarding. Game is a little dodgy right now because of servers and optimization but that will get fixed over time. I'm on a 970 and frames range from 45 70 depending on what I'm looking at. If you're the type to cry about a game not being perfect then don't pick it up yet. But if you arn't this is a great game.

review: Not much to say about the game but heres a recipe for Chinese Chicken Fried RiceIngredients Needed 1/2 tablespoon sesame oil 1 onion 1 1/2 pounds cooked cubed chicken meat 2 tablespoons soy sauce 2 large carrots diced 2 stalks celery chopped 1 large red bell pepper diced 3/4 cup fresh pea pods halved 1/2 large green bell pepper diced 6 cups cooked white rice 2 eggs 1/3 cup soy sauce Prep 25 m Cook 15 m Ready In 40 m Steps 1.)Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and saute until soft then add chicken and 2 tablespoons soy sauce and stir fry for 5 to 6 minutes. 2.)Stir in carrots celery red bell pepper pea pods and green bell pepper and stir fry another 5 minutes. Then add rice and stir thoroughly. 3.)Finally stir in scrambled eggs and 1/3 cup soy sauce heat through and serve hot.

review: INGREDIENTS3/4 cup plain breadcrumbs3/4 cup grated Parmesan cheeseKraft Grated Cheese 100% ParmesanBuy 1 Get 1 50% Off thru 07/29 8 chicken cutlets (about 1 1/2 pounds total) or 4 boneless skinless chicken breasts halved horizontallySalt and freshly ground pepper1 large egg lightly beaten2 cups jarred tomato sauce or Easy Chunky Tomato Sauce1/4 cup olive oil6 ounces mozzarella cheese preferably fresh cut into eight 1/4 inch thick slicesDIRECTIONSHeat broiler. Combine breadcrumbs and Parmesan in a shallow bowl. Season both sides of chicken with 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Dip chicken in the beaten egg then dredge in breadcrumb mixture turning to coat both sides.Spread tomato sauce onto the bottom of a 10 by 15 inch baking dish. Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Place 4 chicken cutlets in skillet cook until golden 1 to 2 minutes on each side. Using a spatula transfer browned cutlets to baking dish placing them on top of sauce. Repeat with remaining oil and cutlets.Top each cutlet with a slice of mozzarella. Broil about 4 inches from heat source until sauce is hot and cheese is melted and lightly browned in spots 5 to 8 minutes. Serve immediately.

review: PUBG is special in how thorough and well developed the gameplay is. But technologically it does not hold up. Poorly optimized and becomes stale after a few rounds. I run graphically intensive games such as Witcher 3 at 60 fps yet get extreme stutter and fps dips below 30 with PUBG. It was awful. Even on medium graphics the stutter and delay makes the game frustrating and unresponsive. Also after four rounds I started realizing how limited the game experience is with only one map. The map is large but on it's own offers little diversity and becomes familiar fast. Can't recommend this at all but will keep an eye out for future updates and optimization.

review: The game is very good and fun to play with friends. It has a very good anticheat and the map is big and fun to explore. The servers are very good. I play on EU server. It is fast and easy to play with friends when you invite theam they join the lobby instantly. There are some bugs It is not big bugs its a big map and it will always be some bugs there. I think this game has a good future becuse it is the most played game on steam right now. The reason it is so many negativ recently i think is becuse in the game is so big so many players who get banned for cheating for example get very angry becuse the anti cheat is very good in this game. In this game you are about 100 player that jump from an airplane. On the airplane you can jump when you want and plan where you want to land with your parachute. When you have landed you want to find fast guns and other items so you can kill many players or win the game. The playarea will get smaller and smaller over time in the end the last players meet in the middle of the white circle. The player that is the last player wins the game.

review: Just played a game of Squad Match and after crossing the safe zone and waiting to move to a new position in the circle i saw two people jumping off their moto bike. I thought this will be easy to deal with but only to see four more people in another car park next to them and all jump out. My first thought 'they're going to kill each other yay'! but no as i saw them all run after me. six people i counted in a game of four v four. I honestly think PUBG is the psycho ex gf that can't get over Fortnite even though Fortnite has clearly moved on so PUBG texts all of their friends about some gossip no one cares about and blames them for everything wrong with world. If you can't handle competition don't be a producer in the market. I mean did you really think that you would have a monopoly on the TYPE of game? There's a movie called Hunger Games btw its VERY similar to this if you really think your supposed feud with Fortnite wasn't enough. Get over the fact that Fortnite made huge strides to make themselves different and more popular (because their game is somewhat playable compared to PUBG) and look at how you're copying CSGO with the weapons and equiptment skin system instead of making a game that YOU KNOW PEOPLE CAN NO LONGER PLAY BECAUSE THE SERVERS ARE SUCH TRASH!!!In fact it even took months of updates just to get rid of SOME of the hackers. It's like they dont read their reviews and take their jobs seriously because the community is trying to tell them what's wrong. But clearly throwing a hissy fit towards Fortnite/any competition (funny becaused they loved everyone else's ideas to use for themselves) is too important to these soap opera actresses. review: I have very much enjoyed this game for the rather short time i have played it. in the 3 or 4 matches i've played i never experienced major lag my computer runs it at a very smooth 60fps with max graphics so i haven't had issues with the game running badly either. I have seen only one cheater and have had no issues with really anything that i hear people complaining about. I am glad i bought this game instead of just avoiding it like many reviews said.Yes this game is still in early access but it plays better than any early access game i have played previously. I can see this game getting kind of old quickly if you just play it one match after another but if you space it out (and have a friend or two to play with) This is an great title and i can't wait to see everything that will be added in the future.

review: Here's the thing about this game it's a great game idea in it's current form even if the whole battle royale mode isn't. That's it though it's just the same battle royale over and over and over and over with nothing but some stats to show for all the time you put into it. Cosmetic clothes that don't do anything for you as you must find all your gear on the map. Now with friends it can be an enjoyable experience but only if you don't get picked off early and have to spend the next 20 mins being your teams eyes in the back of their heads. Solo I do not find at all enjoyable. There is nobody to get you back up. I know I suck compared to most people that only play PVP shooters but when solo and I'm waiting in ambush behind a chair in a room and somebody else can run into my room and headshot before I can even get a shot off is total ttery! The game is fun for it's idea but with only 1 map (another being added soon) or even with the upcoming 2 maps it's still the same over and over with no tangible rewards to speak of. Added with the horrendous performance this game runs at given my system specs It's just not the game for me. Some people like games where you're constantly spinning around twitching the out I just don't. There are other games out there I can get more enjoyment from that just reward me better. My opinion is to stay away for now. If you are a masochist you're gonna do it anyway because it's all you hear these days. I own it I'll let it develop more before I make a really serious final review.

review: WORST GAME I'VE BOUGHT IN 2017 !!!Cool and fun idea on paper but the reality is way more depressing...Unless your computer is amazing and worth a few grands you'll have to lower the graphics and the game will look like it feels like playing a 2005 game on PS2.The game in itself is quite frustrating you spend half an hour looting everything you can and maybe killing a few people before getting one shot from someone you can't see. But the thousands of bugs and glitches make it even more frustrating I can't even begin to list the number of times I was flabbergasted by how bugged the game was. And do you think the developers are trying to fix the bugs and improve the game ?? Well you're 100% wrong they'd rather spend their time finding a new way to ruin the game add some fog on the map so everyone is lagging even more and can't see a damn thing... This is truly a pathetic way to launch a game try and improve the beta and release the game for real before ruining it with this kind of update.The worst part is that it is actually quite addictive so you'll end up playing a lot even though you hate it.The real question is "why was this beta released for 30 euros rather than be free and help the developers improve the game before it could actually be released without looking like a scam ???"PLEASE don't buy it even if your friends pressure you into doing it !! If you really want to play PUBG wait until they fix this broken game and release it for real.

review: Okay after 700+ HRS of gameplay here's my take on the game.It's fun. Really fun. If you got 30 dollars and some decent knowledge of FPS gunplay go ahead and do yourself a favor and buy this game.This game has given me so many moments of pure joy adrenaline anger commitment excitement basically everything. I don't think I've ever gotten bored and the new content in every update every couple of weeks to a month make it really exciting. With the new 4x4 map that I have tried coming up I only see prosperity in PUBG's future. You can see the devs actively interact with the community at r/pubattlegrounds and they listen to us. They fix almost everything the community complains about.The gunplay is amazing with so many modifications to weapons I haven't even tried every combination for every gun which could be a good/bad thing on how you place it. With a confirmed shooting practice range on the way players will have an even chance to practice and get better.Holy crap does this game get fun. I've met many friends from all around the world who play this game. They can also testify the greatness of this game.If you've got the money buy it. If you don't save up. If money is a big issue for you in a couple of months you can get your cash back from selling the free crates you earn for playing games. I myself have profitted 200 dollars from opening them by pure luck. Won't garuntee the same for you.Try it. You won't regret it. It's really fun.

Pubg is a really good game. many updates and options to play. skins were also added a while back. Skins in pubg is really good and depends on your luck and money. review: I Highly Reccommend this game. Though very time consuming and addicting its still a great buy. Im very satified with the game and the graphics considering its Early Access and large scale. It stead of me making a huge story I'll list the Pros and Cons.PROs Extremely easy to learn and play Firing and Health fetures are extremely accurate (Unlike many games based on this) Large scale map warfare Theres a gun in almost every house with loads of ammo (Unlike DayZ and H1Z1) Sound is very clear and accurate You can hear gun shots across the map (Im using Bose QuietComfort 35s) Vehicles Invite your friends to play squads of 1 2 and 4 Camping is too easy Roadside sheds make perfect top 10 hiding spots until the map swallows you of course There aren't no BS kills or deaths its LEGIT Using a Nvida 1080 theres no issues with lag quality or visiblityCONs Driving is buggy and 3rd person camera is too close (Feels like COD made vehicles or a worse Battlefield) Divers are impossible to shoot (20% is my aim) Your first five games you get a jump scare from the campers and snipers Such try hards griding pc... buy it on xboxRemember Its standard that the community is terrible on these massive multiple player games so you wont find anyone that will spare you. In conclusion I would recommend this game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I've been a large fan of the Battle Royale genre in all sorts of mediums including games shows films books etc. and upon first hearing about this game I was quite excited but it seems this is not "the one" we're looking for in the Battle Royale genre.Gameplay wise I find this too fast paced and too short. Games usually last 30 minutes and the circles constantly closing in speed it up moreso and ruin some of the fun for me. It feels like a nomal free for all with extra mechanics thrown in not really a battle royale. I'd expect them to last at least an hour or multiple for a really epic fun game. Playing by yourself is completely boring too it's only fun if you're playing in a squad with friends. If there's going to be solo play make sure it's fun if it isn't just don't add it. Outside of the gameplay this is doing everything wrong. There's microtransactions people getting banned for nonsense the release of the game has already been delayed (Early access survial game's release getting delayed? Haven't we heard this before?) updates are coming slower and the situation is evolving. PUBG thinks too highly of itself. It's just another temporarily popular EA survival game not something special. Another studio is going to eventually come and make a polished battle royale game possibly some AAA companies and no one will remember this.3/10
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game is SO clunky. There is no consistency with how it runs. You cant even mimimize it most of the time The client is trash. You can't reconnct to a game WHEN it crashes all too often. The servers are very far from being optimized and they were promised to be several months ago. Their servers struggle to populate items the first time you run through and there is so much server desync. The idea of the game is awesome and it is fun but i dont know if its worth the BS you have to wade through to play. They are making more money than all other games on steam (maybe more than any other game) right now and they still cant polish a game or deliver to their promises. I cant wait for someone else to create a much smoother and user friendly game like this so we can actually play it rather than deal with it. For the moment it looks like there will not be a polished release for a really long time with the rate they have been making updates. I dont reccomend getting this game unless you are a very patient person.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS
